Text

Title : The Enchanted April Author : [Elizabeth Von Arnim]52-elizabeth von arnim Release date : July 29 , 2005 [ eBook # 16389]Most recently updated : June 25 , 2023 Language : English Credits : [Manette Rothermel]1-manette rothermel

It began in [a Woman ’s Club in [London]3-london]2-a woman ’s club in london on a February afternoon — [an uncomfortable club]181-an uncomfortable club , and a miserable afternoon — when [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , who had come down from [Hampstead]4-hampstead to [shop]182-shop and had lunched at [[her]53-mrs. wilkins club]183-her club , took upThe Timesfrom the table in [the smoking - room]184-the smoking - room , and running [her]53-mrs. wilkins listless eye down [the Agony Column]185-the agony column saw this : To Those who Appreciate [Wistaria]5-wistaria and Sunshine . [Small mediaeval Italian Castle on [the shores of [the Mediterranean]6-the mediterranean]187-the shores of the mediterranean]186-small mediaeval italian castle on the shores of the mediterranean to be Let Furnished for [the month of April]188-the month of april . [Necessary servants]189-necessary servants remain . Z , Box 1000,The Times . That was its conception ; yet , as in the case of many another , [the conceiver]190-the conceiver was unaware of it at the moment . So entirely unaware was [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins that [her]53-mrs. wilkins April for that year had then and there been settled for [her]53-mrs. wilkins that [she]53-mrs. wilkins dropped the newspaper with a gesture that was both irritated and resigned , and went over to the window and stared drearily out at [the dripping street]191-the dripping street . Not for [her]53-mrs. wilkins were [mediaeval castles]192-mediaeval castles , even those that are specially described as small . Not for [her]53-mrs. wilkins [the shores in [April]91-april of [the Mediterranean]6-the mediterranean]193-the shores in april of the mediterranean , and the wistaria and sunshine . Such delights were only for [the rich]194-the rich . Yet the advertisement had been addressed to [persons who appreciate these things]195-persons who appreciate these things , so that it had been , anyhow , addressed too to [her]53-mrs. wilkins , for [she]53-mrs. wilkins certainly appreciated them ; more than [anybody]196-anybody knew ; more than [she]53-mrs. wilkins had ever told . But [she]53-mrs. wilkins was poor . In [the whole world]197-the whole world [she]53-mrs. wilkins possessed of [her]53-mrs. wilkins very own only ninety pounds , saved from year to year , put by carefully pound by pound , out of [her]53-mrs. wilkins dress allowance . [She]53-mrs. wilkins had scraped this sum together at the suggestion of [[her]53-mrs. wilkins husband]198-her husband as a shield and refuge against a rainy day . [Her]53-mrs. wilkins dress allowance , given [her]53-mrs. wilkins by [[her]53-mrs. wilkins father]199-her father , was £ 100 a year , so that [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ’s clothes were what [[her]53-mrs. wilkins husband]198-her husband , urging [her]53-mrs. wilkins to save , called modest and becoming , and [her]53-mrs. wilkins acquaintance to [each other]201-each other , when [they]202-they spoke of [her]53-mrs. wilkins at all , which was seldom for [she]53-mrs. wilkins was very negligible , called a perfect sight . [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , [a solicitor]203-a solicitor , encouraged thrift , except that branch of it which got into [his]54-mr. wilkins food . [He]54-mr. wilkins did not call that thrift , [he]54-mr. wilkins called it bad housekeeping . But for the thrift which , like moth , penetrated into [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ’s clothes and spoilt [them]204-them , [he]54-mr. wilkins had much praise . “ [You]53-mrs. wilkins never know , ”[54-mr. wilkins] [he]54-mr. wilkins said , “ when there will be a rainy day , and [you]53-mrs. wilkins may be very glad to find [you]53-mrs. wilkins have a nest - egg . Indeed [we]2584-we both may . ”[54-mr. wilkins] Looking out of [the club]205-the club window into [Shaftesbury Avenue]8-shaftesbury avenue — [hers]53-mrs. wilkins was [an economical club , but convenient for [Hampstead]4-hampstead , where [she]53-mrs. wilkins lived]206-an economical club , but convenient for hampstead , where she lived , and for [Shoolbred]55-shoolbred ’s , where [she]53-mrs. wilkins shopped — [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , having stood [there]207-there some time very drearily , [her]53-mrs. wilkins mind ’s eye on [the Mediterranean]6-the mediterranean in April , and [the wistaria]208-the wistaria , and the enviable opportunities of [the rich]194-the rich , while [her]53-mrs. wilkins bodily eye watched the really extremely horrible sooty rain falling steadily on the hurrying umbrellas and splashing omnibuses , suddenly wondered whether perhaps this was not the rainy day [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins — [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins was [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins — had so often encouraged [her]53-mrs. wilkins to prepare for , and whether to get out of such a climate and into [the small mediaeval castle]210-the small mediaeval castle was n’t perhaps what [Providence]56-providence had all along intended [her]53-mrs. wilkins to do with [her]53-mrs. wilkins savings . Part of [her]53-mrs. wilkins savings , of course ; perhaps quite a small part . [The castle]211-the castle , being mediaeval , might also be dilapidated , and dilapidations were surely cheap . [She]53-mrs. wilkins would n’t in the least mind a few of them , because [you]212-you did n’t pay for dilapidations which were already there ; on the contrary — by reducing the price [you]212-you had to pay [they]213-they really paid [you]212-you . But what nonsense to think of it . . . [She]53-mrs. wilkins turned away from the window with the same gesture of mingled irritation and resignation with which [she]53-mrs. wilkins had laid downThe Times , and crossed [the room]214-the room towards the door with the intention of getting [her]53-mrs. wilkins mackintosh and umbrella and fighting [her]53-mrs. wilkins way into one of the overcrowded omnibuses and going to [Shoolbred]55-shoolbred ’s on [her]53-mrs. wilkins way [home]215-home and buying some soles for [Mellersh]54-mr. wilkins ’s dinner — [Mellersh]54-mr. wilkins was difficult with fish and liked only soles , except salmon — when [she]53-mrs. wilkins beheld [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , [a woman [she]53-mrs. wilkins knew by sight as also living in [Hampstead]4-hampstead and belonging to [the club]205-the club]216-a woman she knew by sight as also living in hampstead and belonging to the club , sitting at the table in the middle of the room on which the newspapers and magazines were kept , absorbed , in [her]76-mrs. fisher turn , in the first page ofThe Times . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins had never yet spoken to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , who belonged to one of [the various church sets]218-the various church sets , and who analysed , classified , divided and registered [the poor]219-the poor ; whereas [she]53-mrs. wilkins and [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins , when [they]220-they did go out , went to the parties of [impressionist painters]221-impressionist painters , of whom in [Hampstead]4-hampstead there were [many]222-many . [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins had [a sister who had married one of [them]220-they and lived up on [the Heath]9-the heath]223-a sister who had married one of them and lived up on the heath , and because of this alliance [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins was drawn into a circle which was highly unnatural to [her]53-mrs. wilkins , and [she]53-mrs. wilkins had learned to dread pictures . [She]53-mrs. wilkins had to say things about [them]224-them , and [she]53-mrs. wilkins did n’t know what to say . [She]53-mrs. wilkins used to murmur , “ Marvellous , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] and feel that it was not enough . But [nobody]225-nobody minded . [Nobody]225-nobody listened . [Nobody]225-nobody took any notice of [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins . [She]53-mrs. wilkins was [the kind of person who is not noticed at parties]228-the kind of person who is not noticed at parties . [Her]53-mrs. wilkins clothes , infested by thrift , made [her]53-mrs. wilkins practically invisible ; [her]53-mrs. wilkins face was non - arresting ; [her]53-mrs. wilkins conversation was reluctant ; [she]53-mrs. wilkins was shy . And if [one]229-one ’s clothes and face and conversation are all negligible , thought [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , who recognised [her]53-mrs. wilkins disabilities , what , at parties , is there left of [one]229-one ? Also [she]53-mrs. wilkins was always with [Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , [that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air . [Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins was very respectable . [He]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air was known to be highly thought of by [[his]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air senior partners]232-his senior partners . [[His]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air sister]233-his sister ’s circle admired [him]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air . [He]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air pronounced adequately intelligent judgments on art and [artists]234-artists . [He]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air was pithy ; [he]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air was prudent ; [he]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air never said a word too much , nor , on the other hand , did [he]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air ever say a word too little . [He]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air produced the impression of keeping copies of everything [he]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air said ; and [he]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air was so obviously reliable that it often happened that [people who met [him]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air at these parties]235-people who met him at these parties became discontented with [[their]235-people who met him at these parties own solicitors]236-their own solicitors , and after a period of restlessness extricated [themselves]235-people who met him at these parties and went to [Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins . Naturally [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins was blotted out . “ [She]238-his wife , ”[233-his sister] said [[his]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air sister]233-his sister , with something [herself]233-his sister of the judicial , the digested , and the final in [her]233-his sister manner , “ should stay at [home]215-home . ”[233-his sister] But [Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins could not leave [[his]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air wife]238-his wife at [home]215-home . [He]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air was [a family solicitor]240-a family solicitor , and [all such]241-all such have [wives]242-wives and show [them]242-wives . With [his]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air in the week [he]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air went to parties , and with [his]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air on Sundays [he]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air went to [church]243-church . Being still fairly young — [he]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air was thirty - nine — and ambitious of [old ladies , of whom [he]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air had not yet acquired in [his]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air practice]244-old ladies , of whom he had not yet acquired in his practice a sufficient number , [he]231-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air could not afford to miss [church]243-church , and it was there that [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins became familiar , though never through words , with [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher . [She]53-mrs. wilkins saw [her]76-mrs. fisher marshalling [the children of [the poor]219-the poor]246-the children of the poor into [pews]248-pews . [She]76-mrs. fisher would come in at the head of the procession from [the Sunday School]249-the sunday school exactly five minutes before the choir , and get [[her]76-mrs. fisher boys]250-her boys and [girls]251-girls neatly fitted into [their]252-their allotted seats , and down on [their]252-their little knees in [their]252-their preliminary prayer , and up again on [their]252-their feet just as , to the swelling organ , the vestry door opened , and [the choir]253-the choir and [clergy]254-clergy , big with the litanies and commandments [they]252-their were presently to roll out , emerged . [She]76-mrs. fisher had a sad face , yet [she]76-mrs. fisher was evidently efficient . The combination used to make [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins wonder , for [she]53-mrs. wilkins had been told by [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins , on days when [she]53-mrs. wilkins had only been able to get plaice , that if [one were efficient one]255-one were efficient one would n’t be depressed , and that if [one]229-one does [one]229-one ’s job well one becomes automatically bright and brisk . About [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher there was nothing bright and brisk , though much in [her]76-mrs. fisher way with [the Sunday School children]258-the sunday school children that was automatic ; but when [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , turning from the window , caught sight of [her]76-mrs. fisher in [the club]205-the club [she]76-mrs. fisher was not being automatic at all , but was looking fixedly at one portion of the first page ofThe Times , holding the paper quite still , [her]76-mrs. fisher eyes not moving . [She]76-mrs. fisher was just staring ; and [her]76-mrs. fisher face , as usual , was the face of [a patient and disappointed Madonna]260-a patient and disappointed madonna . Obeying an impulse [she]53-mrs. wilkins wondered at even while obeying it , [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , the shy and the reluctant , instead of proceeding as [she]53-mrs. wilkins had intended to [the cloakroom]261-the cloakroom and from thence to Schoolbred ’s in search of [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins ’s fish , stopped at the table and sat down exactly opposite [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , to whom [she]53-mrs. wilkins had never yet spoken in [her]53-mrs. wilkins life . It was one of those long , narrow refectory tables , so that [they]262-they were quite close to each other . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , however , did not look up . [She]76-mrs. fisher continued to gaze , with eyes that seemed to be dreaming , at one spot only of The Times . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins watched [her]76-mrs. fisher a minute , trying to screw up courage to speak to [her]76-mrs. fisher . [She]53-mrs. wilkins wanted to ask [her]76-mrs. fisher if [she]76-mrs. fisher had seen the advertisement . [She]53-mrs. wilkins did not know why [she]53-mrs. wilkins wanted to ask [her]76-mrs. fisher this , but [she]53-mrs. wilkins wanted to . How stupid not to be able to speak to [her]76-mrs. fisher . [She]76-mrs. fisher looked so kind . [She]76-mrs. fisher looked so unhappy . Why could n’t [two unhappy people]263-two unhappy people refresh [each other]201-each other on [their]263-two unhappy people way through this dusty business of life by a little talk — real , natural talk , about what [they]263-two unhappy people felt , what [they]263-two unhappy people would have liked , what [they]263-two unhappy people still tried to hope ? And [she]53-mrs. wilkins could not help thinking that [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , too , was reading that very same advertisement . [Her]76-mrs. fisher eyes were on the very part of the paper . Was [she]76-mrs. fisher , too , picturing what it would be like — the colour , the fragrance , the light , the soft lapping of [the sea]265-the sea among [little hot rocks]266-little hot rocks ? Colour , fragrance , light , [sea]267-sea ; instead of [Shaftesbury Avenue]8-shaftesbury avenue , and the wet omnibuses , and [the fish department at [Shoolbred ’s]55-shoolbred]268-the fish department at shoolbred ’s , and the Tube to [Hampstead]4-hampstead , and dinner , and to - morrow the same and the day after the same and always the same . . . Suddenly [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins found [herself]53-mrs. wilkins leaning across the table . “ Are [you]76-mrs. fisher reading about [the mediaeval castle]2586-the mediaeval castle and [the wistaria]11-the wistaria ? ”[53-mrs. wilkins] [she]53-mrs. wilkins heard [herself]53-mrs. wilkins asking . Naturally [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher was surprised ; but [she]76-mrs. fisher was not half so much surprised as [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins was at [herself]53-mrs. wilkins for asking . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher had not yet to [her]76-mrs. fisher knowledge set eyes on [the shabby , lank , loosely - put - together figure sitting opposite [her]76-mrs. fisher , with [its]269-the shabby , lank , loosely - put - together figure sitting opposite her , with its small freckled face and big grey eyes almost disappearing under a smashed - down wet - weather hat small freckled face and big grey eyes almost disappearing under a smashed - down wet - weather hat]269-the shabby , lank , loosely - put - together figure sitting opposite her , with its small freckled face and big grey eyes almost disappearing under a smashed - down wet - weather hat , and [she]76-mrs. fisher gazed at [her]269-the shabby , lank , loosely - put - together figure sitting opposite her , with its small freckled face and big grey eyes almost disappearing under a smashed - down wet - weather hat a moment without answering . Shewasreading about [the mediaeval castle]2586-the mediaeval castle and [the wistaria]11-the wistaria , or rather had read about [it]271-it ten minutes before , and since then had been lost in dreams — of light , of colour , of fragrance , of the soft lapping of [the sea among little hot rocks]272-the sea among little hot rocks . . . “ Why do [you]53-mrs. wilkins ask [me]53-mrs. wilkins that ? ”[53-mrs. wilkins] [she]53-mrs. wilkins said in [her]53-mrs. wilkins grave voice , for [her]53-mrs. wilkins training of and by [the poor]219-the poor had made [her]53-mrs. wilkins grave and patient . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins flushed and looked excessively shy and frightened . “ Oh , only because [I]53-mrs. wilkins saw it too , and [I]53-mrs. wilkins thought perhaps — [I]53-mrs. wilkins thought somehow — ”[53-mrs. wilkins] [she]53-mrs. wilkins stammered . [Whereupon Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , [her]76-mrs. fisher mind being used to getting [people]274-people into lists and divisions , from habit considered , as [she]76-mrs. fisher gazed thoughtfully at [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , under what heading , supposing [she]76-mrs. fisher had to classify [her]53-mrs. wilkins , [she]76-mrs. fisher could most properly be put . “ And [I]53-mrs. wilkins know [you]53-mrs. wilkins by sight , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] went on [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , who , like [all the shy]275-all the shy , once [she]76-mrs. fisher was started plunged on , frightening [herself]76-mrs. fisher to more and more speech by the sheer sound of what [she]76-mrs. fisher had said last in [her]76-mrs. fisher ears . “ Every Sunday — [I]76-mrs. fisher see [you]53-mrs. wilkins every Sunday in [church]243-church — ”[76-mrs. fisher] “ In [church]243-church ? [She]76-mrs. fisher sat and looked uneasily at [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , feeling more and more the urgent need to getting [her]53-mrs. wilkins classified . Clearly [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins was unbalanced , but [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher had met the unbalanced before — indeed [she]76-mrs. fisher was always meeting [them]298-them — and [they]298-them had no effect on [her]76-mrs. fisher own stability at all ; whereas this one was making [her]76-mrs. fisher feel quite wobbly , quite as though to be off and away , away from [her]76-mrs. fisher compass points of [God]63-god , [Husband]299-husband , [Home]215-home and Duty — [she]76-mrs. fisher did n’t feel as if [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins intended [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins to come too — and just for once be happy , would be both good and desirable . Which of course it was n’t ; which certainly of course it was n’t . [She]53-mrs. wilkins , also , had a nest - egg , invested gradually in [the Post Office Savings Bank]301-the post office savings bank , but to suppose that [she]53-mrs. wilkins would ever forget [her]53-mrs. wilkins duty to the extent of drawing it out and spending it on [herself]53-mrs. wilkins was surely absurd . Surely [she]53-mrs. wilkins could n’t , [she]53-mrs. wilkins would n’t ever do such a thing ? Surely [she]53-mrs. wilkins would n’t , [she]53-mrs. wilkins could n’t ever forget [her]53-mrs. wilkins poor , forget misery and sickness as completely as that ? No doubt a trip to [Italy]13-italy would be extraordinarily delightful , but there were many delightful things one would like to do , and what was strength given to one for except to help one not to do them ? Steadfast as the points of the compass to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher were the great four facts of life : [God]63-god , [Husband]299-husband , [Home]215-home , Duty . [She]53-mrs. wilkins had gone to sleep on these facts years ago , after a period of much misery , [her]53-mrs. wilkins head resting on them as on a pillow ; and [she]53-mrs. wilkins had a great dread of being awakened out of so simple and untroublesome a condition . Therefore it was that [she]53-mrs. wilkins searched with earnestness for a heading under which to put [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , and in this way illumine and steady [her]53-mrs. wilkins own mind ; and sitting there looking at [her]53-mrs. wilkins uneasily after [her]53-mrs. wilkins last remark , and feeling [herself]53-mrs. wilkins becoming more and more unbalanced and infected , [she]53-mrs. wilkins decidedpro tem , as [the vicar]2605-the vicar said at meetings , to put [her]53-mrs. wilkins under the heading [Nerves]64-nerves . It was just possible that [she]53-mrs. wilkins ought to go straight into the category Hysteria , which was often only the antechamber to Lunacy , but [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher had learned not to hurry [people]274-people into [their]274-people final categories , having on more than one occasion discovered with dismay that [she]53-mrs. wilkins had made a mistake ; and how difficult it had been to get [them]306-them out again , and how crushed [she]53-mrs. wilkins had been with the most terrible remorse . Yes . [Nerves]64-nerves . Probably [she]53-mrs. wilkins had no regular work for [others]307-others , thought [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher ; no work that would take [her]53-mrs. wilkins outside [herself]53-mrs. wilkins . No ; such things did n’t make [people]274-people happy , such fleeting things . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher had learned in [her]76-mrs. fisher long life with [Frederick]65-frederick — [he]65-frederick was [[her]76-mrs. fisher husband]198-her husband , and [she]76-mrs. fisher had married [him]65-frederick at twenty and was now thirty - three — where alone true joys are to be found . For years [she]76-mrs. fisher had been able to be happy only by forgetting happiness . [She]76-mrs. fisher wanted to stay like that . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher became acutely uncomfortable and sympathetic . [She]76-mrs. fisher hoped [she]76-mrs. fisher was n’t going to cry . Not there . Of course [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher was not miserable — how could [she]76-mrs. fisher be , [she]76-mrs. fisher asked [herself]76-mrs. fisher , when [God]63-god was taking care of her?—but [she]76-mrs. fisher let that pass for the moment unrepudiated , because of [her]76-mrs. fisher conviction that here was [another fellow - creature in urgent need of [her]76-mrs. fisher help]323-another fellow - creature in urgent need of her help ; and not just boots and blankets and better sanitary arrangements this time , but the more delicate help of comprehension , of finding the exact right words . The exact right words , [she]76-mrs. fisher presently discovered , after trying various ones about living for [others]307-others , and prayer , and the peace to be found in placing [oneself]325-oneself unreservedly in [God]63-god ’s hands — to meet all these words [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins had other words , incoherent and yet , for the moment at least , till [one]229-one had had more time , difficult to answer — the exact right words were a suggestion that it would do no harm to answer the advertisement . Non - committal . Mere inquiry . And what disturbed [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher about this suggestion was that [she]76-mrs. fisher did not make it solely to comfort [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ; [she]76-mrs. fisher made it because of [her]76-mrs. fisher own strange longing for [the mediaeval castle]2586-the mediaeval castle . This was very disturbing . There [she]76-mrs. fisher was , accustomed to direct , to lead , to advise , to support — except [Frederick]65-frederick ; [she]76-mrs. fisher long since had learned to leave [Frederick]65-frederick to [God]63-god — being led [herself]76-mrs. fisher , being influenced and thrown off [her]76-mrs. fisher feet , by just an advertisement , by just [an incoherent stranger]328-an incoherent stranger . It was indeed disturbing . [She]76-mrs. fisher failed to understand [her]76-mrs. fisher sudden longing for what was , after all , self - indulgence , when for years no such desire had entered [her]76-mrs. fisher heart . “ There ’s no harm in simplyasking , ”[76-mrs. fisher] [she]76-mrs. fisher said in a low voice , as if [the vicar]2605-the vicar and [the Savings Bank]320-the savings bank and [all [her]76-mrs. fisher waiting and dependent poor]331-all her waiting and dependent poor were listening and condemning . “ It is n’t as if itcommittedus to anything , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , also in a low voice , but [her]53-mrs. wilkins voice shook . [They]332-they both felt that it was [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher who ought to write the letter and do the business part . Not only was [she]76-mrs. fisher used to organising and being practical , but [she]76-mrs. fisher also was older , and certainly calmer ; and [she]76-mrs. fisher [herself]76-mrs. fisher had no doubt too that [she]76-mrs. fisher was wiser . Incoherent , [she]76-mrs. fisher yet impelled . [She]76-mrs. fisher appeared to have , apart from [her]76-mrs. fisher need of help , an upsetting kind of character . [She]76-mrs. fisher had a curious infectiousness . [She]76-mrs. fisher led one on . And the way [her]76-mrs. fisher unsteady mind leaped at conclusions — wrong ones , of course ; witness the one that [she]76-mrs. fisher , [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , was miserable — the way [she]76-mrs. fisher leaped at conclusions was disconcerting . And then it could be the next nest - egg whose original corruption would be purged away by the use to which it was finally put . For [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , who had no money of [her]76-mrs. fisher own , was obliged to live on the proceeds of [Frederick]65-frederick ’s activities , and [her]76-mrs. fisher very nest - egg was the fruit , posthumously ripened , of ancient sin . The way [Frederick]65-frederick made [his]65-frederick living was one of the standing distresses of [her]76-mrs. fisher life . [He]65-frederick wrote immensely popular memoirs , regularly , every year , of [the mistresses of [kings]361-kings]360-the mistresses of kings . There were in history [numerous kings who had had [mistresses]363-mistresses , and there were still more numerous mistresses who had had [kings]361-kings]362-numerous kings who had had mistresses , and there were still more numerous mistresses who had had kings ; so that [he]65-frederick had been able to publish a book of memoirs during each year of [his]65-frederick married life , and even so there were great further piles of [these ladies waiting to be dealt with]365-these ladies waiting to be dealt with . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher was helpless . Whether [she]76-mrs. fisher liked it or not , [she]76-mrs. fisher was obliged to live on the proceeds . [He]65-frederick gave [her]76-mrs. fisher a dreadful sofa once , after the success of [his]65-frederick Du Barri memoir , with swollen cushions and soft , receptive lap , and it seemed to [her]76-mrs. fisher a miserable thing that there , in [[her]76-mrs. fisher very home]366-her very home , should flaunt this re - incarnation of [a dead old French sinner]367-a dead old french sinner . Simply good , convinced that morality is the basis of happiness , the fact that [she]76-mrs. fisher and [Frederick]65-frederick should draw [their]368-their sustenance from guilt , however much purged by the passage of centuries , was one of the secret reasons of [her]76-mrs. fisher sadness . [She]76-mrs. fisher had tried in days gone by to think the situation out , to discover the exact right course for [her]76-mrs. fisher to take , but had found it , as [she]76-mrs. fisher had found [Frederick]65-frederick , too difficult , and had left it , as [she]76-mrs. fisher had left [Frederick]65-frederick , to [God]63-god . Sometimes [he]65-frederick did not come back at all . Sometimes [she]238-his wife did not see [him]65-frederick for several days together . And [she]238-his wife was always gentle , and anxious that [his]65-frederick coffee should be as [he]65-frederick liked it . [He]65-frederick seemed very happy . Life , [she]238-his wife often thought , however much one tabulated was yet a mystery . There were always [some people]344-some people it was impossible to place . [Frederick]65-frederick was [one of [them]344-some people]401-one of them . [He]65-frederick did n’t seem to bear the remotest resemblance to [the original Frederick]65-frederick . [He]65-frederick did n’t seem to have the least need of any of the things [he]65-frederick used to say were so important and beautiful — love , [home]215-home , complete communion of thoughts , complete immersion in each other ’s interests . After those early painful attempts to hold [him]65-frederick up to the point from which [they]403-they had hand in hand so splendidly started , attempts in which [she]238-his wife [herself]238-his wife had got terribly hurt and the Frederick [she]238-his wife supposed [she]238-his wife had married was mangled out of recognition , [she]238-his wife hung [him]65-frederick up finally by [her]238-his wife bedside as the chief subject of [her]238-his wife prayers , and left [him]65-frederick , except for those , entirely to [God]63-god . [She]238-his wife had loved [Frederick]65-frederick too deeply to be able now to do anything but pray for [him]65-frederick . [He]65-frederick had no idea that [he]65-frederick never went out of [the house]404-the house without [her]238-his wife blessing going with [him]65-frederick too , hovering , like a little echo of finished love , round that once dear head . [She]238-his wife did n’t dare think of [him]65-frederick as [he]65-frederick used to be , as [he]65-frederick had seemed to [her]238-his wife to be in those marvellous first days of [their]405-their love - making , of [their]405-their marriage . [[Her]238-his wife child]406-her child had died ; [she]238-his wife had nothing , nobody of [her]238-his wife own to lavish [herself]238-his wife on . [The poor]219-the poor became [[her]238-his wife children]408-her children , and [God]63-god the object of [her]238-his wife love . What could be happier than such a life , [she]238-his wife sometimes asked [herself]238-his wife ; but [her]238-his wife face , and particularly [her]238-his wife eyes , continued sad . “ Perhaps when [we]2627-we ’re old . . . perhaps when [we]2627-we are both quite old . . . ”[238-his wife] [she]238-his wife would think wistfully .

[The owner of [the mediaeval castle]2586-the mediaeval castle]409-the owner of the mediaeval castle was [an Englishman]411-an englishman , [a Mr. Briggs]72-briggs , who was in [London]3-london at the moment and wrote that [it]2586-the mediaeval castle had beds enough for [eight people]412-eight people , exclusive of [servants]413-servants , [three sitting - rooms]414-three sitting - rooms , [battlements]415-battlements , [dungeons]416-dungeons , and electric light . The rent was £ 60 for the month , [the servants]417-the servants ’ wages were extra , and [he]409-the owner of the mediaeval castle wanted references — [he]409-the owner of the mediaeval castle wanted assurances that the second half of [his]409-the owner of the mediaeval castle rent would be paid , the first half being paid in advance , and [he]409-the owner of the mediaeval castle wanted assurances of respectability from [a solicitor]203-a solicitor , or [a doctor]419-a doctor , or [a clergyman]420-a clergyman . [He]409-the owner of the mediaeval castle was very polite in [his]409-the owner of the mediaeval castle letter , explaining that [his]409-the owner of the mediaeval castle desire for references was what was usual and should be regarded as a mere formality . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher and [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins had not thought of references , and [they]421-they had not dreamed a rent could be so high . In [their]421-they minds had floated sums like three guineas a week ; or less , seeing that [the place]422-the place was small and old . Sixty pounds for a single month . It staggered [them]421-they . Before [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher ’s eyes rose up boots : endless vistas , all the stout boots that sixty pounds would buy ; and besides the rent there would be [the servants]417-the servants ’ wagesc , and the food , and the railway journeys out and [home]215-home . While as for references , these did indeed seem a stumbling - block ; it did seem impossible to give any without making [their]421-they plan more public than [they]421-they had intended . [They]421-they had both — even [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , lured for once away from perfect candour by the realisation of the great saving of trouble and criticism an imperfect explanation would produce — [they]421-they had both thought it would be a good plan to give out , each to [her]76-mrs. fisher own circle , [their]421-they circles being luckily distinct , that each was going to stay with [a friend who had [a house in [Italy]13-italy]426-a house in italy]425-a friend who had a house in italy . It would be true as far as it went — [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins asserted that it would be quite true , but [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher thought it would n’t be quite — and it was the only way , [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins said , to keep [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins even approximately quiet . To spend any of [her]53-mrs. wilkins money just on the mere getting to [Italy]13-italy would cause [him]427-him indignation ; what [he]427-him would say if [he]427-him knew [she]53-mrs. wilkins was renting part of [a mediaeval castle]428-a mediaeval castle on [her]53-mrs. wilkins own account [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins preferred not to think . [I]53-mrs. wilkins expect [all husbands]2629-all husbands are alike in the long run . ”[53-mrs. wilkins] [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher said nothing , because [her]76-mrs. fisher reason for not wanting [Frederick]65-frederick to know was the exactly opposite one — [Frederick]65-frederick would be only too pleased for [her]76-mrs. fisher to go , [he]65-frederick would not mind it in the very least ; indeed , [he]65-frederick would hail such a manifestation of self - indulgence and worldliness with an amusement that would hurt , and urge [her]76-mrs. fisher to have a good time and not to hurry [home]215-home with a crushing detachment . Far better , [she]76-mrs. fisher thought , to be missed by [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins than to be sped by [Frederick]65-frederick . To be missed , to be needed , from whatever motive , was , [she]76-mrs. fisher thought , better than the complete loneliness of not being missed or needed at all . [She]76-mrs. fisher therefore said nothing , and allowed [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins to leap at [her]53-mrs. wilkins conclusions unchecked . But [they]430-they did , [both of [them]430-they]431-both of them , for a whole day feel that the only thing to be done was to renounce [the mediaeval castle]2586-the mediaeval castle ; and it was in arriving at this bitter decision that [they]430-they really realised how acute had been [their]430-they longing for it . Then [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher [, whose mind was trained in the finding of ways out of difficulties]433-, whose mind was trained in the finding of ways out of difficulties , found a way out of the reference difficulty ; and simultaneously [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins had a vision revealing to [her]53-mrs. wilkins how to reduce the rent . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher ’s plan was simple , and completely successful . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins was prepared to fling [her]53-mrs. wilkins entire egg into the adventure , but [she]53-mrs. wilkins realised that if it were to cost even sixpence over [her]53-mrs. wilkins ninety pounds [her]53-mrs. wilkins position would be terrible . Imagine going to [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins and saying , “ [I]53-mrs. wilkins owe . ”[53-mrs. wilkins] It would be awful enough if some day circumstances forced [her]53-mrs. wilkins to say , “ [I]53-mrs. wilkins have no nest - egg , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] but at least [she]53-mrs. wilkins would be supported in such a case by the knowledge that the egg had been [her]53-mrs. wilkins own . [She]53-mrs. wilkins therefore , though prepared to fling [her]53-mrs. wilkins last penny into the adventure , was not prepared to fling into it a single farthing that was not demonstrably [her]53-mrs. wilkins own ; and [she]53-mrs. wilkins felt that if [her]53-mrs. wilkins share of the rent was reduced to fifteen pounds only , [she]53-mrs. wilkins would have a safe margin for the other expenses . Also [they]451-they might economise very much on food — gather olives off [their]451-they own trees and eat them , for instance , and perhaps catch fish . Of course , as [they]451-they pointed out to [each other]201-each other , [they]451-they could reduce the rent to an almost negligible sum by increasing the number of [sharers]454-sharers ; [they]451-they could have [six more ladies]455-six more ladies instead of two if [they]451-they wanted to , seeing that there were eight beds . It had been arranged that [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher and [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , travelling together , should arrive at [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore on the evening of March 31st — [the owner]434-the owner , who told [them]530-them how to get [there]207-there , appreciated [their]530-them disinclination to begin [their]530-them time in [it]207-there on April 1st — and [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline and [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , as yet unacquainted and therefore under no obligations to bore [each other]201-each other on the journey , for only towards the end would [they]530-them find out by a process of sifting who [they]530-them were , were to arrive on the morning of April 2nd . There were disagreeable incidents towards the end of March , when [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , [her]53-mrs. wilkins heart in [her]53-mrs. wilkins mouth and [her]53-mrs. wilkins face a mixture of guilt , terror and determination , told [[her]53-mrs. wilkins husband]198-her husband that [she]53-mrs. wilkins had been invited to [Italy]13-italy , and [he]198-her husband declined to believe it . Of course [he]198-her husband declined to believe it . [Nobody]225-nobody had ever invited [[his]198-her husband wife]238-his wife to [Italy]13-italy before . There was no precedent . [He]198-her husband required proofs . The only proof was [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , and [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins had produced [her]53-mrs. wilkins ; but after what entreaties , what passionate persuading ! [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher had not imagined [she]76-mrs. fisher would have to face [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins and say things to [him]54-mr. wilkins that were short of the truth , and it brought home to [her]76-mrs. fisher what [she]76-mrs. fisher had for some time suspected , that [she]76-mrs. fisher was slipping more and more away from [God]63-god . Indeed , the whole of March was filled with unpleasant , anxious moments . It was an uneasy month . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher ’s conscience , made super - sensitive by years of pampering , could not reconcile what [she]76-mrs. fisher was doing with its own high standard of what was right . It gave [her]76-mrs. fisher little peace . It nudged [her]76-mrs. fisher at [her]76-mrs. fisher prayers . It punctuated [her]76-mrs. fisher entreaties for divine guidance with disconcerting questions , such as , “ Are [you]76-mrs. fisher not [a hypocrite]2654-a hypocrite ? Do [you]76-mrs. fisher really mean that ? Would [you]76-mrs. fisher not , frankly , be disappointed if that prayer were granted ? ”[76-mrs. fisher] The prolonged wet , raw weather was on the side too of [her]76-mrs. fisher conscience , producing far more sickness than usual among [the poor]219-the poor . [They]219-the poor had bronchitis ; [they]219-the poor had fevers ; there was no end to the distress . And here [she]76-mrs. fisher was going off , spending precious money on going off , simply and solely to be happy . [One woman]539-one woman . [One woman]539-one woman being happy , and [these piteous multitudes]541-these piteous multitudes . . . [She]76-mrs. fisher was unable to look [the vicar]2605-the vicar in the face . [He]2605-the vicar did not know , [nobody]225-nobody knew , what [she]76-mrs. fisher was going to do , and from the very beginning [she]76-mrs. fisher was unable to look [anybody]196-anybody in the face . [She]76-mrs. fisher excused [herself]76-mrs. fisher from making speeches appealing for money . Nor did it help [her]76-mrs. fisher or quiet [her]76-mrs. fisher that , having actually told [Frederick]65-frederick , in [her]76-mrs. fisher desire to make up for what [she]76-mrs. fisher was squandering , that [she]76-mrs. fisher would be grateful if [he]65-frederick would let [her]76-mrs. fisher have some money , [he]65-frederick instantly gave [her]76-mrs. fisher a cheque for £ 100 . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , on the contrary , had no doubts . [She]53-mrs. wilkins was quite certain that it was a most proper thing to have a holiday , and altogether right and beautiful to spend one ’s own hard - collected savings on being happy . “ Think how much nicer [we]2655-we shall be when [we]2655-we come back , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] [she]53-mrs. wilkins said to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , encouraging [that pale lady]547-that pale lady . Also things happen so awkwardly . It really is astonishing , how awkwardly they happen . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , who was very careful all this month to give [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins only the food [he]54-mr. wilkins liked , buying it and hovering over its cooking with a zeal more than common , succeeded so well that [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins was pleased ; definitely pleased ; so much pleased that [he]54-mr. wilkins began to think that [he]54-mr. wilkins might , after all , have married [the right wife]548-the right wife instead of , as [he]54-mr. wilkins had frequently suspected , [the wrong one]549-the wrong one . None came . The silence in [the room]214-the room , except for the hail hitting the windows and the gay roar of the fire , was complete . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins could not speak . [She]53-mrs. wilkins was dumbfounded . [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , who had not been abroad since before the war , and was noticing with increasing disgust , as week followed week of wind and rain , the peculiar persistent vileness of the weather , had slowly conceived a desire to get away from [England]16-england for Easter . [He]54-mr. wilkins was doing very well in [his]54-mr. wilkins business . [He]54-mr. wilkins could afford a trip . [Switzerland]23-switzerland was useless in April . [God]63-god sees none . ”[238-his wife] The remainder of [March]85-march was a confused bad dream .
