[Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , always silent about [him]65-frederick , had said nothing of this to [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins . [Frederick]65-frederick went too deep into [her]53-mrs. wilkins heart for [her]53-mrs. wilkins to talk about [him]65-frederick . [He]65-frederick was having an extra bout of work finishing another of those dreadful books , and had been away practically continually the last few weeks , and was away when [she]53-mrs. wilkins left . Why should [she]53-mrs. wilkins tell [him]65-frederick beforehand ? Sure as [she]53-mrs. wilkins so miserably was that [he]65-frederick would have no objection to anything [she]53-mrs. wilkins did , [she]53-mrs. wilkins merely wrote [him]65-frederick a note and put it on the hall - table ready for [him]65-frederick if and when [he]65-frederick should come [home]215-home . [She]53-mrs. wilkins said [she]53-mrs. wilkins was going for a month ’s holiday as [she]53-mrs. wilkins needed a rest and [she]53-mrs. wilkins had not had one for so long , and that [Gladys]87-gladys , [the efficient parlourmaid]574-the efficient parlourmaid , had orders to see to [his]65-frederick comforts . [She]53-mrs. wilkins did not say where [she]53-mrs. wilkins was going ; there was no reason why [she]53-mrs. wilkins should ; [he]65-frederick would not be interested , [he]65-frederick would not care . The day was wretched , blustering and wet ; the crossing was atrocious , and [they]575-they were very sick . But after having been very sick , just to arrive at [Calais]25-calais and not be sick was happiness , and it was there that the real splendour of what [they]575-they were doing first began to warm [their]575-they benumbed spirits . It got hold of [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins first , and spread from [her]53-mrs. wilkins like a rose - coloured flame over [[her]53-mrs. wilkins pale companion]576-her pale companion . [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins at [Calais]25-calais , where [they]575-they restored [themselves]575-they with soles because of [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ’s desire to eat a sole [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins was n’t having — [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins at [Calais]25-calais had already begun to dwindle and seem less important . [None of [the French porters]578-the french porters]577-none of the french porters knew [him]65-frederick ; [not a single official at [Calais]25-calais]579-not a single official at calais cared a fig for [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins . In [Paris]26-paris there was no time to think of [him]65-frederick because [[their]575-they train]580-their train was late and [they]575-they only just caught [the Turin train]581-the turin train at [the Gare de [Lyons]27-lyons]582-the gare de lyons ; and by the afternoon of the next day when [they]575-they got into [Italy]13-italy , [England]16-england , [Frederick]65-frederick , [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins , [the vicar]2605-the vicar , [the poor]219-the poor , [Hampstead]4-hampstead , [the club]205-the club , [Shoolbred]55-shoolbred , [everybody]2599-everybody and everything , the whole inflamed sore dreariness , had faded to the dimness of a dream .

It was cloudy in [Italy]13-italy , which surprised [them]575-they . [They]575-they had expected brilliant sunshine . But never mind : it was [Italy]13-italy , and the very clouds looked fat . Neither of [them]575-they had ever been [there]207-there before . [Both]566-both gazed out of the windows with rapt faces . The hours flew as long as it was daylight , and after that there was the excitement of getting nearer , getting quite near , getting [there]207-there . At [Genoa]28-genoa it had begun to rain — [Genoa]28-genoa ! Imagine actually being at [Genoa]28-genoa , seeing its name written up in [the station]526-the station just like any other name — at [Nervi]29-nervi it was pouring , and when at last towards midnight , for again [the train]528-the train was late , [they]575-they got to [Mezzago]30-mezzago , the rain was coming down in what seemed solid sheets . But it was [Italy]13-italy . Nothing it did could be bad . The very rain was different — straight rain , falling properly on to one ’s umbrella ; not that violently blowing English stuff that got in everywhere . And it did leave off ; and when it did , behold [the earth]592-the earth would be strewn with roses . [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs , [[San Salvatore]14-san salvatore ’s owner]593-san salvatore ’s owner , had said , “ [You]72-briggs get out at [Mezzago]30-mezzago , and then [you]72-briggs drive . ”[72-briggs] But [he]72-briggs had forgotten what [he]72-briggs amply knew , that trains in [Italy]13-italy are sometimes late , and [he]72-briggs had imagined [[his]72-briggs tenants]594-his tenants arriving at [Mezzago]30-mezzago at eight o’clock and finding a string of flys to choose from . [The train]528-the train was four hours late , and when [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher and [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins scrambled down the ladder - like high steps of [[their]575-they carriage]596-their carriage into the black downpour , [their]575-they skirts sweeping off great pools of sooty wet because [their]575-they hands were full of suit - cases , if it had not been for the vigilance of [Domenico]88-domenico , [the gardener at [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore]597-the gardener at san salvatore , [they]575-they would have found nothing for [them]575-they to drive in . [All ordinary flys]598-all ordinary flys had long since gone [home]215-home . [Domenico]88-domenico , foreseeing this , had sent [[his]88-domenico aunt]600-his aunt ’s fly , driven by [[her]600-his aunt son]601-her son [[his]88-domenico cousin]602-his cousin ; and [[his]88-domenico aunt]600-his aunt and [her]600-his aunt fly lived in [Castagneto]31-castagneto , [the village]604-the village crouching at the feet of [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore , and therefore , however late [the train]528-the train was , [the fly]606-the fly would not dare come [home]215-home without containing that which it had been sent to fetch . [[Domenico]88-domenico ’s cousin]608-domenico ’s cousin ’s name was [Beppo]89-beppo , and [he]89-beppo presently emerged out of the dark where [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher and [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins stood , uncertain what to do next after [the train]528-the train had gone on , for [they]610-they could see [no porter]611-no porter and [they]610-they thought from the feel of it that [they]610-they were standing not so much on [a platform]612-a platform as in the middle of the permanent way . [Beppo]89-beppo , who had been searching for [them]610-they , emerged from the dark with a kind of pounce and talked Italian to [them]610-they vociferously . [Beppo]89-beppo was [a most respectable young man]613-a most respectable young man , but [he]89-beppo did not look as if [he]89-beppo were , especially not in the dark , and [he]89-beppo had a dripping hat slouched over one eye . [They]610-they did not like the way [he]89-beppo seized [their]610-they suit - cases . [He]89-beppo could not be , [they]610-they thought , [a porter]614-a porter . However , [they]610-they presently from out of [his]89-beppo streaming talk discerned the words [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore , and after that [they]610-they kept on saying them to [him]89-beppo , for it was the only Italian [they]610-they knew , as [they]610-they hurried after [him]89-beppo , unwilling to lose sight of [their]610-they suit - cases , stumbling across rails and through puddles out to where in [the road]2644-the road [a small , high fly]616-a small , high fly stood . Its hood was up , and its horse was in an attitude of thought . [They]610-they climbed in , and the minute [they]610-they were in — [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , indeed , could hardly be called in — the horse awoke with a start from its reverie and immediately began going [home]215-home rapidly ; without [Beppo]89-beppo ; without the suit - cases . [Beppo]89-beppo darted after [him]89-beppo , making the night ring with [his]89-beppo shouts , and caught the hanging reins just in time . [He]89-beppo explained proudly , and as it seemed to [him]89-beppo with perfect clearness , that the horse always did that , being a fine animal full of corn and blood , and cared for by [him]89-beppo , [Beppo]89-beppo , as if [he]89-beppo were [[his]89-beppo own son]618-his own son , and [the ladies]619-the ladies must not be alarmed — [he]89-beppo had noticed [they]619-the ladies were clutching [each other]201-each other ; but clear , and loud , and profuse of words though [he]89-beppo was , [they]619-the ladies only looked at [him]89-beppo blankly . [He]89-beppo went on talking , however , while [he]89-beppo piled the suit - cases up round [them]619-the ladies , sure that sooner or later [they]619-the ladies must understand [him]89-beppo , especially as [he]89-beppo was careful to talk very loud and illustrate everything [he]89-beppo said with the simplest elucidatory gestures , but [they]619-the ladies both continued only to look at [him]89-beppo . [They]619-the ladies both , [he]89-beppo noticed sympathetically , had white faces , fatigued faces , and [they]619-the ladies both had big eyes , fatigued eyes . [They]619-the ladies were [beautiful ladies]621-beautiful ladies , [he]89-beppo thought , and [their]619-the ladies eyes , looking at [him]89-beppo over the tops of the suit - cases watching [his]89-beppo every movement — there were no trunks , only numbers of suit - cases — were like the eyes of [the Mother of [God]63-god]622-the mother of god . The only thing [the ladies]619-the ladies said , and [they]619-the ladies repeated it at regular intervals , even after [they]619-the ladies had started , gently prodding [him]89-beppo as [he]89-beppo sat on [his]89-beppo box to call [his]89-beppo attention to it , was , “ [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore ? ”[619-the ladies] And each time [he]89-beppo answered vociferously , encouragingly , “ Sì , sì — [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore . ”[89-beppo] “ [We]619-the ladies don’tknowof course if [he]89-beppo ’s taking [us]619-the ladies [there]207-there , ”[76-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher at last in a low voice , after [they]619-the ladies had been driving as it seemed to [them]619-the ladies a long while , and had got off the paving - stones of [the sleep - shrouded town]624-the sleep - shrouded town and were out on [a winding road]625-a winding road with what [they]619-the ladies could just see was a low wall on [their]619-the ladies left beyond which was a great black emptiness and the sound of [the sea]265-the sea . On [their]619-the ladies right was something close and steep and high and black — rocks , [they]619-the ladies whispered to [each other]201-each other ; huge rocks . “ No — [we]619-the ladies don’tknow , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] agreed [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , a slight coldness passing down [her]53-mrs. wilkins spine . [They]619-the ladies felt very uncomfortable . It was so late . It was so dark . [The road]2644-the road was so lonely . Suppose a wheel came off . Suppose [they]619-the ladies met [Fascisti]90-fascisti , or the opposite of [Fascisti]90-fascisti . How sorry [they]619-the ladies were now that [they]619-the ladies had not slept at [Genoa]28-genoa and come on the next morning in daylight . “ But that would have been the first of [April]91-april , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , in a low voice . “ It is that now , ”[76-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher beneath [her]76-mrs. fisher breath . “ So it is , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] murmured [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins . [They]619-the ladies were silent . [Beppo]89-beppo turned round on [his]89-beppo box — a disquieting habit already noticed , for surely [his]89-beppo horse ought to be carefully watched — and again addressed [them]619-the ladies with what [he]89-beppo was convinced was lucidity — nopatois , and the clearest explanatory movements . How much [they]619-the ladies wished [[their]619-the ladies mothers]629-their mothers had made [them]619-the ladies learn Italian when [they]619-the ladies were little . If only now [they]619-the ladies could have said , “ Please sit round the right way and look after the horse . ”[619-the ladies] [They]619-the ladies did not even know what horse was in [Italian]32-italian . It was contemptible to be so ignorant . In [their]619-the ladies anxiety , for [the road]2644-the road twisted round great jutting rocks , and on [their]619-the ladies left was only the low wall to keep [them]619-the ladies out of [the sea]265-the sea should anything happen , [they]619-the ladies too began to gesticulate , waving [their]619-the ladies hands at [Beppo]89-beppo , pointing ahead . [They]619-the ladies wanted [him]89-beppo to turn round again and face [his]89-beppo horse , that was all . [He]89-beppo thought [they]619-the ladies wanted [him]89-beppo to drive faster ; and there followed a terrifying ten minutes during which , as [he]89-beppo supposed , [he]89-beppo was gratifying [them]619-the ladies . [He]89-beppo was proud of [his]89-beppo horse , and it could go very fast . [He]89-beppo rose in [his]89-beppo seat , the whip cracked , the horse rushed forward , the rocks leaped towards [them]619-the ladies , the little fly swayed , the suit - cases heaved , [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher and [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins clung . In this way [they]619-the ladies continued , swaying , heaving , clattering , clinging , till at a point near [Castagneto]31-castagneto there was a rise in [the road]2644-the road , and on reaching the foot of the rise the horse , who knew every inch of the way , stopped suddenly , throwing everything in the fly into a heap , and then proceeded up at the slowest of walks . [Beppo]89-beppo twisted [himself]89-beppo round to receive [their]619-the ladies admiration , laughing with pride in [his]89-beppo horse . There was no answering laugh from [the beautiful ladies]633-the beautiful ladies . [Their]633-the beautiful ladies eyes , fixed on [him]89-beppo , seemed bigger than ever , and [their]633-the beautiful ladies faces against the black of the night showed milky . But here at least , once [they]619-the ladies were up [the slope]634-the slope , were [houses]635-houses . [The rocks]636-the rocks left off , and there were [houses]635-houses ; the low wall left off , and there were [houses]635-houses ; [the sea]265-the sea shrunk away , and the sound of it ceased , and the loneliness of [the road]2644-the road was finished . No lights anywhere , of course , [nobody]225-nobody to see [them]619-the ladies pass ; and yet [Beppo]89-beppo , when [the houses]642-the houses began , after looking over [his]89-beppo shoulder and shouting “ Castagneto ”[89-beppo] at [the ladies]619-the ladies , once more stood up and cracked [his]89-beppo whip and once more made [his]89-beppo horse dash forward . “ [We]644-they shall be [there]207-there in a minute , ”[76-mrs. fisher] [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher said to [herself]76-mrs. fisher , holding on . “ [We]644-they shall soon stop now , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins said to [herself]53-mrs. wilkins , holding on . [They]644-they said nothing aloud , because nothing would have been heard above the whip - cracking and the wheel - clattering and the boisterous inciting noises [Beppo]89-beppo was making at [his]89-beppo horse . Anxiously [they]644-they strained [their]644-they eyes for any sight of the beginning of [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore . [They]644-they had supposed and hoped that after a reasonable amount of [village]645-village a mediaeval archway would loom upon [them]644-they , and through it [they]644-they would drive into [a garden]646-a garden and draw up at an open , welcoming door , with light streaming from [it]647-it and [those servants standing in [it]647-it who , according to the advertisement , remained]648-those servants standing in it who , according to the advertisement , remained . Instead the fly suddenly stopped . Peering out [they]644-they could see [they]644-they were still in [the village street]649-the village street , with [small dark houses each side]650-small dark houses each side ; and [Beppo]89-beppo , throwing the reins over the horse ’s back as if completely confident this time that [he]89-beppo would not go any farther , got down off [his]89-beppo box . At the same moment , springing as it seemed out of nothing , [a man]651-a man and [several half - grown boys]652-several half - grown boys appeared on each side of the fly and began dragging out the suit - cases . “ No , no — [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore , [San Salvatore”—exclaimed[651-a man] Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , trying to hold on to what suit - cases [she]653-her could . “ Sì , sì — [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore , ”[644-they] [they]644-they all shouted , pulling . “ Thiscan’tbe [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , turning to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , who sat quite still watching [her]653-her suit - cases being taken from [her]653-her with the same patience [she]653-her applied to lesser evils . [She]53-mrs. wilkins knew [she]53-mrs. wilkins could do nothing if [these men]654-these men were [wicked men determined to have [her]653-her suit - cases]655-wicked men determined to have her suit - cases . “ [I]53-mrs. wilkins do n’t think it can be , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] [she]53-mrs. wilkins admitted , and could not refrain from a moment ’s wonder at the ways of [God]63-god . Had [she]53-mrs. wilkins really been brought [here]2640-here , [she]53-mrs. wilkins and poor [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , after so much trouble in arranging it , so much difficulty and worry , along such devious paths of prevarication and deceit , only to be — [She]53-mrs. wilkins checked [her]53-mrs. wilkins thoughts , and gently said to [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , while [the ragged youths]657-the ragged youths disappeared with the suit - cases into the night and [the man with the lantern]658-the man with the lantern helped [Beppo]89-beppo pull the rug off [her]653-her , that [they]659-they were both in [God]63-god ’s hands ; and for the first time on hearing this , [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins was afraid . There was nothing for it but to get out . Useless to try to go on sitting in the fly repeating [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore . Every time [they]659-they said it , and [their]659-they voices each time were fainter , [Beppo]89-beppo and [the other man]660-the other man merely echoed it in a series of loud shouts . If only [they]659-they had learned Italian when [they]659-they were little . If only [they]659-they could have said , “ [We]659-they wish to be driven to the door . ”[659-they] But [they]659-they did not even know what door was in Italian . Such ignorance was not only contemptible , it was , [they]659-they now saw , definitely dangerous . Useless , however , to lament it now . Useless to put off whatever it was that was going to happen to [them]659-they by trying to go on sitting in the fly . [They]659-they therefore got out . [The two men]661-the two men opened [their]661-the two men umbrellas for [them]659-they and handed them to [them]659-they . From this [they]659-they received a faint encouragement , because [they]659-they could not believe that if [these men]654-these men were wicked [they]659-they would pause to open umbrellas . [The man with the lantern]658-the man with the lantern then made signs to [them]659-they to follow [him]658-the man with the lantern , talking loud and quickly , and [Beppo]89-beppo , [they]659-they noticed , remained behind . Ought [they]659-they to pay [him]658-the man with the lantern ? Not , [they]659-they thought , if [they]659-they were going to be robbed and perhaps murdered . Surely on such an occasion [one]229-one did not pay . Besides , [he]658-the man with the lantern had not after all brought [them]659-they to [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore . Where [they]659-they had got to was evidently somewhere else . Also , [he]658-the man with the lantern did not show the least wish to be paid ; [he]658-the man with the lantern let [them]659-they go away into the night with no clamour at all . This , [they]659-they could not help thinking , was a bad sign . [He]658-the man with the lantern asked for nothing because presently [he]658-the man with the lantern was to get so much . [They]659-they came to some steps . [The road]2644-the road ended abruptly in [a church]666-a church and [some descending steps]667-some descending steps . [The man]668-the man held the lantern low for [them]659-they to see the steps . “ [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore ? ”[53-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins once again , very faintly , before committing [herself]53-mrs. wilkins to the steps . It was useless to mention it now , of course , but [she]53-mrs. wilkins could not go down steps in complete silence . [No mediaeval castle]669-no mediaeval castle , [she]53-mrs. wilkins was sure , was ever built at the bottom of steps . Again , however , came the echoing shout—“Sì , sì — [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore . ”[659-they] [They]659-they descended gingerly , holding up [their]659-they skirts just as if [they]659-they would be wanting [them]659-they another time and had not in all probability finished with skirts for ever . [The steps]670-the steps ended in [a steeply sloping path]671-a steeply sloping path with flat stone slabs down the middle . [They]659-they slipped a good deal on these wet slabs , and [the man with the lantern]658-the man with the lantern , talking loud and quickly , held them up . [His]668-the man way of holding [them]659-they up was polite . “ Perhaps , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins in a low voice to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , “ It is all right after all . ”[53-mrs. wilkins] “ [We]659-they ’re in [God]63-god ’s hands , ”[76-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher again ; and again [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins was afraid . [They]659-they reached the bottom of [the sloping path]673-the sloping path , and the light of the lantern flickered over [an open space with [houses round three sides]675-houses round three sides]674-an open space with houses round three sides . [The sea]265-the sea was the fourth side , lazily washing backwards and forwards on pebbles . “ [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore , ”[668-the man] said [the man]668-the man pointing with [his]668-the man lantern to a black mass curved round [the water]678-the water like an arm flung about it . [They]659-they strained [their]659-they eyes . [They]659-they saw the black mass , and on the top of it a light . “ [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore ? ”[659-they] [they]659-they both repeated incredulously , for where were the suit - cases , and why had [they]659-they been forced to get out of the fly ? “ Sì , sì — [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore . ”[659-they] [They]659-they went along what seemed to be [a quay]679-a quay , right on [the edge of the water]680-the edge of the water . There was not even a low wall here — nothing to prevent [the man with the lantern]658-the man with the lantern tipping [them]659-they in if [he]668-the man wanted to . [He]668-the man did not , however , tip [them]659-they in . Perhaps it was all right after all , [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins again suggested to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher on noticing this , who this time was [herself]76-mrs. fisher beginning to think that it might be , and said no more about [God]63-god ’s hands . The flicker of the lantern danced along , reflected in the wet pavement of [the quay]682-the quay . Out to the left , in the darkness and evidently at the end of [a jetty]683-a jetty , was a red light . [They]659-they came to an archway with a heavy iron gate . [The man with the lantern]658-the man with the lantern pushed the gate open . This time [they]659-they went up steps instead of down , and at the top of [them]659-they was a little path that wound upwards among flowers . [They]659-they could not see the flowers , but [the whole place]685-the whole place was evidently full of [them]686-them . It here dawned on [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins that perhaps the reason why the fly had not driven [them]659-they up to the door was that there was [no road]687-no road , only a footpath . That also would explain the disappearance of [the suit - cases]688-the suit - cases . [She]53-mrs. wilkins began to feel confident that [they]659-they would find [their]659-they suit - cases waiting for [them]659-they when [they]659-they got up to the top . [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore was , it seemed , on the top of [a hill]689-a hill , as [a mediaeval castle]428-a mediaeval castle should be . At a turn of [the path]691-the path [they]659-they saw above [them]659-they , much nearer now and shining more brightly , the light [they]659-they had seen from [the quay]682-the quay . [She]53-mrs. wilkins told [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher of [her]53-mrs. wilkins dawning belief , and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher agreed that it was very likely a true one . Once more , but this time in a tone of real hopefulness , [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins said , pointing upwards at the black outline against the only slightly less black sky , “ [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore ? ”[53-mrs. wilkins] And once more , but this time comfortingly , encouragingly , came back the assurance , “ Sì , sì — [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore . ”[659-they] [They]659-they crossed [a little bridge]693-a little bridge , over what was apparently [a ravine]694-a ravine , and then came a flat bit with long grass at the sides and more flowers . [They]659-they felt the grass flicking wet against [their]659-they stockings , and the invisible flowers were everywhere . Then up again through trees , along [a zigzag path]695-a zigzag path with the smell all the way of the flowers [they]659-they could not see . The warm rain was bringing out all the sweetness . Higher and higher [they]659-they went in this sweet darkness , and the red light on [the jetty]696-the jetty dropped farther and farther below [them]659-they . [The path]691-the path wound round to the other side of what appeared to be [a little peninsula]698-a little peninsula ; [the jetty]696-the jetty and the red light disappeared ; across the emptiness on [their]659-they left were distant lights . “ Mezzago , ”[668-the man] said [the man]668-the man , waving [his]668-the man lantern at the lights . “ Sì , sì , ”[659-they] [they]659-they answered , for [they]659-they had by now learned “ sì , sì ”[668-the man] . Upon which [the man]668-the man congratulated [them]659-they in a great flow of polite words , not one of which [they]659-they understood , on [their]659-they magnificent Italian ; for this was [Domenico]88-domenico , [the vigilant and accomplished gardener of [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore]702-the vigilant and accomplished gardener of san salvatore , [the prop and stay of the establishment]703-the prop and stay of the establishment , the resourceful , the gifted , [the eloquent]704-the eloquent , [the courteous]705-the courteous , [the intelligent Domenico]706-the intelligent domenico . Only [they]659-they did not know that yet ; and [he]88-domenico did in the dark , and even sometimes in the light , look , with [his]88-domenico knife - sharp swarthy features and swift , panther movements , very like [somebody wicked]707-somebody wicked . [They]659-they passed along another flat bit of path , with a black shape like a high wall towering above [them]659-they on [their]659-they right , and then [the path]691-the path went up again under trellises , and trailing sprays of scented things caught at them and shook raindrops on them , and the light of the lantern flickered over lilies , and then came a flight of ancient steps worn with centuries , and then another iron gate , and then [they]659-they were inside , though still climbing a twisting flight of stone steps with old walls on either side like the walls of [dungeons]416-dungeons , and with a vaulted roof . At the top was a wrought - iron door , and through it shone a flood of electric light . “ [Ecco]93-ecco , ”[88-domenico] said [Domenico]88-domenico , lithely running up the last few steps ahead and pushing the door open . And there [they]659-they were , arrived ; and it was [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore ; and [their]659-they suit - cases were waiting for [them]659-they ; and [they]659-they had not been murdered . [They]659-they looked at [each other]201-each other ’s white faces and blinking eyes very solemnly . It was a great , a wonderful moment . Here [they]659-they were , in [[their]659-they mediaeval castle]711-their mediaeval castle at last . [Their]659-they feet touched [its]711-their mediaeval castle stones . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins put [her]53-mrs. wilkins arm round [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher ’s neck and kissed [her]76-mrs. fisher . “ The first thing to happen in [this house]2661-this house , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] [she]53-mrs. wilkins said softly , solemnly , “ shall be a kiss . ”[53-mrs. wilkins] “ [Dear Lotty]94-lotty , ”[76-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher . “ [Dear Rose]95-rose , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , [her]53-mrs. wilkins eyes brimming with gladness . [Domenico]88-domenico was delighted . [He]88-domenico liked to see [beautiful ladies]621-beautiful ladies kiss . [He]88-domenico made [them]621-beautiful ladies a most appreciative speech of welcome , and [they]621-beautiful ladies stood arm in arm , holding [each other]201-each other up , for [they]621-beautiful ladies were very tired , blinking smilingly at [him]88-domenico , and not understanding a word .

When [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins woke next morning [she]53-mrs. wilkins lay in bed a few minutes before getting up and opening the shutters . What would [she]53-mrs. wilkins see out of [her]53-mrs. wilkins window ? A shining world , or a world of rain ? But it would be beautiful ; whatever it was would be beautiful . [She]53-mrs. wilkins was in [a little bedroom]714-a little bedroom with bare white walls and a stone floor and sparse old furniture . The beds — there were two — were made of iron , enamelled black and painted with bunches of gay flowers . [She]53-mrs. wilkins lay putting off the great moment of going to the window as [one]229-one puts off opening a precious letter , gloating over it . [She]53-mrs. wilkins had no idea what time it was ; [she]53-mrs. wilkins had forgotten to wind up [her]53-mrs. wilkins watch ever since , centuries ago , [she]53-mrs. wilkins last went to bed in [Hampstead]4-hampstead . No sounds were to be heard in [the house]404-the house , so [she]53-mrs. wilkins supposed it was very early , yet [she]53-mrs. wilkins felt as if [she]53-mrs. wilkins had slept a long while — so completely rested , so perfectly content . [She]53-mrs. wilkins lay with [her]53-mrs. wilkins arms clasped round [her]53-mrs. wilkins head thinking how happy [she]53-mrs. wilkins was , [her]53-mrs. wilkins lips curved upwards in a delighted smile . In bed by [herself]53-mrs. wilkins : adorable condition . [She]53-mrs. wilkins had not been in a bed without [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins once now for five whole years ; and the cool roominess of it , the freedom of [one]229-one ’s movements , the sense of recklessness , of audacity , in giving the blankets a pull if one wanted to , or twitching the pillows more comfortably ! It was like the discovery of an entirely new joy . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins longed to get up and open the shutters , but where [she]53-mrs. wilkins was was really so very delicious . [She]53-mrs. wilkins gave a sigh of contentment , and went on lying there looking round [her]53-mrs. wilkins , taking in everything in [[her]53-mrs. wilkins room]718-her room , [[her]53-mrs. wilkins own little room]719-her own little room , [her]53-mrs. wilkins very own to arrange just as [she]53-mrs. wilkins pleased for this one blessed month , [[her]53-mrs. wilkins room]718-her room bought with [her]53-mrs. wilkins own savings , the fruit of [her]53-mrs. wilkins careful denials , whose door [she]53-mrs. wilkins could bolt if [she]53-mrs. wilkins wanted to , and [nobody]225-nobody had the right to come in . It was such [a strange little room]722-a strange little room , so different from any [she]53-mrs. wilkins had known , and so sweet . [It]722-a strange little room was like [a cell]723-a cell . Except for the two beds , it suggested a happy austerity . “ And the name of [the chamber]2662-the chamber , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] [she]53-mrs. wilkins thought , quoting and smiling round at it , “ was Peace . ”[53-mrs. wilkins] Well , this was delicious , to lie there thinking how happy [she]53-mrs. wilkins was , but outside those shutters it was more delicious still . [She]53-mrs. wilkins jumped up , pulled on [her]53-mrs. wilkins slippers , for there was nothing on the stone floor but one small rug , ran to the window and threw open the shutters . “ Oh ! ”[53-mrs. wilkins] cried [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins . All the radiance of April in [Italy]13-italy lay gathered together at [her]53-mrs. wilkins feet . The sun poured in on [her]53-mrs. wilkins . [The sea]265-the sea lay asleep in [it]722-a strange little room , hardly stirring . Across [the bay]725-the bay [the lovely mountains]726-the lovely mountains , exquisitely different in colour , were asleep too in the light ; and underneath [her]53-mrs. wilkins window , at the bottom of the flower - starred grass slope from which the wall of [the castle]211-the castle rose up , was a great cypress , cutting through the delicate blues and violets and rose - colours of [the mountains]728-the mountains and [the sea]265-the sea like a great black sword . [She]53-mrs. wilkins stared . Such beauty ; and [she]53-mrs. wilkins there to see it . Such beauty ; and [she]53-mrs. wilkins alive to feel it . [Her]53-mrs. wilkins face was bathed in light . Lovely scents came up to the window and caressed [her]53-mrs. wilkins . A tiny breeze gently lifted [her]53-mrs. wilkins hair . Far out in [the bay]725-the bay a cluster of [almost motionless fishing boats]731-almost motionless fishing boats hovered like a flock of white birds on [the tranquil sea]732-the tranquil sea . How beautiful , how beautiful . Not to have died before this . . . to have been allowed to see , breathe , feel this . . . . [She]53-mrs. wilkins stared , [her]53-mrs. wilkins lips parted . Happy ? Poor , ordinary , everyday word . But what could [one]229-one say , how could one describe it ? It was as though [she]53-mrs. wilkins could hardly stay inside [herself]53-mrs. wilkins , it was as though [she]53-mrs. wilkins were too small to hold so much of joy , it was as though [she]53-mrs. wilkins were washed through with light . And how astonishing to feel this sheer bliss , for here [she]53-mrs. wilkins was , not doing and not going to do a single unselfish thing , not going to do a thing [she]53-mrs. wilkins did n’t want to do . According to [everybody]2599-everybody [she]53-mrs. wilkins had ever come across [she]53-mrs. wilkins ought at least to have twinges . [She]53-mrs. wilkins had not one twinge . Something was wrong somewhere . Wonderful that at [home]215-home [she]53-mrs. wilkins should have been so good , so terribly good , and merely felt tormented . Twinges of every sort had there been [her]53-mrs. wilkins portion ; aches , hurts , discouragements , and [she]53-mrs. wilkins the whole time being steadily unselfish . Now [she]53-mrs. wilkins had taken off all [her]53-mrs. wilkins goodness and left it behind [her]53-mrs. wilkins like a heap of rain - sodden clothes , and [she]53-mrs. wilkins only felt joy . [She]53-mrs. wilkins was naked of goodness , and was rejoicing in being naked . [She]53-mrs. wilkins was stripped , and exulting . And there , away in the dim mugginess of [Hampstead]4-hampstead , was [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins being angry . [She]53-mrs. wilkins tried to visualise [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins , [she]53-mrs. wilkins tried to see [him]736-him having breakfast and thinking bitter things about [her]53-mrs. wilkins ; and lo , [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins [himself]53-mrs. wilkins began to shimmer , became rose - colour , became delicate violet , became an enchanting blue , became formless , became iridescent . Actually [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins , after quivering a minute , was lost in light . “ Well , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] thought [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , staring , as it were , after [him]736-him . How extraordinary not to be able to visualise [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins ; and [she]53-mrs. wilkins who used to know every feature , every expression of [his]736-him by heart . [She]53-mrs. wilkins simply could not see [him]736-him as [he]736-him was . [She]53-mrs. wilkins could only see [him]736-him resolved into beauty , melted into harmony with everything else . [She]53-mrs. wilkins moved about with quick , purposeful steps , [her]53-mrs. wilkins long thin body held up straight , [her]53-mrs. wilkins small face , so much puckered at home with effort and fear , smoothed out . All [she]53-mrs. wilkins had been and done before this morning , all [she]53-mrs. wilkins had felt and worried about , was gone . There was nothing , [she]75-lady caroline saw at once , to be hoped for in the way of interest from [their]788-them clothes . [She]75-lady caroline did not consciously think this , for [she]75-lady caroline was having a violent reaction against beautiful clothes and the slavery [they]788-them impose on one , [her]75-lady caroline experience being that the instant one had got [them]788-them [they]788-them took one in hand and gave [one]229-one no peace till [they]788-them had been everywhere and been seen by [everybody]2599-everybody . [You]793-you did n’t take [your]793-you clothes to parties ; [they]788-them took [you]793-you . It was quite a mistake to think that [a woman]794-a woman , [a really well - dressed woman]795-a really well - dressed woman , wore out [her]794-a woman clothes ; it was the clothes that wore out [the woman]796-the woman — dragging [her]796-the woman about at all hours of the day and night . No wonder [men]797-men stayed young longer . Just new trousers could n’t excite [them]797-men . [She]75-lady caroline could n’t suppose that even the newest trousers ever behaved like that , taking the bit between [their]798-their teeth . [Her]75-lady caroline images were disorderly , but [she]75-lady caroline thought as [she]75-lady caroline chose , [she]75-lady caroline used what images [she]75-lady caroline liked . As [she]75-lady caroline got off the wall and came towards the window , it seemed a restful thing to know [she]75-lady caroline was going to spend an entire month with [people]274-people in dresses made as [she]75-lady caroline dimly remembered dresses used to be made five summers ago . “ [I]75-lady caroline got [here]2640-here yesterday morning , ”[75-lady caroline] [she]75-lady caroline said , looking up at [them]274-people and smiling . [She]75-lady caroline really was bewitching . [She]75-lady caroline had everything , even a dimple . “ It ’s a great pity , ”[76-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , smiling back , “ because [we]2668-we were going to choose [the nicest room for [you]75-lady caroline]2669-the nicest room for you . ”[76-mrs. fisher] “ Oh , but [I]75-lady caroline ’ve done that , ”[75-lady caroline] said [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline . “ At least , [I]75-lady caroline think it ’s the nicest . [She]75-lady caroline was not usually told this quite so immediately and roundly . Nothing bored [her]75-lady caroline so much as [people who insisted on being original]805-people who insisted on being original , who came and buttonholed [her]75-lady caroline and kept [her]75-lady caroline waiting while [they]805-people who insisted on being original were being original . What [she]75-lady caroline wanted of this holiday was complete escape from all [she]75-lady caroline had had before , [she]75-lady caroline wanted the rest of complete contrast . Perhaps [she]75-lady caroline had better be a little less encouraging . [They]804-these two had seemed such timid creatures , even [the dark one]808-the dark one — [she]75-lady caroline could n’t remember [their]804-these two names — that day at [the club]205-the club , that [she]75-lady caroline had felt it quite safe to be very friendly . Here [they]804-these two had come out of [their]804-these two shells ; already ; indeed , at once . There was no sign of timidity about either of [them]804-these two here . If [they]804-these two had got out of [their]804-these two shells so immediately , at the very first contact , unless [she]75-lady caroline checked [them]804-these two [they]804-these two would soon begin to press upon [her]75-lady caroline , and then good - bye to [her]75-lady caroline dream of thirty restful , silent days , lying unmolested in the sun , getting [her]75-lady caroline feathers smooth again , not being spoken to , not waited on , not grabbed at and monopolised , but just recovering from the fatigue , the deep and melancholy fatigue , of the too much . Besides , there was [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher . [She]76-mrs. fisher too must be checked . [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline had started two days earlier than had been arranged for two reasons : first , because [she]75-lady caroline wished to arrive before the others in order to pick out [the room]214-the room or [rooms]811-rooms [she]75-lady caroline preferred , and second , because [she]75-lady caroline judged it likely that otherwise [she]75-lady caroline would have to travel with [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher . [She]75-lady caroline did not want to travel with [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher . [She]75-lady caroline did not want to arrive with [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher . [She]75-lady caroline saw no reason whatever why for a single moment [she]75-lady caroline should have to have anything at all to do with [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher . As early as [Calais]25-calais [they]814-they began to suspect it ; in [Paris]26-paris [they]814-they feared it ; at [Modane]33-modane [they]814-they knew it ; at [Mezzago]30-mezzago [they]814-they concealed it , driving out to [Castagneto]31-castagneto in two separate flys , the nose of the one almost touching the back of the other the whole way . But when [the road]2644-the road suddenly left off at [the church]816-the church and the steps , further evasion was impossible ; and faced by this abrupt and difficult finish to [their]814-they journey there was nothing for it but to amalgamate . And so would [these two]804-these two up at the window . [She]76-mrs. fisher had better begin at once . [She]76-mrs. fisher was sorry [she]76-mrs. fisher had got off the wall . So [she]76-mrs. fisher ignored [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher ’s remark and raised forefinger , and said with marked coldness — at least , [she]76-mrs. fisher tried to make it sound marked — that [she]76-mrs. fisher supposed [they]804-these two would be going to breakfast , and that [she]76-mrs. fisher had had [hers]76-mrs. fisher ; but it was [her]76-mrs. fisher fate that however coldly [she]76-mrs. fisher sent forth [her]76-mrs. fisher words they came out sounding quite warm and agreeable . That was because [she]76-mrs. fisher had a sympathetic and delightful voice , due entirely to some special formation of [her]76-mrs. fisher throat and the roof of [her]76-mrs. fisher mouth , and having nothing whatever to do with what [she]76-mrs. fisher was feeling . [Nobody in consequence]833-nobody in consequence ever believed [they]804-these two were being snubbed . It was most tiresome . And if [she]76-mrs. fisher stared icily it did not look icy at all , because [her]76-mrs. fisher eyes , lovely to begin with , had the added loveliness of very long , soft , dark eyelashes . No icy stare could come out of eyes like that ; it got caught and lost in the soft eyelashes , and [the persons stared at merely]834-the persons stared at merely thought [they]834-the persons stared at merely were being regarded with a flattering and exquisite attentiveness . And if ever [she]76-mrs. fisher was out of humour or definitely cross — and who would not be sometimes in such a world?—she only looked so pathetic that [people]274-people all rushed to comfort [her]76-mrs. fisher , if possible by means of kissing . It was more than tiresome , it was maddening . [Nature]98-nature was determined that [she]76-mrs. fisher should look and sound angelic . [She]76-mrs. fisher could never be disagreeable or rude without being completely misunderstood . “ [I]76-mrs. fisher had [my]76-mrs. fisher breakfast in [[my]76-mrs. fisher room]2680-my room , ”[76-mrs. fisher] [she]76-mrs. fisher said , trying [her]76-mrs. fisher utmost to sound curt . “ Perhaps [I]76-mrs. fisher ’ll see [you]274-people later . ”[76-mrs. fisher] And [she]76-mrs. fisher nodded , and went back to where [she]76-mrs. fisher had been sitting on the wall , with the lilies being nice and cool round [her]76-mrs. fisher feet .

[Their]274-people eyes followed [her]76-mrs. fisher admiringly . [They]274-people had no idea [they]274-people had been snubbed . It was a disappointment , of course , to find [she]76-mrs. fisher had forestalled [them]274-people and that [they]274-people were not to have the happiness of preparing for [her]76-mrs. fisher , of watching [her]76-mrs. fisher face when [she]76-mrs. fisher arrived and first saw everything , but there was still [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher . [They]274-people would concentrate on [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , and would watch [her]76-mrs. fisher face instead ; only , like [everybody else]836-everybody else , [they]274-people would have preferred to watch [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline ’s . Perhaps , then , as [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline had talked of breakfast , [they]274-people had better begin by going and having it , for there was too much to be done that day to spend any more time gazing at the scenery — [servants]413-servants to be interviewed , [the house]404-the house to be gone through and examined , and finally [[Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ’s room]839-mrs. fisher ’s room to be got ready and adorned . [She]76-mrs. fisher therefore sat down in one , and [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins sat down opposite [her]76-mrs. fisher in the other . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher was at the head of the table . Round [her]76-mrs. fisher was grouped the coffee and the tea . Of course [they]848-they were all sharing [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore equally , but it was [she]76-mrs. fisher [herself]76-mrs. fisher and [Lotty]94-lotty , [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher mildly reflected , who had found it , who had had the work of getting it , who had chosen to admit [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher into it . Without [them]848-they , [she]76-mrs. fisher could not help thinking , [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher would not have been [there]207-there . [Morally Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher was [a guest]850-a guest . There was [no hostess in this party]851-no hostess in this party , but supposing there had been [a hostess]852-a hostess it would not have been [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , nor [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline , it would have been either [herself]76-mrs. fisher or [Lotty]94-lotty . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher could not help feeling this as [she]76-mrs. fisher sat down , and [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , the hand which [Ruskin]101-ruskin had wrung suspended over the pots before [her]76-mrs. fisher , inquired , “ Tea or coffee ? ”[76-mrs. fisher] [She]76-mrs. fisher could not help feeling it even more definitely when [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher touched a small gong on the table beside [her]76-mrs. fisher as though [she]76-mrs. fisher had been used to that gong and that table ever since [she]76-mrs. fisher was little , and , on [Francesca]99-francesca ’s appearing , bade [her]76-mrs. fisher in the language of [Dante]96-dante bring more milk . There was a curious air about [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , thought [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , of being in possession ; and if [she]76-mrs. fisher [herself]76-mrs. fisher had not been so happy [she]76-mrs. fisher would have perhaps minded . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins noticed it too , but it only made [her]53-mrs. wilkins discursive brain think of cuckoos . [She]53-mrs. wilkins would no doubt immediately have begun to talk of cuckoos , incoherently , unrestrainably and deplorably , if [she]53-mrs. wilkins had been in the condition of nerves and shyness [she]53-mrs. wilkins was in last time [she]53-mrs. wilkins saw [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher . But happiness had done away with shyness — [she]53-mrs. wilkins was very serene ; [she]53-mrs. wilkins could control [her]53-mrs. wilkins conversation ; [she]53-mrs. wilkins did not have , horrified , to listen to [herself]53-mrs. wilkins saying things [she]53-mrs. wilkins had no idea of saying when [she]53-mrs. wilkins began ; [she]53-mrs. wilkins was quite at [her]53-mrs. wilkins ease , and completely natural . The disappointment of not going to be able to prepare a welcome for [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher had evaporated at once , for it was impossible to go on being disappointed in [heaven]2604-heaven . Nor did [she]76-mrs. fisher mind [her]76-mrs. fisher behaving as [hostess]854-hostess . What did it matter ? [You]855-you did not mind things in [heaven]2604-heaven . [She]76-mrs. fisher and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , therefore , sat down more willingly than [they]857-they otherwise would have done , one on either side of [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , and the sun , pouring through the two windows facing east across [the bay]725-the bay , flooded [the room]214-the room , and there was an open door leading into [the garden]507-the garden , and [the garden]507-the garden was full of many lovely things , especially freesias . The delicate and delicious fragrance of the freesias came in through the door and floated round [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ’s enraptured nostrils . Freesias in [London]3-london were quite beyond [her]76-mrs. fisher . Occasionally [she]76-mrs. fisher went into [a shop]862-a shop and asked what they cost , so as just to have an excuse for lifting up a bunch and smelling them , well knowing that it was something awful like a shilling for about three flowers . Here they were everywhere — bursting out of every corner and carpeting the rose beds . Presently , when [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , unhampered by any duties , wandered out and down the worn stone steps and under [the pergola]909-the pergola into [the lower garden]910-the lower garden , [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins said to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , who seemed pensive , “ Do n’t [you]76-mrs. fisher see that if [somebody else]2707-somebody else does the ordering it frees [us]911-us ? ”[76-mrs. fisher] [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher said [she]76-mrs. fisher did see , but nevertheless [she]76-mrs. fisher thought it rather silly to have everything taken out of [their]911-us hands . “ [I]53-mrs. wilkins love things to be taken out of [my]53-mrs. wilkins hands , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins . “ But [we]911-us found [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore , ”[76-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , “ and it is rather silly that [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher should behave as if it belonged only to [her]76-mrs. fisher . ”[76-mrs. fisher] “ What is rather silly , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins with much serenity , “ is to mind . [I]53-mrs. wilkins ca n’t see the least point in being in authority at the price of one ’s liberty . ”[53-mrs. wilkins] [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher said nothing to that for two reasons — first , because [she]76-mrs. fisher was struck by the remarkable and growing calm of [the hitherto incoherent and excited Lotty]912-the hitherto incoherent and excited lotty , and secondly because what [she]76-mrs. fisher was looking at was so very beautiful . All down the stone steps on either side were periwinkles in full flower , and [she]76-mrs. fisher could now see what it was that had caught at [her]76-mrs. fisher the night before and brushed , wet and scented , across [her]76-mrs. fisher face . It was wistaria . [Wistaria]5-wistaria and sunshine . . . [she]76-mrs. fisher remembered the advertisement . Here indeed were both in profusion . The wistaria was tumbling over itself in its excess of life , its prodigality of flowering ; and where the pergola ended the sun blazed on scarlet geraniums , bushes of them , and nasturtiums in great heaps , and marigolds so brilliant that they seemed to be burning , and red and pink snapdragons , all outdoing each other in bright , fierce colour . The ground behind these flaming things dropped away in terraces to [the sea]265-the sea , [each terrace]914-each terrace [a little orchard]915-a little orchard , where among the olives grew vines on trellises , and fig - trees , and peach - trees , and cherry - trees . The cherry - trees and peach - trees were in blossom — lovely showers of white and deep rose - colour among the trembling delicacy of the olives ; the fig - leaves were just big enough to smell of figs , the vine - buds were only beginning to show . And beneath these trees were groups of blue and purple irises , and bushes of lavender , and grey , sharp cactuses , and the grass was thick with dandelions and daisies , and right down at the bottom was [the sea]265-the sea . Colour seemed flung down anyhow , anywhere ; every sort of colour , piled up in heaps , pouring along in [rivers]917-rivers — the periwinkles looked exactly as if they were being poured down each side of [the steps]670-the steps — and flowers that grow only in borders in [England]16-england , proud flowers keeping themselves to themselves over there , such as the great blue irises and the lavender , were being jostled by small , shining common things like dandelions and daisies and the white bells of the wild onion , and only seemed the better and the more exuberant for it . [They]919-they stood looking at [this crowd of loveliness]920-this crowd of loveliness , this happy jumble , in silence . No , it did n’t matter what [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher did ; not here ; not in such beauty . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher ’s discomposure melted out of [her]76-mrs. fisher . In the warmth and light of what [she]76-mrs. fisher was looking at , of what to [her]76-mrs. fisher was a manifestation , an entirely new side of [God]63-god , how could one be discomposed ? [She]75-lady caroline disliked jokes at all times , but in the morning [she]75-lady caroline hated them ; especially close up ; especially crowding in [her]75-lady caroline ears . This time [they]927-they both did notice that [they]927-they had been met with , at least , unresponsiveness . “ If [we]927-they were n’t in [heaven]2604-heaven , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins serenely , “ [I]53-mrs. wilkins should say [we]927-they had been snubbed , but as [nobody]225-nobody snubs [anybody]196-anybody there of course [we]927-they ca n’t have been . ”[53-mrs. wilkins] “ Perhaps [she]2718-she is unhappy , ”[76-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher . “ Whatever it is [she]2718-she is [she]2718-she ’ll get over it here , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins with conviction . “ [We]927-they must try and help [her]2718-she , ”[76-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher . “ Oh , but [nobody]225-nobody helps [anybody]196-anybody in [heaven]2604-heaven . [The vicar]2605-the vicar , [she]76-mrs. fisher knew , would have called [Lotty]94-lotty ’s talk levity , if not profanity . [They]938-they left [the path]691-the path , and clambered down [the olive terraces]940-the olive terraces , down and down , to where at the bottom [the warm , sleepy sea heaved gently among the rocks]941-the warm , sleepy sea heaved gently among the rocks . There a pine - tree grew close to [the water]678-the water , and [they]938-they sat under [it]678-the water , and a few yards away was a fishing - boat lying motionless and green - bellied on [the water]678-the water . The ripples of [the sea]265-the sea made little gurgling noises at [their]938-they feet . [They]938-they screwed up [their]938-they eyes to be able to look into the blaze of light beyond the shade of [their]938-they tree . The hot smell from the pine - needles and from the cushions of wild thyme that padded the spaces between [the rocks]636-the rocks , and sometimes a smell of pure honey from a clump of warm irises up behind them in the sun , puffed across [their]938-they faces . Very soon [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins took [her]53-mrs. wilkins shoes and stockings off , and let [her]53-mrs. wilkins feet hang in the water . After watching [her]53-mrs. wilkins a minute [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher did the same . [Their]938-they happiness was then complete . [[Their]938-they husbands]570-their husbands would not have known [them]938-they . [They]938-they left off talking . [They]938-they ceased to mention heaven . [They]938-they were just cups of acceptance . Meanwhile [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline , on [her]75-lady caroline wall , was considering [her]75-lady caroline position . [The garden on the top of the wall]947-the garden on the top of the wall was [a delicious garden]948-a delicious garden , but [its]947-the garden on the top of the wall situation made [it]947-the garden on the top of the wall insecure and exposed to interruptions . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher had the battlements , delightful with flowers , and [a watch - tower]952-a watch - tower all to [herself]76-mrs. fisher , besides having snatched [the one really nice room in [the house]404-the house]953-the one really nice room in the house . Why should not this one spot be kept exclusively for [her]76-mrs. fisher ? [She]76-mrs. fisher liked it ; [she]76-mrs. fisher liked it best of all . It had the Judas tree and an umbrella pine , [it]960-it had the freesias and the lilies , it had a tamarisk beginning to flush pink , it had the convenient low wall to sit on , [it]960-it had from each of [its]960-it three sides the most amazing views — to the east [the bay]725-the bay and mountains , to the north [the village]604-the village across [the tranquil clear green water of [the little harbour]964-the little harbour]963-the tranquil clear green water of the little harbour and [the hills]965-the hills dotted with [white houses and orange groves]966-white houses and orange groves , and to the west was the thin thread of land by which [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore was tied to [the mainland]967-the mainland , and then [the open sea]968-the open sea and [the coast line beyond]969-the coast line beyond [Genoa]28-genoa reaching away into [the blue dimness of [France]35-france]970-the blue dimness of france . Yes , [she]76-mrs. fisher would say [she]76-mrs. fisher wanted to have this entirely to [herself]76-mrs. fisher . [One]229-one had enough of that in [England]16-england , with [[one]229-one ’s relations]976-one ’s relations and [friends]2611-friends — oh , the numbers of them!—pressing on one continually . [She]76-mrs. fisher began to feel secure . [Those two]979-those two had gone for a walk . There was no sign of [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher . How very pleasant this was . [I]75-lady caroline give no more . ”[75-lady caroline] The idea that [she]106-costanza would go on giving orders was too absurd . [She]106-costanza never gave orders at [home]215-home . [Nobody]225-nobody there dreamed of asking [her]106-costanza to do anything . That such a very tiresome activity should be thrust upon [her]106-costanza here , simply because [she]106-costanza happened to be able to talk Italian , was ridiculous . Let [the originals]929-the originals give orders if [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher refused to . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , of course , was [the one Nature intended for such a purpose]1053-the one nature intended for such a purpose . [She]76-mrs. fisher had the very air of [a competent housekeeper]1054-a competent housekeeper . [Her]76-mrs. fisher clothes were the clothes of [a housekeeper]1055-a housekeeper , and so was the way [she]76-mrs. fisher did [her]76-mrs. fisher hair . Having delivered [herself]106-costanza of [her]106-costanza ultimatum with an acerbity that turned sweet on the way , and accompanied it by a peremptory gesture of dismissal that had the grace and loving - kindness of a benediction , it was annoying that [Costanza]106-costanza should only stand still with [her]106-costanza head on one side gazing at [her]106-costanza in obvious delight . “ Oh , goaway ! ”[75-lady caroline] exclaimed [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline in English , suddenly exasperated . There had been a fly in [[her]75-lady caroline bedroom]1056-her bedroom that morning which had stuck just as [Costanza]106-costanza was sticking ; only one , but it might have been [a myriad it was so tiresome from daylight on]1057-a myriad it was so tiresome from daylight on . It was determined to settle on [her]75-lady caroline face , and [she]75-lady caroline was determined it should not . Its persistence was uncanny . It woke [her]75-lady caroline , and would not let [her]75-lady caroline go to sleep again . [She]75-lady caroline hit at it , and it eluded [her]75-lady caroline without fuss or effort and with an almost visible blandness , and [she]75-lady caroline had only hit [herself]75-lady caroline . It came back again instantly , and with a loud buzz alighted on [her]75-lady caroline cheek . [She]75-lady caroline hit at it again and hurt [herself]75-lady caroline , while it skimmed gracefully away . [She]75-lady caroline lost [her]75-lady caroline temper , and sat up in bed and waited , watching to hit at it and kill [it]1058-it . [She]75-lady caroline kept on hitting at it at last with fury and with all [her]75-lady caroline strength , as if it were [a real enemy]1059-a real enemy deliberately trying to madden [her]75-lady caroline ; and it elegantly skimmed in and out of [her]75-lady caroline blows , not even angry , to be back again the next instant . [It]1058-it succeeded every time in getting on to [her]75-lady caroline face , and was quite indifferent how often it was driven away . That was why [she]75-lady caroline had dressed and come out so early . [Francesca]99-francesca had already been told to put a net over [her]99-francesca bed , for [she]99-francesca was not going to allow [herself]99-francesca to be annoyed twice like that . [People]274-people were exactly like flies . [She]75-lady caroline wished there were nets for keeping them off too . [She]75-lady caroline hit at [them]274-people with words and frowns , and like the fly they slipped between [her]75-lady caroline blows and were untouched . Worse than the fly , [they]274-people seemed unaware that [she]75-lady caroline had even tried to hit [them]274-people . The fly at least did for a moment go away . With [human beings]1061-human beings the only way to get rid of [them]274-people was to go away [herself]75-lady caroline . That was what , so tired , [she]75-lady caroline had done this April ; and having got [here]2640-here , having got close up to the details of life at [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore , it appeared that here , too , [she]75-lady caroline was not to be let alone . Viewed from [London]3-london there had seemed to be no details . [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore from there seemed to be an empty , a delicious blank . Yet , after only twenty - four hours of it , [she]75-lady caroline was discovering that it was not a blank at all , and that [she]75-lady caroline was having to ward off as actively as ever . Already [she]75-lady caroline had been much stuck to . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher had stuck nearly the whole of the day before , and this morning there had been no peace , not ten minutes uninterruptedly alone . [Costanza]106-costanza of course had finally to go because [she]106-costanza had to cook , but hardly had [she]106-costanza gone before [Domenico]88-domenico came . [He]88-domenico came to water and tie up . That was natural , since [he]88-domenico was [the gardener]2674-the gardener , but [he]88-domenico watered and tied up all the things that were nearest to [her]75-lady caroline ; [he]88-domenico hovered closer and closer ; [he]88-domenico watered to excess ; [he]88-domenico tied plants that were as straight and steady as arrows . Well , at least [he]88-domenico was [a man]651-a man , and therefore not quite so annoying , and [his]88-domenico smiling good - morning was received with an answering smile ; upon which [Domenico]88-domenico forgot [[his]88-domenico family]1065-his family , [[his]88-domenico wife]238-his wife , [[his]88-domenico mother]443-his mother , [[his]88-domenico grown - up children]1068-his grown - up children and all [his]88-domenico duties , and only wanted to kiss [the young lady]1022-the young lady ’s feet . [He]88-domenico could not do that , unfortunately , but [he]88-domenico could talk while [he]88-domenico worked , and talk [he]88-domenico did ; voluminously ; pouring out every kind of information , illustrating what [he]88-domenico said with gestures so lively that [he]88-domenico had to put down the watering - pot , and thus delay the end of the watering . [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline bore it for a time but presently was unable to bear it , and as [he]88-domenico would not go , and [she]75-lady caroline could not tell [him]88-domenico to , seeing that [he]88-domenico was engaged in [his]88-domenico proper work , once again it was [she]75-lady caroline who had to . [She]75-lady caroline got off the wall and moved to the other side of [the garden]507-the garden , where in [a wooden shed]1071-a wooden shed were some comfortable low cane chairs . All [she]75-lady caroline wanted was to turn one of these round with its back to [Domenico]88-domenico and its front to [the sea]265-the sea towards [Genoa]28-genoa . Such a little thing to want . [One]229-one would have thought [she]75-lady caroline might have been allowed to do that unmolested . But [he]88-domenico , who watched [her]75-lady caroline every movement , when [he]88-domenico saw [her]75-lady caroline approaching the chairs darted after [her]75-lady caroline and seized one and asked to be told where to put it . Would [she]75-lady caroline never get away from being waited on , being made comfortable , being asked where [she]75-lady caroline wanted things put , having to say thank [you]88-domenico ? [She]75-lady caroline was short with [Domenico]88-domenico , who instantly concluded the sun had given [her]75-lady caroline a headache , and ran in and fetched [her]75-lady caroline a sunshade and a cushion and a footstool , and was skilful , and was wonderful , and was one of [[Nature]98-nature ’s gentlemen]1074-nature ’s gentlemen . [She]75-lady caroline shut [her]75-lady caroline eyes in a heavy resignation . [She]75-lady caroline could not be unkind to [Domenico]88-domenico . [She]75-lady caroline could not get up and walk indoors as [she]75-lady caroline would have done if it had been [one of [the others]949-the others]1075-one of the others . [Domenico]88-domenico was intelligent and very competent . [She]75-lady caroline had at once discovered that it was [he]88-domenico who really ran [the house]404-the house , who really did everything . And [his]88-domenico manners were definitely delightful , and [he]88-domenico undoubtedly was [a charming person]1078-a charming person . It was only that [she]75-lady caroline did so much long to be let alone . If only , only [she]75-lady caroline could be left quite quiet for this one month , [she]75-lady caroline felt that [she]75-lady caroline might perhaps make something of [herself]75-lady caroline after all . [She]75-lady caroline kept [her]75-lady caroline eyes shut , because then [he]88-domenico would think [she]75-lady caroline wanted to sleep and would go away . [Domenico]88-domenico ’s romantic Italian soul melted within [him]88-domenico at the sight , for having [her]75-lady caroline eyes shut was extraordinarily becoming to [her]75-lady caroline . [He]88-domenico stood entranced , quite still , and [she]75-lady caroline thought [he]88-domenico had stolen away , so [she]75-lady caroline opened them again . No ; there [he]88-domenico was , staring at [her]75-lady caroline . Even [he]88-domenico . There was no getting away from being stared at . “ [I]75-lady caroline have a headache , ”[75-lady caroline] [she]75-lady caroline said , shutting them again . “ It is the sun , ”[88-domenico] said [Domenico]88-domenico , “ and sitting on the wall without a hat . ”[88-domenico] “ [I]75-lady caroline wish to sleep . ”[75-lady caroline] “ Sì signorina , ”[88-domenico] [he]88-domenico said sympathetically ; and went softly away . [She]75-lady caroline opened [her]75-lady caroline eyes with a sigh of relief . The gentle closing of the glass doors showed [her]75-lady caroline that [he]88-domenico had not only gone quite away but had shut [her]75-lady caroline out in [the garden]507-the garden so that [she]75-lady caroline should be undisturbed . Now perhaps [she]75-lady caroline would be alone till lunch - time . It was very curious , and [no one in [the world]398-the world]1080-no one in the world could have been more surprised than [she]75-lady caroline [herself]75-lady caroline , but [she]75-lady caroline wanted to think . [She]75-lady caroline had never wanted to do that before . Everything else that it is possible to do without too much inconvenience [she]75-lady caroline had either wanted to do or had done at one period or another of [her]75-lady caroline life , but not before had [she]75-lady caroline wanted to think . [She]75-lady caroline had come to [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore with the single intention of lying comatose for four weeks in the sun , somewhere where [[her]75-lady caroline parents]1082-her parents and [friends]2611-friends were not , lapped in forgetfulness , stirring [herself]75-lady caroline only to be fed , and [she]75-lady caroline had not been there more than a few hours when this strange new desire took hold of [her]75-lady caroline . There had been wonderful stars the evening before , and [she]75-lady caroline had gone out into [the top garden]1084-the top garden after dinner , leaving [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher alone over [her]76-mrs. fisher nuts and wine , and , sitting on the wall at the place where the lilies crowded their ghost heads , [she]75-lady caroline had looked out into the gulf of the night , and it had suddenly seemed as if [her]75-lady caroline life had been a noise all about nothing . [She]75-lady caroline had been intensely surprised . [She]75-lady caroline knew stars and darkness did produce unusual emotions because , in others , [she]75-lady caroline had seen them being produced , but [they]1085-they had not before done it in [herself]75-lady caroline . A noise all about nothing . Could [she]75-lady caroline be quite well ? [She]75-lady caroline had wondered . For a long while past [she]75-lady caroline had been aware that [her]75-lady caroline life was a noise , but it had seemed to be very much about something ; a noise , indeed , about so much that [she]75-lady caroline felt [she]75-lady caroline must get out of earshot for a little or [she]75-lady caroline would be completely , and perhaps permanently , deafened . But suppose it was only a noise about nothing ? [She]75-lady caroline had not had a question like that in [her]75-lady caroline mind before . It had made [her]75-lady caroline feel lonely . [She]75-lady caroline wanted to be alone , but not lonely . That was very different ; that was something that ached and hurt dreadfully right inside one . It was what [one]229-one dreaded most . It was what made [one]229-one go to so many parties ; and lately even the parties had seemed once or twice not to be a perfectly certain protection . Was it possible that loneliness had nothing to do with circumstances , but only with the way [one]229-one met [them]1089-them ? Perhaps , [she]75-lady caroline had thought , [she]75-lady caroline had better go to bed . [She]75-lady caroline could n’t be very well . [She]75-lady caroline went to bed ; and in the morning , after [she]75-lady caroline had escaped the fly and had [her]75-lady caroline breakfast and got out again into [the garden]507-the garden , there was this same feeling again , and in broad daylight . Once more [she]75-lady caroline had that really rather disgusting suspicion that [her]75-lady caroline life till now had not only been loud but empty . Well , if that were so , and if [her]75-lady caroline first twenty - eight years — [the best ones]1091-the best ones — had gone just in meaningless noise , [she]75-lady caroline had better stop a moment and look round [her]75-lady caroline ; pause , as [they]1092-they said in tiresome novels , and consider . [She]75-lady caroline had n’t got many sets of twenty - eight years . [One more]1093-one more would see [her]75-lady caroline growing very like [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher . Two more — [She]75-lady caroline averted [her]75-lady caroline eyes . [[Her]75-lady caroline mother]1020-her mother would have been concerned if [she]1020-her mother had known . [[Her]75-lady caroline mother]1020-her mother doted . [[Her]75-lady caroline father]199-her father would have been concerned too , for [he]199-her father also doted . [Everybody]2599-everybody doted . And when , melodiously obstinate , [she]75-lady caroline had insisted on going off to entomb [herself]75-lady caroline in [Italy]13-italy for a whole month with [queer people [she]75-lady caroline had got out of an advertisement , refusing even to take [[her]75-lady caroline maid]1099-her maid]1098-queer people she had got out of an advertisement , refusing even to take her maid , the only explanation [[her]75-lady caroline friends]481-her friends could imagine was that poor [Scrap]108-scrap — such was [her]108-scrap name among [them]481-her friends — had overdone it and was feeling a little nervy . [[Her]75-lady caroline mother]1020-her mother had been distressed at [her]75-lady caroline departure . It was such an odd thing to do , such a sign of disappointment . [She]1020-her mother encouraged the general idea of the verge of a nervous breakdown . If [she]1020-her mother could have seen [her]1020-her mother adored [Scrap]108-scrap , more delightful to look upon than [[any other mother]1102-any other mother ’s daughter]1103-any other mother ’s daughter had ever yet been , the object of [her]1020-her mother utmost pride , the source of all [her]1020-her mother fondest hopes , sitting staring at the empty noonday Mediterranean considering [her]1020-her mother three possible sets of twenty - eight years , [she]1020-her mother would have been miserable . To go away alone was bad ; to think was worse . No good could come out of the thinking of [a beautiful young woman]1104-a beautiful young woman . [Complications]109-complications could come out of it in profusion , but no good . The thinking of [the beautiful]1105-the beautiful was bound to result in hesitations , in reluctances , in unhappiness all round . And here , if [she]1020-her mother could have seen [her]1104-a beautiful young woman , sat [her]75-lady caroline Scrap thinking quite hard . And such things . Such old things . Things [nobody]225-nobody ever began to think till [they]225-nobody were at least forty .

That [one of [the two sitting - rooms which [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher had taken for [her]76-mrs. fisher own]1108-the two sitting - rooms which mrs. fisher had taken for her own]1107-one of the two sitting - rooms which mrs. fisher had taken for her own was [a room of charm and character]1109-a room of charm and character . [Those friends of [hers]76-mrs. fisher in [London]3-london]1134-those friends of hers in london , [solid persons of [her]76-mrs. fisher own age]1135-solid persons of her own age , knew the same past that [she]76-mrs. fisher knew , could talk about it with [her]76-mrs. fisher , could compare it as [she]76-mrs. fisher did with the tinkling present , and in remembering [great men]1136-great men forget for a moment [the trivial and barren young people who still , in spite of the war]1137-the trivial and barren young people who still , in spite of the war , seemed to litter [the world]398-the world in such numbers .
