The uneventful days — only outwardly uneventful — slipped by in floods of sunshine , and [the servants]417-the servants , watching [the four ladies]1188-the four ladies , came to the conclusion there was very little life in [them]417-the servants . To [the servants]417-the servants [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore seemed asleep . [No one]308-no one came to tea , nor did [the ladies]619-the ladies go anywhere to tea . [Other tenants in [other springs]1518-other springs]1517-other tenants in other springs had been far more active . There had been stir and enterprise ; [the boat]1519-the boat had been used ; excursions had been made ; [Beppo]89-beppo ’s fly was ordered ; [people from [Mezzago]30-mezzago]1520-people from mezzago came over and spent the day ; [the house]404-the house rang with voices ; even sometimes champagne had been drunk . Life was varied , life was interesting . But this ? What was this ? [The servants]417-the servants were not even scolded . [They]417-the servants were left completely to [themselves]417-the servants . [They]417-the servants yawned . Perplexing , too , was the entire absence of [gentlemen]1038-gentlemen . How could [gentlemen]1038-gentlemen keep away from so much beauty ? For , added up , and even after the subtraction of [the old one]2727-the old one , [the three younger ladies]1526-the three younger ladies produced a formidable total of that which [gentlemen]1038-gentlemen usually sought . Also the evident desire of [each lady]1528-each lady to spend long hours separated from [the other ladies]2725-the other ladies puzzled [the servants]417-the servants . The result was a deathly stillness in [the house]404-the house , except at meal - times . [It]404-the house might have been as empty as it had been all the winter , for any sounds of life there were . [The old lady]1532-the old lady sat in [[her]1532-the old lady room]718-her room , alone ; [the dark - eyed lady]1534-the dark - eyed lady wandered off alone , loitering , so [Domenico]88-domenico told [them]417-the servants , who sometimes came across [her]1534-the dark - eyed lady in the course of [his]88-domenico duties , incomprehensibly among [the rocks]636-the rocks ; [the very beautiful fair lady]1536-the very beautiful fair lady lay in [her]1536-the very beautiful fair lady low chair in [the top garden]1084-the top garden , alone ; [the less , but still beautiful fair lady]1538-the less , but still beautiful fair lady went up [the hills]965-the hills and stayed up them for hours , alone ; and every day the sun blazed slowly round [the house]404-the house , and disappeared at evening into [the sea]265-the sea , and nothing at all had happened . [The servants]417-the servants yawned . Yet [the four visitors]1543-the four visitors , while [their]1543-the four visitors bodies sat — that was [Mrs. Fisher’s]136-mrs. fisher’s — or lay — that was [Lady Caroline’s]137-lady caroline’s — or loitered — that was [Mrs. Arbuthnot’s]138-mrs. arbuthnot’s — or went in solitude up into [the hills]965-the hills — that was [Mrs. Wilkins’s]139-mrs. wilkins’s — were anything but torpid really . [Their]1543-the four visitors minds were unusually busy . Even at night [their]1543-the four visitors minds were busy , and the dreams [they]1543-the four visitors had were clear , thin , quick things , entirely different from the heavy dreams of [home]215-home . There was that in the atmosphere of [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore which produced active - mindedness in all except [the natives]1546-the natives . [They]1543-the four visitors , as before , whatever the beauty around [them]1543-the four visitors , whatever the prodigal seasons did , remained immune from thoughts other than those [they]1543-the four visitors were accustomed to . All [their]1543-the four visitors lives [they]1543-the four visitors had seen , year by year , the amazing recurrent spectacle of [April]91-april in [the gardens]1547-the gardens , and custom had made it invisible to [them]1543-the four visitors . [They]1543-the four visitors were as blind to it , as unconscious of it , as [Domenico]88-domenico ’s dog asleep in the sun . [The visitors]1548-the visitors could not be blind to it — it was too arresting after [London]3-london in [a particularly wet and gloomy March]1549-a particularly wet and gloomy march . Suddenly to be transported to [that place where the air was so still that it held its breath , where the light was so golden that the most ordinary things]1550-that place where the air was so still that it held its breath , where the light was so golden that the most ordinary things were transfigured — to be transported into that delicate warmth , that caressing fragrance , and to have [the old grey castle]1551-the old grey castle as the setting , and , in the distance , the serene clear hills of [[Perugini]140-perugini ’s backgrounds]1552-perugini ’s backgrounds , was an astonishing contrast . Even [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline , used all [her]75-lady caroline life to beauty , who had been everywhere and seen everything , felt the surprise of it . It was , that year , a particularly wonderful spring , and of all the months at [San Salvatore April]41-san salvatore april , if the weather was fine , was best . May scorched and withered ; [March]85-march was restless , and could be hard and cold in its brightness ; but [April]91-april came along softly like a blessing , and if it were a fine [April]91-april it was so beautiful that it was impossible not to feel different , not to feel stirred and touched . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , [we]1553-we have seen , responded to it instantly . [She]53-mrs. wilkins , so to speak , at once flung off all [her]53-mrs. wilkins garments and dived straight into glory , unhesitatingly , with a cry of rapture . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher was stirred and touched , but differently . [She]53-mrs. wilkins had odd sensations — presently to be described . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , being old , was of a closer , more impermeable texture , and offered more resistance ; but [she]53-mrs. wilkins too had odd sensations , also in [their]1554-their place to be described . [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline , already amply acquainted with [beautiful houses]1555-beautiful houses and climates , to whom [they]1554-their could not come quite with the same surprise , yet was very nearly as quick to react as [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins . [The place]422-the place had an almost instantaneous influence on [her]75-lady caroline as well , and of one part of this influence [she]75-lady caroline was aware : it had made [her]75-lady caroline , beginning on the very first evening , want to think , and acted on [her]75-lady caroline curiously like a conscience . What this conscience seemed to press upon [her]75-lady caroline notice with an insistence that startled [her]75-lady caroline — [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline hesitated to accept the word , but it would keep on coming into [her]75-lady caroline head — was that [she]75-lady caroline was tawdry . Tawdry . [She]75-lady caroline . [Fancy]141-fancy . [She]75-lady caroline must think that out . The morning after the first dinner together , [she]75-lady caroline woke up in a condition of regret that [she]75-lady caroline should have been so talkative to [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins the night before . What had made [her]75-lady caroline be , [she]75-lady caroline wondered . Now , of course , [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins would want to grab , [she]53-mrs. wilkins would want to be inseparable ; and the thought of a grabbing and an inseparableness that should last four weeks made [Scrap]108-scrap ’s spirit swoon within [her]75-lady caroline . No doubt [the encouraged Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins would be lurking in [the top garden]1084-the top garden waiting to waylay [her]75-lady caroline when [she]75-lady caroline went out , and would hail [her]75-lady caroline with morning cheerfulness . How much [she]75-lady caroline hated being hailed with morning cheerfulness — or indeed , hailed at all . [She]75-lady caroline ought n’t to have encouraged [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins the night before . Fatal to encourage . It was bad enough not to encourage , for just sitting there and saying nothing seemed usually to involve [her]75-lady caroline , but actively to encourage was suicidal . What on earth had made [her]75-lady caroline ? Now [she]75-lady caroline would have to waste all the precious time , the precious , lovely time for thinking in , for getting square with [herself]75-lady caroline , in shaking [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins off . With great caution and on the tips of [her]75-lady caroline toes , balancing [herself]75-lady caroline carefully lest the pebbles should scrunch , [she]75-lady caroline stole out when [she]75-lady caroline was dressed to [her]75-lady caroline corner ; but [the garden]507-the garden was empty . No shaking off was necessary . Neither [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins nor [anybody else]1559-anybody else was to be seen . [She]75-lady caroline had it entirely to [herself]75-lady caroline . Except for [Domenico]88-domenico , who presently came and hovered , watering [his]88-domenico plants , again especially all the plants that were nearest [her]75-lady caroline , [no one]308-no one came out at all ; and when , after a long while of following up thoughts which seemed to escape [her]75-lady caroline just as [she]75-lady caroline had got them , and dropping off exhausted to sleep in the intervals of this chase , [she]75-lady caroline felt hungry and looked at [her]75-lady caroline watch and saw that it was past three , [she]75-lady caroline realised that [nobody]225-nobody had even bothered to call [her]75-lady caroline in to lunch . So that , [Scrap]108-scrap could not but remark , if [any one]2617-any one was shaken off it was [she]75-lady caroline [herself]75-lady caroline . Well , but how delightful , and how very new . Now [she]75-lady caroline would really be able to think , uninterruptedly . Delicious to be forgotten . Still , [she]75-lady caroline was hungry ; and [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , after that excessive friendliness the night before , might at least have told [her]75-lady caroline lunch was ready . And [she]75-lady caroline had really been excessively friendly — so nice about [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins ’s sleeping arrangements , wanting [him]88-domenico to have [the spare - room]1563-the spare - room and all . [She]75-lady caroline was n’t usually interested in arrangements , in fact [she]75-lady caroline was n’t ever interested in them ; so that [Scrap]108-scrap considered [she]108-scrap might be said almost to have gone out of [her]108-scrap way to be agreeable to [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins . And , in return , [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins did n’t even bother whether or not [she]75-lady caroline had any lunch . Fortunately , though [she]75-lady caroline was hungry , [she]75-lady caroline did n’t mind missing a meal . Life was full of meals . [They]1564-they took up an enormous proportion of [one]229-one ’s time ; and [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher was , [she]75-lady caroline was afraid , one of [those persons who at meals]1566-those persons who at meals linger . Twice now had [she]75-lady caroline dined with [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , and each time [she]75-lady caroline had been difficult at the end to dislodge , lingering on slowly cracking innumerable nuts and slowly drinking a glass of wine that seemed as if it would never be finished . Probably it would be a good thing to make a habit of missing lunch , and as it was quite easy to have tea brought out to [her]75-lady caroline , and as [she]75-lady caroline breakfasted in [[her]75-lady caroline room]718-her room , only once a day would [she]75-lady caroline have to sit at the dining - room table and endure the nuts . [Scrap]108-scrap burrowed [her]108-scrap head comfortably in the cushions , and with [her]108-scrap feet crossed on the low parapet gave [herself]108-scrap up to more thought . [She]108-scrap said to [herself]108-scrap , as [she]108-scrap had said at intervals throughout the morning : Now [I]0-i ’m going to think . But , never having thought out anything in [her]108-scrap life , it was difficult . Extraordinary how [one]229-one ’s attention would n’t stay fixed ; extraordinary how [one]229-one ’s mind slipped sideways . Settling [herself]108-scrap down to a review of [her]108-scrap past as a preliminary to the consideration of [her]108-scrap future , and hunting in it to begin with for any justification of that distressing word tawdry , the next thing [she]108-scrap knew was that [she]108-scrap was n’t thinking about this at all , but had somehow switched on to [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins . Well , [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins was quite easy to think about , though not pleasant . [She]108-scrap viewed [his]54-mr. wilkins approach with misgivings . For not only was it a profound and unexpected bore to have [a man added to the party]1570-a man added to the party , and [a man]651-a man , too , of the kind [she]108-scrap was sure [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins must be , but [she]108-scrap was afraid — and [her]108-scrap fear was the result of a drearily unvarying experience — that [he]54-mr. wilkins might wish to hang about [her]108-scrap . This possibility had evidently not yet occurred to [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , and it was not one to which [she]108-scrap could very well draw [her]108-scrap attention ; not , that is , without being too fatuous to live . [She]108-scrap tried to hope that [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins would be a wonderful exception to the dreadful rule . If only [he]54-mr. wilkins were , [she]108-scrap would be so much obliged to [him]54-mr. wilkins that [she]108-scrap believed [she]108-scrap might really quite like [him]54-mr. wilkins . But — [she]108-scrap had misgivings . Suppose [he]54-mr. wilkins hung about [her]108-scrap so that [she]108-scrap was driven from [[her]108-scrap lovely top garden]1572-her lovely top garden ; suppose the light in [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ’s funny , flickering face was blown out . [Scrap]108-scrap felt [she]108-scrap would particularly dislike this to happen to [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ’s face , yet [she]108-scrap had never in [her]108-scrap life met [any wives]1573-any wives , not any at all , who had been able to understand that [she]108-scrap did n’t in the least want [[their]1573-any wives husbands]570-their husbands . Often [she]108-scrap had met wives who did n’t want [[their]1573-any wives husbands]570-their husbands either , but that made [them]1573-any wives none the less indignant if [they]1573-any wives thought [somebody else]2707-somebody else did , and none the less sure , when [they]1573-any wives saw [them]1573-any wives hanging round [Scrap]108-scrap , that [she]108-scrap was trying to get [them]1573-any wives . Trying to get [them]1573-any wives ! The bare thought , the bare recollection of these situations , filled [her]108-scrap with a boredom so extreme that it instantly sent [her]108-scrap to sleep again . When [she]108-scrap woke up [she]108-scrap went on with [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins . Now if , thought [Scrap]108-scrap , [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins were not an exception and behaved in the usual way , would [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins understand , or would it just simply spoil [her]53-mrs. wilkins holiday ? [She]53-mrs. wilkins seemed quick , but would [she]53-mrs. wilkins be quick about just this ? [She]53-mrs. wilkins seemed to understand and see inside one , but would [she]53-mrs. wilkins understand and see inside one when it came to [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins ? [The experienced Scrap]1577-the experienced scrap was full of doubts . [She]1577-the experienced scrap shifted [her]1577-the experienced scrap feet on the parapet ; [she]1577-the experienced scrap jerked a cushion straight . Perhaps [she]1577-the experienced scrap had better try and explain to [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , during the days still remaining before the arrival — explain in a general way , rather vague and talking at large — [her]53-mrs. wilkins attitude towards such things . [She]1577-the experienced scrap might also expound to [her]53-mrs. wilkins [her]53-mrs. wilkins peculiar dislike of [[people]274-people ’s husbands]1579-people ’s husbands , and [her]53-mrs. wilkins profound craving to be , at least for this one month , let alone . But [Scrap]108-scrap had [her]108-scrap doubts about this too . Such talk meant a certain familiarity , meant embarking on a friendship with [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ; and if , after having embarked on it and faced the peril it contained of too much [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins should turn out to be artful — and [people]274-people did get very artful when [they]274-people were set on anything — and manage after all to slip through into [the top garden]1084-the top garden , [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins might easily believe [she]53-mrs. wilkins had been taken in , and that [she]53-mrs. wilkins , [Scrap]108-scrap , was deceitful . Deceitful ! And about [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins . [Wives]242-wives were really pathetic . At half - past four [she]53-mrs. wilkins heard sounds of saucers on the other side of the daphne bushes . Was tea being sent out to [her]53-mrs. wilkins ? No ; the sounds came no closer , [they]1583-they stopped near [the house]404-the house . [Tea]142-tea was to be in [the garden]507-the garden , in [[her]53-mrs. wilkins garden]1586-her garden . [Scrap]108-scrap considered [she]108-scrap might at least have been asked if [she]108-scrap minded being disturbed . [They]1587-they all knew [she]108-scrap sat there . Perhaps [some one]751-some one would bring hers to [her]108-scrap in [[her]108-scrap corner]1589-her corner . No ; [nobody]225-nobody brought anything . Well , [she]53-mrs. wilkins was too hungry not to go and have it with [the others]949-the others to - day , but [she]53-mrs. wilkins would give [Francesca]99-francesca strict orders for the future . [She]53-mrs. wilkins got up , and walked with that slow grace which was another of [her]53-mrs. wilkins outrageous number of attractions towards the sounds of tea . [She]53-mrs. wilkins was conscious not only of being very hungry but of wanting to talk to [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins again . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins had not grabbed , [she]53-mrs. wilkins had left [her]53-mrs. wilkins quite free all day in spite of therapprochementthe night before . Of course [she]53-mrs. wilkins was [an original]1592-an original , and put on a silk jumper for dinner , but [she]53-mrs. wilkins had n’t grabbed . This was a great thing . [Scrap]108-scrap went towards the tea - table quite looking forward to [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ; and when [she]108-scrap came in sight of [it]1593-it [she]108-scrap saw only [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher was pouring out the tea , and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher was offering [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher macaroons . Every time [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher offered [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher anything — [her]76-mrs. fisher cup , or milk , or sugar — [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher offered [her]76-mrs. fisher macaroons — pressed them on [her]76-mrs. fisher with an odd assiduousness , almost with obstinacy . Was it a game ? [Scrap]108-scrap wondered , sitting down and seizing a macaroon . “ Where is [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ? ”[108-scrap] asked [Scrap]108-scrap . [They]1594-they did not know . At least , [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , on [Scrap]108-scrap ’s inquiry , did not know ; [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ’s face , at the name , became elaborately uninterested . It appeared that [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins had not been seen since breakfast . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher thought [she]53-mrs. wilkins had probably gone for a picnic . [Scrap]108-scrap missed [her]53-mrs. wilkins . [She]108-scrap ate the enormous macaroons , the best and biggest [she]108-scrap had ever come across , in silence . Tea without [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins was dull ; and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher had that fatal flavour of motherliness about [her]76-mrs. fisher , of wanting to pet [one]229-one , to make one very comfortable , coaxing one to eat — coaxing [her]76-mrs. fisher , who was already so frankly , so even excessively , eating — that seemed to have dogged [Scrap]108-scrap ’s steps through life . Could n’t [people]274-people leave one alone ? [She]76-mrs. fisher was perfectly able to eat what [she]76-mrs. fisher wanted unincited . [She]76-mrs. fisher tried to quench [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher ’s zeal by being short with [her]53-mrs. wilkins . Useless . The shortness was not apparent . It remained , as all [Scrap]108-scrap ’s evil feelings remained , covered up by the impenetrable veil of [her]108-scrap loveliness . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher sat monumentally , and took no notice of [either of [them]1598-them]1597-either of them . [She]76-mrs. fisher had had a curious day , and was a little worried . [She]76-mrs. fisher had been quite alone , for [none of [the three]1133-the three]1599-none of the three had come to lunch , and [none of [them]1133-the three]1300-none of them had taken the trouble to let [her]76-mrs. fisher know [they]1133-the three were not coming ; and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , drifting casually into tea , had behaved oddly till [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline joined [them]1598-them and distracted [her]76-mrs. fisher attention . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher was prepared not to dislike [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , whose parted hair and mild expression seemed very decent and womanly , but [she]76-mrs. fisher certainly had habits that were difficult to like . [Her]76-mrs. fisher habit of instantly echoing any offer made [her]76-mrs. fisher of food or drink , of throwing the offer back on one , as it were , was not somehow what [one]229-one expected of [her]76-mrs. fisher . “ Will [you]76-mrs. fisher have some more tea ? ”[76-mrs. fisher] was surely a question to which the answer was simply yes or no ; but [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher persisted in the trick [she]76-mrs. fisher had exhibited the day before at breakfast , of adding to [her]76-mrs. fisher yes or no the words , “ [Willyou]143-willyou ? ”[76-mrs. fisher] [She]76-mrs. fisher had done it again that morning at breakfast and here [she]76-mrs. fisher was doing it at tea — the two meals at which [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher presided and poured out . Why did [she]76-mrs. fisher do it ? [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher failed to understand . But this was not what was worrying [her]76-mrs. fisher ; this was merely by the way . What was worrying [her]76-mrs. fisher was that [she]76-mrs. fisher had been quite unable that day to settle to anything , and had done nothing but wander restlessly from [[her]76-mrs. fisher sitting - room]982-her sitting - room to [her]76-mrs. fisher battlements and back again . It had been a wasted day , and how much [she]76-mrs. fisher disliked waste . [She]76-mrs. fisher had tried to read , and [she]76-mrs. fisher had tried to write to [Kate Lumley]135-kate ; but no — a few words read , a few lines written , and up [she]76-mrs. fisher got again and went out on to the battlements and stared at [the sea]265-the sea . It did not matter that the letter to [Kate Lumley]135-kate should not be written . There was time enough for that . Let [the others]949-the others suppose [her]76-mrs. fisher coming was definitely fixed . All the better . So would [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins be kept out of [the spare - room]1563-the spare - room and put where [he]54-mr. wilkins belonged . [Kate]135-kate would keep . [She]135-kate could be held in reserve . [Kate]135-kate in [reserve]1607-reserve was just as potent as [Kate]135-kate in actuality , and there were points about [Kate]135-kate in reserve which might be missing from [Kate]135-kate in actuality . For instance , if [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher were going to be restless , [she]76-mrs. fisher would rather [Kate]135-kate were not there to see . There was a want of dignity about restlessness , about trotting backwards and forwards . But it did matter that [she]76-mrs. fisher could not read a sentence of any of [[her]76-mrs. fisher great dead friends]1608-her great dead friends ’ writings ; no , not even of [Browning]102-browning ’s , who had been so much in [Italy]13-italy , nor of [Ruskin]101-ruskin ’s , whoseStones of [Veniceshe]144-veniceshe had brought with [her]76-mrs. fisher to re - read so nearly on the very spot ; nor even a sentence of a really interesting book like the one [she]76-mrs. fisher had found in [[her]76-mrs. fisher sitting - room]982-her sitting - room about the home life of [the German Emperor]1610-the german emperor , [poor man]1611-poor man — written in the nineties , when [he]1611-poor man had not yet begun to be more sinned against than sinning , which was , [she]76-mrs. fisher was firmly convinced , what was the matter with [him]1611-poor man now , and full of exciting things about [his]1611-poor man birth and [his]1611-poor man right arm andaccoucheurs — without having to put it down and go and stare at [the sea]265-the sea . Reading was very important ; the proper exercise and development of [one]229-one ’s mind was a paramount duty . How could [one]229-one read if [one]229-one were constantly trotting in and out ? Curious , this restlessness . Was [she]76-mrs. fisher going to be ill ? No , [she]76-mrs. fisher felt well ; indeed , unusually well , and [she]76-mrs. fisher went in and out quite quickly — trotted , in fact — and without [her]76-mrs. fisher stick . Very odd that [she]76-mrs. fisher should n’t be able to sit still , [she]76-mrs. fisher thought , frowning across the tops of some purple hyacinths at [the Gulf of Spezia]36-the gulf of spezia glittering beyond [a headland]1616-a headland ; very odd that [she]76-mrs. fisher , who walked so slowly , with such dependence on [her]76-mrs. fisher stick , should suddenly trot . It would be interesting to talk to [some one]751-some one about it , [she]76-mrs. fisher felt . Not to [Kate]135-kate — to [a stranger]458-a stranger . [Kate]135-kate would only look at [her]76-mrs. fisher and suggest a cup of tea . [Kate]135-kate always suggested cups of tea . Besides , [Kate]135-kate had a flat face . That [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , now — annoying as [she]53-mrs. wilkins was , loose - tongued as [she]53-mrs. wilkins was , impertinent , objectionable , would probably understand , and perhaps know what was making [her]53-mrs. wilkins be like this . But [she]76-mrs. fisher could say nothing to [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins . [She]53-mrs. wilkins was [the last person to whom one]1619-the last person to whom one would admit sensations . [Dignity]145-dignity alone forbade it . Confide in [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ? Never . And [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , while [she]76-mrs. fisher wistfully mothered the obstructive Scrap at tea , felt too that [she]76-mrs. fisher had had a curious day . Like [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ’s , it had been active , but , unlike [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ’s , only active in mind . [Her]76-mrs. fisher body had been quite still ; [her]76-mrs. fisher mind had not been still at all , it had been excessively active . For years [she]76-mrs. fisher had taken care to have no time to think . [Her]76-mrs. fisher scheduled life in [the parish]373-the parish had prevented memories and desires from intruding on [her]76-mrs. fisher . That day [they]1621-they had crowded . [She]76-mrs. fisher went back to tea feeling dejected , and that [she]76-mrs. fisher should feel dejected in such a place with everything about [her]76-mrs. fisher to make [her]76-mrs. fisher rejoice , only dejected [her]76-mrs. fisher the more . But how could [she]76-mrs. fisher rejoice alone ? How could [anybody]196-anybody rejoice and enjoy and appreciate , really appreciate , alone ? Except [Lotty]94-lotty . [Lotty]94-lotty seemed able to . [She]94-lotty had gone off down [the hill]1623-the hill directly after breakfast , alone yet obviously rejoicing , for [she]94-lotty had not suggested that [Rose]95-rose should go too , and [she]95-rose was singing as [she]95-rose went . [Rose]95-rose had spent the day by [herself]95-rose , sitting with [her]95-rose hands clasping [her]95-rose knees , staring straight in front of [her]95-rose . What [she]95-rose was staring at were the grey swords of the agaves , and , on their tall stalks , the pale irises that grew in the remote place [she]95-rose had found , while beyond them , between the grey leaves and the blue flowers , [she]95-rose saw [the sea]265-the sea . [The place [she]95-rose had found]1625-the place she had found was a hidden corner where the sun - baked stones were padded with thyme , and [nobody was likely to come]1626-nobody was likely to come . It was out of sight and sound of [the house]404-the house ; [it]1625-the place she had found was off any path ; [it]1625-the place she had found was near [the end of [the promontory]1629-the promontory]1628-the end of the promontory . [She]95-rose sat so quiet that presently lizards darted over [her]95-rose feet , and some tiny birds like finches , frightened away at first , came back again and flitted among the bushes round [her]95-rose just as if [she]95-rose had n’t been [there]207-there . How beautiful it was . And what was the good of it with [no one there]1631-no one there , [no one who loved being with one]1632-no one who loved being with one , who belonged to [one , to whom one]1633-one , to whom one could say , “ Look . ”[1633-one , to whom one] And would n’t [one]229-one say , “ Look — dearest ? ”[229-one] Yes , [one]229-one would saydearestand the sweet word , just to say it to [somebody who loved one]1636-somebody who loved one , would make one happy . [She]95-rose sat quite still , staring straight in front of [her]95-rose . Strange that in [this place]2743-this place [she]95-rose did not want to pray . [[She]95-rose who had prayed so constantly at [home]215-home]1638-she who had prayed so constantly at home did n’t seem able to do it [here at all]1640-here at all . The first morning [she]95-rose had merely thrown up a brief thank [you]1641-you to heaven on getting out of bed , and had gone straight to the window to see what everything looked like — thrown up the thank you as carelessly as a ball , and thought no more about it . That morning , remembering this and ashamed , [she]95-rose had knelt down with determination ; but perhaps determination was bad for prayers , for [she]95-rose had been unable to think of a thing to say . And as for [her]95-rose bedtime prayers , on neither of the nights had [she]95-rose said a single one . [She]95-rose had forgotten them . [She]95-rose had been so much absorbed in other thoughts that [she]95-rose had forgotten them ; and , once in bed , [she]95-rose was asleep and whirling along among bright , thin swift dreams before [she]95-rose had so much time as to stretch [herself]95-rose out . What had come over [her]95-rose ? Why had [she]95-rose let go the anchor of prayer ? And [she]95-rose had difficulty , too , in remembering [[her]95-rose poor]1642-her poor , in remembering even that there were such things as [poor]1643-poor . Holidays , of course , were good , and were recognised by [everybody]2599-everybody as good , but ought [they]1645-they so completely to blot out , to make such havoc of , the realities ? Perhaps it was healthy to forget [[her]95-rose poor]1642-her poor ; with all the greater gusto would [she]95-rose go back to [them]1642-her poor . But it could n’t be healthy to forget [her]95-rose prayers , and still less could it be healthy not to mind . [Rose]95-rose did not mind . [She]95-rose knew [she]95-rose did not mind . And , even worse , [she]95-rose knew [she]95-rose did not mind not minding . In [this place]2743-this place [she]95-rose was indifferent to both the things that had filled [her]95-rose life and made it seem as if it were happy for years . Well , if only [she]95-rose could rejoice in [her]95-rose wonderful new surroundings , have that much at least to set against the indifference , the letting go — but [she]95-rose could not . [She]95-rose had no work ; [she]95-rose did not pray ; [she]95-rose was left empty . [Lotty]94-lotty had spoilt [her]94-lotty day that day , as [she]94-lotty had spoilt [her]94-lotty day the day before — [Lotty]94-lotty , with [her]94-lotty invitation to [[her]94-lotty husband]198-her husband , with [her]94-lotty suggestion that [she]94-lotty too should invite [hers]94-lotty . Having flung [Frederick]65-frederick into [her]94-lotty mind again the day before , [Lotty]94-lotty had left [her]94-lotty ; for the whole afternoon [she]94-lotty had left [her]94-lotty alone with [her]94-lotty thoughts . Since then [they]1649-they had been all of [Frederick]65-frederick . Where at Hampstead [he]65-frederick came to [her]94-lotty only in [her]94-lotty dreams , here [he]65-frederick left [her]94-lotty dreams free and was with [her]94-lotty during the day instead . And again that morning , as [she]94-lotty was struggling not to think of [him]65-frederick , [Lotty]94-lotty had asked [her]94-lotty , just before disappearing singing down [the path]691-the path , if [she]94-lotty had written yet and invited [him]65-frederick , and again [he]65-frederick was flung into [her]94-lotty mind and [she]94-lotty was n’t able to get [him]65-frederick out . How could [she]94-lotty invite [him]65-frederick ? It had gone on so long , [their]1651-their estrangement , such years ; [she]94-lotty would hardly know what words to use ; and besides , [he]65-frederick would not come . Why should [he]65-frederick come ? [He]65-frederick did n’t care about being with [her]94-lotty . What could [they]1651-their talk about ? Between [them]1651-their was the barrier of [his]65-frederick work and [her]94-lotty religion . [She]94-lotty could not — how could [she]94-lotty , believing as [she]94-lotty did in purity , in responsibility for the effect of [one]229-one ’s actions on [others]307-others — bear [his]65-frederick work , bear living by it ; and [he]65-frederick , [she]94-lotty knew , had at first resented and then been merely bored by [her]94-lotty religion . [He]65-frederick had let [her]94-lotty slip away ; [he]65-frederick had given [her]94-lotty up ; [he]65-frederick no longer minded ; [he]65-frederick accepted [her]94-lotty religion indifferently , as a settled fact . Both it and [she]94-lotty — [Rose]95-rose ’s mind , becoming more luminous in the clear light of [April]91-april at [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore , suddenly saw the truth — bored [him]65-frederick . Naturally when [she]94-lotty saw this , when that morning it flashed upon [her]94-lotty for the first time , [she]94-lotty did not like it ; [she]94-lotty liked it so little that for a space the whole beauty of [Italy]13-italy was blotted out . What was to be done about it ? [She]94-lotty could not give up believing in good and not liking evil , and it must be evil to live entirely on the proceeds of [adulteries]1654-adulteries , however dead and distinguished [they]1654-adulteries were . Besides , if [she]94-lotty did , if [she]94-lotty sacrificed [her]94-lotty whole past , [her]94-lotty bringing up , [her]94-lotty work for the last ten years , would [she]94-lotty bore [him]65-frederick less ? [Rose]95-rose felt right down at [her]95-rose very roots that if [you]1655-you have once thoroughly bored [somebody]980-somebody it is next to impossible to unbore [him]980-somebody . Once a bore always a bore — certainly , [she]95-rose thought , to [the person originally bored]1657-the person originally bored . Then , thought [she]95-rose , looking out to [sea]267-sea through eyes grown misty , better cling to [her]95-rose religion . It was better — [she]95-rose hardly noticed the reprehensibleness of [her]95-rose thought — than nothing . But oh , [she]95-rose wanted to cling to something tangible , to love something living , something that one could hold against one ’s heart , that [one]229-one could see and touch and do things for . If [[her]95-rose poor baby]1660-her poor baby had n’t died . . . [babies]1661-babies did n’t get bored with one , it took [them]1661-babies a long while to grow up and find one out . And perhaps [one ’s baby]1662-one ’s baby never did find one out ; perhaps one would always be to it , however old and bearded it grew , [somebody special]1663-somebody special , somebody different from [every one else]1664-every one else , and if for no other reason , precious in that one could never be repeated . Sitting with dim eyes looking out to [sea]267-sea [she]95-rose felt an extraordinary yearning to hold something of [her]95-rose very own tight to [her]95-rose bosom . [Rose]95-rose was slender , and as reserved in figure as in character , yet [she]95-rose felt a queer sensation of — how could [she]95-rose describe it?—bosom . There was something about [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore that made [her]95-rose feel all bosom . [She]95-rose wanted to gather to [her]95-rose bosom , to comfort and protect , soothing the dear head that should lie on it with softest strokings and murmurs of love . [Frederick]65-frederick , [[Frederick]65-frederick ’s child]1666-frederick ’s child — come to [her]95-rose , pillowed on [her]95-rose , because [they]1661-babies were unhappy , because [they]1661-babies had been hurt . . . [They]1661-babies would need [her]95-rose then , if [they]1661-babies had been hurt ; [they]1661-babies would let [themselves]1661-babies be loved then , if [they]1661-babies were unhappy . Well , [the child]1667-the child was gone , would never come now ; but perhaps [Frederick]65-frederick — some day — when [he]65-frederick was old and tired . . . Such were [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher ’s reflections and emotions that first day at [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore by [herself]95-rose . [She]95-rose went back to tea dejected as [she]95-rose had not been for years . [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore had taken [her]95-rose carefully built - up semblance of happiness away from [her]95-rose , and given [her]95-rose nothing in exchange . Yes — it had given [her]95-rose yearnings in exchange , this ache and longing , this queer feeling of bosom ; but that was worse than nothing . And [she]95-rose who had learned balance , who never at [home]215-home was irritated but always able to be kind , could not , even in [her]95-rose dejection , that afternoon endure [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ’s assumption of the position as [hostess at tea]1669-hostess at tea . [One]229-one would have supposed that such a little thing would not have touched [her]95-rose , but it did . Was [her]95-rose nature changing ? Was [she]95-rose to be not only thrown back on long - stifled yearnings after [Frederick]65-frederick , but also turned into [somebody who wanted to fight over little things]1671-somebody who wanted to fight over little things ? After tea , when both [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher and [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline had disappeared again — it was quite evident that [nobody]225-nobody wanted [her]95-rose — [she]95-rose was more dejected than ever , overwhelmed by the discrepancy between the splendour outside [her]95-rose , the warm , teeming beauty and self - sufficiency of nature , and the blank emptiness of [her]95-rose heart . Then came [Lotty]94-lotty , back to dinner , incredibly more freckled , exuding the sunshine [she]94-lotty had been collecting all day , talking , laughing , being tactless , being unwise , being without reticence ; and [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline , so quiet at tea , woke up to animation , and [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher was not so noticeable , and [Rose]95-rose was beginning to revive a little , for [Lotty]94-lotty ’s spirits were contagious as [she]94-lotty described the delights of [her]94-lotty day , a day which might easily to [any one else have had nothing in it but a very long and very hot walk and sandwiches]1673-any one else have had nothing in it but a very long and very hot walk and sandwiches , when [she]94-lotty suddenly said catching [Rose]95-rose ’s eye , “ Letter gone ? ”[94-lotty] [Rose]95-rose flushed . This tactlessness . . . “ What letter ? ”[108-scrap] asked [Scrap]108-scrap , interested . Both [her]94-lotty elbows were on the table and [her]94-lotty chin was supported in [her]94-lotty hands , for the nut - stage had been reached , and there was nothing for it but to wait in as comfortable as position as possible till [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher had finished cracking . “ Asking [[her]94-lotty husband]198-her husband here , ”[94-lotty] said [Lotty]94-lotty . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher looked up . [Another husband]1674-another husband ? Was there to be no end to [them]1675-them ? Nor was [this one]847-this one , then , [a widow]441-a widow either ; but [[her]94-lotty husband]198-her husband was no doubt [a decent , respectable man]1679-a decent , respectable man , following a decent , respectable calling . [She]94-lotty had little hope of [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins ; so little , that [she]94-lotty had refrained from inquiring what [he]54-mr. wilkins did . “ Has it ? ”[94-lotty] persisted [Lotty]94-lotty , as [Rose]95-rose said nothing . “ No , ”[95-rose] said [Rose]95-rose . “ Oh , well — to - morrow then , ”[94-lotty] said [Lotty]94-lotty . [Rose]95-rose wanted to say No again to this . [Lotty]94-lotty would have in [her]94-lotty place , and would , besides , have expounded all [her]94-lotty reasons . But [she]94-lotty could not turn [herself]94-lotty inside out like that and invite any and [everybody]2599-everybody to come and look . How was it that [Lotty]94-lotty , who saw so many things , did n’t see stuck on [her]94-lotty heart , and seeing keep quiet about it , the sore place that was [Frederick]65-frederick ? “ Who is [[your]76-mrs. fisher husband]2628-your husband ? ”[76-mrs. fisher] asked [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , carefully adjusting another nut between the crackers . “ Who should [he]2628-your husband be , ”[95-rose] said [Rose]95-rose quickly , roused at once by [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher to irritation , “ exceptMr . [Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher ? ”[95-rose] “ [I]95-rose mean , of course , what is [Mr. Arbuthnot]146-mr. arbuthnot ? ”[95-rose] And [Rose]95-rose , gone painfully red at this , said after a tiny pause , “ [[My]95-rose husband]2595-my husband . ”[95-rose] Naturally , [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher was incensed . [She]76-mrs. fisher could n’t have believed it of [this one]847-this one , with [her]76-mrs. fisher decent hair and gentle voice , that [she]76-mrs. fisher too should be impertinent .

That first week the wistaria began to fade , and the flowers of the Judas - tree and peach - trees fell off and carpeted the ground with rose - colour . Then all the freesias disappeared , and the irises grew scarce . And then , while these were clearing [themselves]1682-themselves away , the double banksia roses came out , and the big summer roses suddenly flaunted gorgeously on the walls and trellises . [Fortune]147-fortune ’s Yellow was one of them ; a very beautiful rose . Presently the tamarisk and [the daphnes]1683-the daphnes were at [their]1684-their best , and the lilies at [their]1684-their tallest . By the end of the week the fig - trees were giving shade , the plum - blossom was out among the olives , the modest weigelias appeared in [their]1684-their fresh pink clothes , and on the rocks sprawled masses of thick - leaved , star - shaped flowers , some vivid purple and some a clear , pale lemon . By the end of the week , too , [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins arrived ; even as [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife had foreseen [he]54-mr. wilkins would , so [he]54-mr. wilkins did . And there were signs almost of eagerness about [his]54-mr. wilkins acceptance of [her]238-his wife suggestion , for [he]54-mr. wilkins had not waited to write a letter in answer to [hers]238-his wife , but had telegraphed . That , surely , was eager . It showed , [Scrap]108-scrap thought , a definite wish for reunion ; and watching [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife ’s happy face , and aware of [her]238-his wife desire that [Mellersh]54-mr. wilkins should enjoy [his]54-mr. wilkins holiday , [she]238-his wife told [herself]238-his wife that [he]54-mr. wilkins would be a very unusual fool should [he]54-mr. wilkins waste [his]54-mr. wilkins time bothering about [anybody else]1559-anybody else . “ If [he]54-mr. wilkins is n’t nice to [her]238-his wife , ”[108-scrap] [Scrap]108-scrap thought , “ [he]54-mr. wilkins shall be taken to the battlements and tipped over . ”[108-scrap] For , by the end of the week , [she]238-his wife and [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins had become [Caroline]75-lady caroline and [Lotty]94-lotty to [each other]201-each other , and were [friends]2611-friends . [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins had always been [friends]2611-friends , but [Scrap]108-scrap had struggled not to be . [She]108-scrap had tried hard to be cautious , but how difficult was caution with [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ! Free [herself]108-scrap from every vestige of it , [she]108-scrap was so entirely unreserved , so completely expansive , that soon [Scrap]108-scrap , almost before [she]108-scrap knew what [she]108-scrap was doing , was being unreserved too . And [nobody]225-nobody could be more unreserved than [Scrap]108-scrap , once [she]108-scrap let [herself]108-scrap go . The only difficulty about [Lotty]94-lotty was that [she]94-lotty was nearly always somewhere else . [You]1692-you could n’t catch [her]94-lotty ; [you]1692-you could n’t pin [her]94-lotty down to come and talk . [Scrap]108-scrap ’s fears that [she]94-lotty would grab seemed grotesque in retrospect . Why , there was no grab in [her]94-lotty . At dinner and after dinner were the only times [one]229-one really saw [her]94-lotty . All day long [she]94-lotty was invisible , and would come back in the late afternoon looking a perfect sight , [her]94-lotty hair full of bits of moss , and [her]94-lotty freckles worse than ever . Perhaps [she]94-lotty was making the most of [her]94-lotty time before [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins arrived to do all the things [she]94-lotty wanted to do , and meant to devote [herself]94-lotty afterwards to going about with [him]1694-him , tidy and in [her]94-lotty best clothes . [Scrap]108-scrap watched [her]94-lotty , interested in spite of [herself]108-scrap , because it seemed so extraordinary to be as happy as all that on so little . [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore was beautiful , and the weather was divine ; but scenery and weather had never been enough for [Scrap]108-scrap , and how could they be enough for [somebody who would have to leave [them]1696-them quite soon and go back to life in [Hampstead]4-hampstead]1695-somebody who would have to leave them quite soon and go back to life in hampstead ? Also , there was the imminence of [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins , of [that [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins from whom [Lotty]94-lotty had so lately run]1697-that mellersh from whom lotty had so lately run . It was all very well to feel [one]229-one ought to share , and to make [abeau gesteand]148-abeau gesteand do it , but thebeaux gestesScrap had known had n’t made [anybody]196-anybody happy . [Nobody]225-nobody really liked being the object of one , and it always meant an effort on the part of [the maker]1701-the maker . Still , [she]94-lotty had to admit there was no effort about [Lotty]94-lotty ; it was quite plain that everything [she]94-lotty did and said was effortless , and that [she]94-lotty was just simply , completely happy . And so [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins was ; for [her]94-lotty doubts as to whether [she]94-lotty had had time to become steady enough in serenity to go on being serene in [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins ’s company when [she]94-lotty had it uninterruptedly right round the clock , had gone by the middle of the week , and [she]94-lotty felt that nothing now could shake [her]94-lotty . [She]94-lotty was ready for anything . [She]94-lotty was firmly grafted , rooted , built into heaven . Whatever [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins said or did , [she]94-lotty would not budge an inch out of [heaven]2604-heaven , would not rouse [herself]94-lotty a single instant to come outside [it]2604-heaven and be cross . On the contrary , [she]94-lotty was going to pull [him]1703-he up into it beside [her]94-lotty , and [they]1704-they would sit comfortably together , suffused in light , and laugh at how much afraid of [him]1703-he [she]94-lotty used to be in [Hampstead]4-hampstead , and at how deceitful [her]94-lotty afraidness had made [her]94-lotty . But [he]1703-he would n’t need much pulling . [He]1703-he would come in quite naturally after a day or two , irresistibly wafted on the scented breezes of that divine air ; and there [he]1703-he would sit arrayed in stars , thought [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins , in whose mind , among much otherdébris , floated occasional bright shreds of poetry . [She]53-mrs. wilkins laughed to [herself]53-mrs. wilkins a little at the picture of [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins , [that top - hatted , black - coated , respectable family solicitor]1705-that top - hatted , black - coated , respectable family solicitor , arrayed in stars , but [she]53-mrs. wilkins laughed affectionately , almost with a maternal pride in how splendid [he]1703-he would look in such fine clothes . “ [Poor lamb]2793-poor lamb , ”[53-mrs. wilkins] [she]53-mrs. wilkins murmured to [herself]53-mrs. wilkins affectionately . And added , “ What [he]1703-he wants is a thorough airing . ”[53-mrs. wilkins] This was during the first half of the week . By the beginning of the last half , at the end of which [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins arrived , [she]53-mrs. wilkins left off even assuring [herself]53-mrs. wilkins that [she]53-mrs. wilkins was unshakeable , that [she]53-mrs. wilkins was permeated beyond altering by the atmosphere , [she]53-mrs. wilkins no longer thought of it or noticed it ; [she]53-mrs. wilkins took it for granted . If [one]229-one may say so , and [she]53-mrs. wilkins certainly said so , not only to [herself]53-mrs. wilkins but also to [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline , [she]53-mrs. wilkins had found [her]53-mrs. wilkins celestial legs . Contrary to [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ’s idea of the seemly — but of course contrary ; what else would [one]229-one expect of [Mrs. Wilkins?—she]149-mrs. wilkins?—she did not go to meet [[her]53-mrs. wilkins husband]198-her husband at [Mezzago]30-mezzago , but merely walked down to the point where [Beppo]89-beppo ’s fly would leave [him]198-her husband and [his]198-her husband luggage in [the street of [Castagneto]31-castagneto]1709-the street of castagneto . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher disliked the arrival of [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , and was sure that anybody who could have married [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins must be at least of an injudicious disposition , but [a husband]282-a husband , whatever [his]282-a husband disposition , should be properly met . [Mr. Fisher]83-mr. fisher had always been properly met . Never once in [his]83-mr. fisher married life had [he]83-mr. fisher gone unmet at [a station]1711-a station , nor had [he]83-mr. fisher ever not been seen off . These observances , these courtesies , strengthened the bonds of marriage , and made [the husband]1430-the husband feel [he]1430-the husband could rely on [[his]1430-the husband wife]238-his wife ’s being always there . Always being there was the essential secret for [a wife]1714-a wife . What would have become of [Mr. Fisher]83-mr. fisher if [she]76-mrs. fisher had neglected to act on this principle [she]76-mrs. fisher preferred not to think . Enough things became of [him]83-mr. fisher as it was ; for whatever [one]229-one ’s care in stopping up , married life yet seemed to contain chinks . But [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins took no pains . [She]53-mrs. wilkins just walked down [the hill]1623-the hill singing — [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher could hear [her]53-mrs. wilkins — and picked up [[her]53-mrs. wilkins husband]198-her husband in [the street]1718-the street as casually as if [he]198-her husband were a pin . [The three others]1719-the three others , still in bed , for it was not nearly time to get up , heard [her]53-mrs. wilkins as [she]53-mrs. wilkins passed beneath [their]1719-the three others windows down [the zigzag path]825-the zigzag path to meet [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , who was coming by [the morning train]1721-the morning train , and [Scrap]108-scrap smiled , and [Rose]95-rose sighed , and [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher rang [her]76-mrs. fisher bell and desired [Francesca]99-francesca to bring [her]76-mrs. fisher [her]76-mrs. fisher breakfast in [[her]76-mrs. fisher room]718-her room . [All three]1723-all three had breakfast that day in [[their]1723-all three rooms]1724-their rooms , moved by a common instinct to take cover . [Scrap]108-scrap always breakfasted in bed , but [she]108-scrap had the same instinct for cover , and during breakfast [she]108-scrap made plans for spending the whole day where [she]108-scrap was . Perhaps , though , it would n’t be as necessary that day as the next . That day , [Scrap]108-scrap calculated , [Mellersh]54-mr. wilkins would be provided for . [He]54-mr. wilkins would want to have a bath , and having a bath at [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore was an elaborate business , a real adventure if one had a hot one in [the bathroom]1725-the bathroom , and it took a lot of time . It involved the attendance of [the entire staff]1726-the entire staff — [Domenico]88-domenico and [the boy]1727-the boy [Giuseppe]150-giuseppe coaxing the patent stove to burn , restraining it when it burnt too fiercely , using the bellows to it when it threatened to go out , relighting it when it did go out ; [Francesca]99-francesca anxiously hovering over the tap regulating its trickle , because if it were turned on too full the water instantly ran cold , and if not full enough the stove blew up inside and mysteriously flooded [the house]404-the house ; and [Costanza]106-costanza and [Angela]151-angela running up and down bringing pails of hot water from [the kitchen]2704-the kitchen to eke out what the tap did . [This bath]1730-this bath had been put in lately , and was at once the pride and the terror of [the servants]417-the servants . It was very patent . [Nobody]225-nobody quite understood it . There were long printed instructions as to its right treatment hanging on the wall , in which the wordpericolosorecurred . When [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , proceeding on [her]76-mrs. fisher arrival to [the bathroom]1725-the bathroom , saw this word , [she]76-mrs. fisher went back to [[her]76-mrs. fisher room]718-her room again and ordered a sponge - bath instead ; and when [the others]949-the others found what using [the bathroom]1725-the bathroom meant , and how reluctant [the servants]417-the servants were to leave [them]949-the others alone with the stove , and how [Francesca]99-francesca positively refused to , and stayed with [her]99-francesca back turned watching the tap , and how [the remaining servants]1738-the remaining servants waited anxiously outside the door till [the bather]1739-the bather came safely out again , [they]1738-the remaining servants too had sponge - baths brought into [[their]1738-the remaining servants rooms]1724-their rooms instead . [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , however , was [a man]651-a man , and would be sure to want a big bath . Having it , [Scrap]108-scrap calculated , would keep [him]54-mr. wilkins busy for a long while . Then [he]54-mr. wilkins would unpack , and then , after [his]54-mr. wilkins night in [the train]528-the train , [he]54-mr. wilkins would probably sleep till the evening . So would [he]54-mr. wilkins be provided for the whole of that day , and not be let loose on [them]417-the servants till dinner . Therefore [Scrap]108-scrap came to the conclusion [she]108-scrap would be quite safe in [the garden]507-the garden that day , and got up as usual after breakfast , and dawdled as usual through [her]108-scrap dressing , listening with a slightly cocked ear to the sounds of [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins ’s arrival , of [his]54-mr. wilkins luggage being carried into [[Lotty]94-lotty ’s room]1744-lotty ’s room on [the other side of [the landing]1746-the landing]1745-the other side of the landing , of [his]54-mr. wilkins educated voice as [he]54-mr. wilkins inquired of [Lotty]94-lotty , first , “ Do [I]54-mr. wilkins give [this fellow]2874-this fellow anything ? ”[54-mr. wilkins] and immediately afterwards , “ Can [I]94-lotty have a hot bath?”—of[94-lotty] [Lotty]94-lotty ’s voice cheerfully assuring [him]54-mr. wilkins that [he]54-mr. wilkins need n’t give [the fellow]1747-the fellow anything because [he]54-mr. wilkins was [the gardener]2674-the gardener , and that yes , [he]54-mr. wilkins could have a hot bath ; and soon after this [the landing]1746-the landing was filled with the familiar noises of wood being brought , of water being brought , of feet running , of tongues vociferating — in fact , with the preparation of the bath . [Scrap]108-scrap finished dressing , and then loitered at [her]108-scrap window , waiting till [she]108-scrap should hear [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins go into [the bathroom]1725-the bathroom . When [he]54-mr. wilkins was safely [there]207-there [she]108-scrap would slip out and settle [herself]108-scrap in [[her]108-scrap garden]1586-her garden and resume [her]108-scrap inquiries into the probable meaning of [her]108-scrap life . [She]108-scrap was getting on with [her]108-scrap inquiries . [She]108-scrap dozed much less frequently , and was beginning to be inclined to agree that tawdry was the word to apply to [her]108-scrap past . Also [she]108-scrap was afraid that [her]108-scrap future looked black . There — [she]108-scrap could hear [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins ’s educated voice again . [Lotty]94-lotty ’s door had opened , and [he]54-mr. wilkins was coming out of [it]1753-it asking [his]54-mr. wilkins way to [the bathroom]1725-the bathroom . “ It ’s where [you]108-scrap see [the crowd]2875-the crowd , ”[94-lotty] [Lotty]94-lotty ’s voice answered — still a cheerful voice , [Scrap]108-scrap was glad to notice . [His]54-mr. wilkins steps went along [the landing]1746-the landing , and [Lotty]94-lotty ’s steps seemed to go [downstairs]1756-downstairs , and then there seemed to be a brief altercation at the bathroom door — hardly so much an altercation as a chorus of vociferations on one side and a wordless determination , [Scrap]108-scrap judged , to have a bath by [oneself]1757-oneself on the other . [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins knew no Italian , and the expressionpericolosoleft [him]54-mr. wilkins precisely as it found [him]54-mr. wilkins — or would have if [he]54-mr. wilkins had seen it , but naturally [he]54-mr. wilkins took no notice of the printed matter on the wall . [He]54-mr. wilkins firmly closed the door on [the servants]417-the servants , resisting [Domenico]88-domenico , who tried to the last to press through , and locked [himself]54-mr. wilkins in as [a man]651-a man should for [his]651-a man bath , judicially considering , as [he]54-mr. wilkins made [his]54-mr. wilkins simple preparations for getting in , the singular standard of behaviour of [these foreigners who , both male and female , apparently wished to stay with [him]54-mr. wilkins while [he]54-mr. wilkins bathed]1760-these foreigners who , both male and female , apparently wished to stay with him while he bathed . In [Finland]42-finland , [he]54-mr. wilkins had heard , [the female natives]1761-the female natives not only were present on such occasions but actually washed [the bath - taking traveller]1762-the bath - taking traveller . [He]54-mr. wilkins had not heard , however , that this was true too of [Italy]13-italy , which somehow seemed much nearer civilisation — perhaps because [one]229-one went [there]207-there , and did not go to [Finland]42-finland . Impartially examining this reflection , and carefully balancing the claims to civilisation of [Italy]13-italy and [Finland]42-finland , [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins got into [the bath]1765-the bath and turned off the tap . Naturally [he]54-mr. wilkins turned off the tap . It was what [one]229-one did . But on the instructions , printed in red letters , was a paragraph saying that the tap should not be turned off as long as there was still fire in the stove . It should be left on — not much on , but on — until the fire was quite out ; otherwise , and here again was the wordpericoloso , the stove would blow up . [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins got into [the bath]1765-the bath , turned off the tap , and the stove blew up , exactly as the printed instructions said it would . It blew up , fortunately , only in its inside , but it blew up with a terrific noise , and [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins leapt out of [the bath]1765-the bath and rushed to the door , and only the instinct born of years of training made [him]54-mr. wilkins snatch up a towel as [he]54-mr. wilkins rushed . [Scrap]108-scrap , half - way across [the landing]1746-the landing on [her]108-scrap way out of doors , heard the explosion . “ Good heavens , ”[108-scrap] [she]108-scrap thought , remembering the instructions , “ there goes [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins ! ”[108-scrap] And [she]108-scrap ran toward the head of the stairs to call [the servants]417-the servants , and as [she]108-scrap ran , out ran [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins clutching [his]54-mr. wilkins towel , and [they]1771-they ran into [each other]201-each other . “ [That damned bath]2876-that damned bath ! ”[54-mr. wilkins] cried [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , perhaps for the only time in [his]54-mr. wilkins life forgetting [himself]54-mr. wilkins ; but [he]54-mr. wilkins was upset . Here was an introduction . [Mr Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , imperfectly concealed in [his]54-mr. wilkins towel , [his]54-mr. wilkins shoulders exposed at one end and [his]54-mr. wilkins legs at the other , and [Lady Caroline Dester]75-lady caroline , to meet whom [he]54-mr. wilkins had swallowed all [his]54-mr. wilkins anger with [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife and come out to [Italy]13-italy . For [Lotty]94-lotty in [her]94-lotty letter had told [him]54-mr. wilkins who was at [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore besides [herself]94-lotty and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , and [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins at once had perceived that this was an opportunity which might never recur . [Lotty]94-lotty had merely said , “ There are [two other women]2877-two other women [here]2640-here , [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher and [Lady Caroline Dester]75-lady caroline , ”[94-lotty] but that was enough . [He]54-mr. wilkins knew all about [the Droitwiches]152-the droitwiches , [their]152-the droitwiches wealth , [their]152-the droitwiches connections , [their]152-the droitwiches place in history , and the power [they]152-the droitwiches had , should [they]152-the droitwiches choose to exert it , of making yet [another solicitor]1774-another solicitor happy by adding [him]1774-another solicitor to those [they]152-the droitwiches already employed . [Some people]344-some people employed [one solicitor]1776-one solicitor for one branch of [their]344-some people affairs , and another for another . The affairs of [the Droitwiches]152-the droitwiches must have many branches . [He]54-mr. wilkins had also heard — for it was , [he]54-mr. wilkins considered , part of [his]54-mr. wilkins business to hear , and having heard to remember — of the beauty of [[their]152-the droitwiches only daughter]1777-their only daughter . Even if [the Droitwiches]1778-the droitwiches [themselves]1778-the droitwiches did not need [his]54-mr. wilkins services , [[their]1778-the droitwiches daughter]1779-their daughter might . [Beauty]117-beauty led [one]229-one into strange situations ; advice could never come amiss . And should [none of [them]1778-the droitwiches]1300-none of them , [neither [parents]1783-parents nor [daughter]1784-daughter nor any of [[their]152-the droitwiches brilliant sons]1785-their brilliant sons]1782-neither parents nor daughter nor any of their brilliant sons , need [him]54-mr. wilkins in [his]54-mr. wilkins professional capacity , it yet was obviously a most valuable acquaintance to make . It opened up vistas . [It]1786-it swelled with possibilities . [He]54-mr. wilkins might go on living in [Hampstead]4-hampstead for years , and not again come across such another chance . Directly [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife ’s letter reached [him]54-mr. wilkins [he]54-mr. wilkins telegraphed and packed . This was business . [He]54-mr. wilkins was not [a man]651-a man to lose time when it came to business ; nor was [he]54-mr. wilkins [a man]651-a man to jeopardise a chance by neglecting to be amiable . [He]54-mr. wilkins met [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife perfectly amiably , aware that amiability under such circumstances was wisdom . Besides , [he]54-mr. wilkins actually felt amiable — very . For once , [Lotty]94-lotty was really helping [him]54-mr. wilkins . [He]54-mr. wilkins kissed [her]238-his wife affectionately on getting out of [Beppo]89-beppo ’s fly , and was afraid [she]238-his wife must have got up extremely early ; [he]54-mr. wilkins made no complaints of the steepness of the walk up ; [he]54-mr. wilkins told [her]238-his wife pleasantly of [his]54-mr. wilkins journey , and when called upon , obediently admired the views . It was all neatly mapped out in [his]54-mr. wilkins mind , what [he]54-mr. wilkins was going to do that first day — have a shave , have a bath , put on clean clothes , sleep a while , and then would come lunch and the introduction to [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline . In [the train]528-the train [he]54-mr. wilkins had selected the words of [his]54-mr. wilkins greeting , going over them with care — some slight expression of [his]54-mr. wilkins gratification in meeting one of whom [he]54-mr. wilkins , in common with [the whole world]197-the whole world , had heard — but of course put delicately , very delicately ; some slight reference to [[her]238-his wife distinguished parents]1793-her distinguished parents and the part [[her]238-his wife family]1794-her family had played in the history of [England]16-england — made , of course , with proper tact ; a sentence or two about [[her]238-his wife eldest brother [Lord Winchcombe]153-lord winchcombe , who had won [his]153-lord winchcombe V.C. in the late war under circumstances which could only cause — [he]54-mr. wilkins might or might not add this — [every Englishman]1796-every englishman ’s heart]1795-her eldest brother lord winchcombe , who had won his v.c. in the late war under circumstances which could only cause — he might or might not add this — every englishman ’s heart to beat higher than ever with pride , and the first steps towards what might well be the turning - point in [his]54-mr. wilkins career would have been taken . And here [he]54-mr. wilkins was . . . no , it was too terrible , what could be more terrible ? Only a towel on , water running off [his]54-mr. wilkins legs , and that exclamation . [He]54-mr. wilkins knew at once [the lady]1797-the lady was [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline — the minute the exclamation was out [he]54-mr. wilkins knew it . Rarely did [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins use that word , and never , never in the presence of [a lady]1798-a lady or [a client]1799-a client . While as for the towel — why had [he]54-mr. wilkins come ? Why had [he]54-mr. wilkins not stayed in [Hampstead]4-hampstead ? It would be impossible to live this down . But [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins was reckoning without [Scrap]108-scrap . [She]1797-the lady , indeed , screwed up [her]1797-the lady face at the first flash of [him]54-mr. wilkins on [her]1797-the lady astonished sight in an enormous effort not to laugh , and having choked the laughter down and got [her]1797-the lady face serious again , [she]1797-the lady said as composedly as if [he]54-mr. wilkins had had all [his]54-mr. wilkins clothes on , “ How do [you]54-mr. wilkins do . ”[1797-the lady] What perfect tact . [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins could have worshipped [her]1797-the lady . This exquisite ignoring . Blue blood , of course , coming out . The strange effect of this incident was that when [they]1822-they met that evening at dinner both [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher and [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline had a singular feeling of secret understanding with [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins . [He]54-mr. wilkins could not be to [them]1822-they as [other men]1823-other men . [He]54-mr. wilkins could not be to [them]1822-they as [he]54-mr. wilkins would have been if [they]1822-they had met [him]54-mr. wilkins in [his]54-mr. wilkins clothes . There was a sense of broken ice ; [they]1822-they felt at once intimate and indulgent ; almost [they]1822-they felt to [him]54-mr. wilkins as [nurses]1824-nurses do — as [those feel who have assisted either [patients]1826-patients or [young children]1827-young children at [their]1825-those feel who have assisted either patients or young children at their baths baths]1825-those feel who have assisted either patients or young children at their baths . [They]1822-they were acquainted with [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins ’s legs . What [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher said to [him]54-mr. wilkins that morning in [her]76-mrs. fisher first shock will never be known , but what [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins said to [her]76-mrs. fisher in reply , when reminded by what [she]76-mrs. fisher was saying of [his]54-mr. wilkins condition , was so handsome in its apology , so proper in its confusion , that [she]76-mrs. fisher had ended by being quite sorry for [him]54-mr. wilkins and completely placated . After all , it was an accident , and [nobody]225-nobody could help accidents . And when [she]76-mrs. fisher saw [him]54-mr. wilkins next at dinner , dressed , polished , spotless as to linen and sleek as to hair , [she]76-mrs. fisher felt this singular sensation of a secret understanding with [him]54-mr. wilkins and , added to it , of a kind of almost personal pride in [his]54-mr. wilkins appearance , now that [he]54-mr. wilkins was dressed , which presently extended in some subtle way to an almost personal pride in everything [he]54-mr. wilkins said . There was no doubt whatever in [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ’s mind that [a man]651-a man was infinitely preferable as a companion to [a woman]794-a woman . [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins ’s presence and conversation at once raised the standard of the dinner - table from that of [a bear garden]1831-a bear garden — yes , [a bear garden]1831-a bear garden — to that of a civilised social gathering . [He]54-mr. wilkins talked as [men]797-men talk , about interesting subjects , and , though most courteous to [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline , showed no traces of dissolving into simpers and idiocy whenever [he]54-mr. wilkins addressed [her]75-lady caroline . [He]54-mr. wilkins was , indeed , precisely as courteous to [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher [herself]76-mrs. fisher ; and when for the first time at that table politics were introduced , [he]54-mr. wilkins listened to [her]76-mrs. fisher with the proper seriousness on [her]76-mrs. fisher exhibiting a desire to speak , and treated [her]76-mrs. fisher opinions with the attention [they]1834-they deserved . [He]54-mr. wilkins appeared to think much as [she]76-mrs. fisher did about [Lloyd George]154-lloyd george , and in regard to literature [he]54-mr. wilkins was equally sound . In fact there was real conversation , and [he]54-mr. wilkins liked nuts . How [he]54-mr. wilkins could have married [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins was a mystery . [Lotty]94-lotty , for [her]76-mrs. fisher part , looked on with round eyes . [She]76-mrs. fisher had expected [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins to take at least two days before [he]54-mr. wilkins got to this stage , but the San Salvatore spell had worked instantly . Kissed [her]76-mrs. fisher ! And it was neither good - morning nor good - night . Well , this being so , [she]76-mrs. fisher would put off telling [him]54-mr. wilkins the truth about [her]76-mrs. fisher nest - egg , and about [Rose]95-rose not being [[his]54-mr. wilkins hostess]1836-his hostess after all , till next day . Pity to spoil things . [She]76-mrs. fisher had been going to blurt it out as soon as [he]54-mr. wilkins had had a rest , but it did seem a pity to disturb such a very beautiful frame of mind as that of [Mellersh]53-mrs. wilkins this first day . Let [him]54-mr. wilkins too get more firmly fixed in [heaven]2604-heaven . Once fixed [he]54-mr. wilkins would n’t mind anything .
