[Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins was of a cool habit , and rarely had any real wish to press . Meanwhile , [Costanza]106-costanza , perceiving that [she]106-costanza had lost [the Wilkinses]123-the wilkinses ’ ear had gone back to [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , who at least understood Italian , besides being clearly in [the servants]417-the servants ’ eyes the one of [the party marked down by age and appearance to pay the bills]1862-the party marked down by age and appearance to pay the bills ; and to [her]106-costanza , while [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher put the final touches to [her]106-costanza toilette , for [she]106-costanza was preparing , by means of putting on a hat and veil and feather boa and gloves , to go for [her]106-costanza first stroll in [the lower garden]910-the lower garden — positively [her]106-costanza first since [her]106-costanza arrival — [she]106-costanza explained that unless [she]106-costanza was given money to pay the last week ’s bills [the shops of [Castagneto]31-castagneto]1864-the shops of castagneto would refuse credit for the current week ’s food . Not even credit would [they]1864-the shops of castagneto give , affirmed [Costanza]106-costanza , who had been spending a great deal and was anxious to pay all [her]106-costanza relations what was owed [them]1864-the shops of castagneto and also to find out how [[her]106-costanza mistresses]1865-her mistresses took it , for that day ’s meals . Soon it would be the hour ofcolazione , and how could there becolazionewithout meat , without fish , without eggs , without — [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher took the bills out of [her]76-mrs. fisher hand and looked at the total ; and [she]76-mrs. fisher was so much astonished by its size , so much horrified by the extravagance to which it testified , that [she]76-mrs. fisher sat down at [her]76-mrs. fisher writing - table to go into the thing thoroughly . [Costanza]106-costanza had a very bad half - hour . [She]106-costanza had not supposed it was in the English to be so mercenary . And [thenla Vecchia]155-thenla vecchia , as [she]155-thenla vecchia was called in [the kitchen]2704-the kitchen , knew so much Italian , and with a doggedness that filled [Costanza]106-costanza with shame on [her]106-costanza behalf , for such conduct was the last one expected from [the noble English]126-the english , [she]76-mrs. fisher went through item after item , requiring and persisting till [she]76-mrs. fisher got them , explanations . There were no explanations , except that [Costanza]106-costanza had had one glorious week of doing exactly as [she]106-costanza chose , of splendid unbridled licence , and that this was the result . [Costanza]106-costanza , having no explanations , wept . It was miserable to think [she]106-costanza would have to cook from now on under watchfulness , under suspicion ; and what would [[her]106-costanza relations]1028-her relations say when [they]1028-her relations found the orders [they]1028-her relations received were whittled down ? [They]1028-her relations would say [she]106-costanza had no influence ; [they]1028-her relations would despise [her]106-costanza . [Costanza]106-costanza wept , but [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher was unmoved . In slow and splendid Italian , with the roll of the cantos of theInferno , [she]76-mrs. fisher informed [her]106-costanza that [she]76-mrs. fisher would pay no bills till the following week , and that meanwhile the food was to be precisely as good as ever , and at a quarter the cost . [Costanza]106-costanza threw up [her]106-costanza hands . Next week , proceeded [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher unmoved , if [she]76-mrs. fisher found this had been so [she]76-mrs. fisher would pay the whole . Otherwise — [she]76-mrs. fisher paused ; for what [she]76-mrs. fisher would do otherwise [she]76-mrs. fisher did not know [herself]76-mrs. fisher . But [she]76-mrs. fisher paused and looked impenetrable , majestic and menacing , and [Costanza]106-costanza was cowed . Then [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , having dismissed [her]106-costanza with a gesture , went in search of [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline to complain . [She]76-mrs. fisher had been under the impression that [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline ordered the meals and therefore was responsible for the prices , but now it appeared that [the cook]2701-the cook had been left to do exactly as [she]2701-the cook pleased ever since [they]1869-they got [there]207-there , which of course was simply disgraceful . [Scrap]108-scrap was not in [[her]76-mrs. fisher bedroom]1056-her bedroom , but [the room]214-the room , on [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ’s opening the door , for [she]76-mrs. fisher suspected [her]76-mrs. fisher of being in [it]214-the room and only pretending not to hear the knock , was still flowerlike from [her]76-mrs. fisher presence . “ Scent , ”[76-mrs. fisher] sniffed [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , shutting it again ; and [she]76-mrs. fisher wished [Carlyle]77-carlyle could have had five minutes ’ straight talk with [this young woman]1873-this young woman . And yet — perhaps even [he]77-carlyle — [She]76-mrs. fisher went [downstairs]1756-downstairs to go into [the garden]507-the garden in search of [her]1873-this young woman , and in [the hall]334-the hall encountered [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins . [He]54-mr. wilkins had [his]54-mr. wilkins hat on , and was lighting a cigar . Indulgent as [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher felt towards [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , and peculiarly and even mystically related after the previous morning ’s encounter , [she]76-mrs. fisher yet could not like a cigar in [the house]404-the house . Out of doors [she]76-mrs. fisher endured it , but it was not necessary , when out of doors was such a big place , to indulge the habit indoors . Even [Mr. Fisher]83-mr. fisher , who had been , [she]76-mrs. fisher should say , [a man originally tenacious of habits]1878-a man originally tenacious of habits , had quite soon after marriage got out of this one . However , [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , snatching off [his]54-mr. wilkins hat on seeing [her]76-mrs. fisher , instantly threw the cigar away . [He]54-mr. wilkins threw it into the water a great jar of arum lilies presumably contained , and [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , aware of the value [men]797-men attach to [their]797-men newly - lit cigars , could not but be impressed by this immediate and magnificentamende honorable . But the cigar did not reach the water . It got caught in the lilies , and smoked on by itself among them , a strange and depraved - looking object . “ Where are [you]76-mrs. fisher going to , [my]54-mr. wilkins prett — ”[54-mr. wilkins] began [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , advancing towards [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ; but [he]54-mr. wilkins broke off just in time . Was it morning spirits impelling [him]54-mr. wilkins to address [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher in the terms of a nursery rhyme ? [He]54-mr. wilkins was n’t even aware that [he]54-mr. wilkins knew the thing . Most strange . What could have put it , at such a moment , into [his]54-mr. wilkins self - possessed head ? [He]54-mr. wilkins felt great respect for [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , and would not for [the world]398-the world have insulted [her]76-mrs. fisher by addressing [her]76-mrs. fisher as [a maid]1881-a maid , pretty or otherwise . [He]54-mr. wilkins wished to stand well with [her]76-mrs. fisher . [She]76-mrs. fisher was [a woman of parts]1882-a woman of parts , and also , [he]54-mr. wilkins suspected , of property . At breakfast [they]1883-they had been most pleasant together , and [he]54-mr. wilkins had been struck by [her]76-mrs. fisher apparent intimacy with [well - known persons]1884-well - known persons . [Victorians]1885-victorians , of course ; but it was restful to talk about [them]1885-victorians after the strain of [[his]54-mr. wilkins brother - in - law]1886-his brother - in - law ’s Georgian parties on [Hampstead Heath]43-hampstead heath . [She]76-mrs. fisher had not , however , noticed . “ [You]76-mrs. fisher are going out , ”[54-mr. wilkins] [he]54-mr. wilkins said very politely , all readiness should [she]76-mrs. fisher confirm [his]54-mr. wilkins assumption to accompany [her]76-mrs. fisher . “ [I]76-mrs. fisher want to find [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline , ”[76-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , going towards the glass door leading into [the top garden]1084-the top garden . “ An agreeable quest , ”[54-mr. wilkins] remarked [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins . “ May [I]54-mr. wilkins assist in the search ? The ground was cut from under [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ’s feet . “ Of course if [you]54-mr. wilkins choose to throw [your]54-mr. wilkins money about — ”[108-scrap] [she]108-scrap said at last , disapproving but immensely relieved , while [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins was rapt in the contemplation of the precious qualities of blue blood . This readiness , for instance , not to trouble about money , this free - handedness — it was not only what [one]229-one admired in [others]307-others , admired in [others]307-others perhaps more than anything else , but it was extraordinarily useful to [the professional classes]1900-the professional classes . When met with it should be encouraged by warmth of reception . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher was not warm . [She]76-mrs. fisher accepted — from which [he]54-mr. wilkins deduced that with [her]76-mrs. fisher wealth went closeness — but [she]76-mrs. fisher accepted grudgingly . Presents were presents , and [one]229-one did not look them in this manner in the mouth , [he]54-mr. wilkins felt ; and if [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline found [her]75-lady caroline pleasure in presenting [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife and [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher with [their]1903-their entire food for a week , it was [their]1903-their part to accept gracefully . [One]229-one should not discourage gifts . On behalf of [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife , then , [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins expressed what [she]238-his wife would wish to express , and remarking to [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline — with a touch of lightness , for so should gifts be accepted in order to avoid embarrassing [the donor]1906-the donor — that [she]238-his wife had in that case been [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife ’s hostess since [her]238-his wife arrival , [he]54-mr. wilkins turned almost gaily to [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher and pointed out that [she]76-mrs. fisher and [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife must now jointly write [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline the customary letter of thanks for hospitality . “ [A Collins]158-collins , ”[54-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , who knew what was necessary in literature . “ [I]54-mr. wilkins prefer the name [Collins]158-collins for such a letter to either that of Board and Lodging or Bread and Butter . Let [us]2897-us call it a [Collins]158-collins . ”[54-mr. wilkins] [Scrap]108-scrap smiled , and held out [her]108-scrap cigarette case . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher could not help being mollified . A way out of waste was going to be found , thanks to [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , and [she]76-mrs. fisher hated waste quite as much as having to pay for it ; also a way was found out of housekeeping . For a moment [she]76-mrs. fisher had thought that if [everybody]2599-everybody tried to force [her]76-mrs. fisher into housekeeping on [her]76-mrs. fisher brief holiday by [their]2599-everybody own indifference ( [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline ) , or inability to speak Italian ( the other two ) , [she]76-mrs. fisher would have to send for [Kate Lumley]135-kate after all . But this was much better , this way of [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins ’s . Really [a most superior man]1910-a most superior man . There was nothing like [an intelligent , not too young man]1911-an intelligent , not too young man for profitable and pleasurable companionship . And so the second week began , and all was harmony . The arrival of [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , instead of , as three of [the party]1920-the party had feared and [the fourth]1921-the fourth had only been protected from fearing by [her]75-lady caroline burning faith in the effect on [him]54-mr. wilkins of [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore , disturbing such harmony as there was , increased it . [He]54-mr. wilkins fitted in . [He]54-mr. wilkins was determined to please , and [he]54-mr. wilkins did please . [He]54-mr. wilkins was most amiable to [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife — not only in public , which [she]238-his wife was used to , but in private , when [he]54-mr. wilkins certainly would n’t have been if [he]54-mr. wilkins had n’t wanted to . [He]54-mr. wilkins did want to . [He]54-mr. wilkins was so much obliged to [her]238-his wife , so much pleased with [her]238-his wife , for making [him]54-mr. wilkins acquainted with [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline , that [he]54-mr. wilkins felt really fond of [her]238-his wife . Also proud ; for there must be , [he]54-mr. wilkins reflected , a good deal more in [her]238-his wife than [he]54-mr. wilkins had supposed , for [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline to have become so intimate with [her]238-his wife and so affectionate . And the more [he]54-mr. wilkins treated [her]238-his wife as though [she]238-his wife were really very nice , the more [Lotty]94-lotty expanded and became really very nice , and the more [he]54-mr. wilkins , affected in [his]54-mr. wilkins turn , became really very nice [himself]54-mr. wilkins ; so that [they]1923-they went round and round , not in a vicious but in a highly virtuous circle . [Positively]159-positively , for [him]54-mr. wilkins , [Mellersh]54-mr. wilkins petted [her]238-his wife . There was at no time much pet in [Mellersh]54-mr. wilkins , because [he]54-mr. wilkins was by nature [a cool man]1924-a cool man ; yet such was the influence on [him]54-mr. wilkins of , as [Lotty]94-lotty supposed , [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore , that in this second week [he]54-mr. wilkins sometimes pinched both [her]238-his wife ears , one after the other , instead of only one ; and [Lotty]94-lotty , marvelling at such rapidly developing affectionateness , wondered what [he]54-mr. wilkins would do , should [he]54-mr. wilkins continue at this rate , in the third week , when [her]238-his wife supply of ears would have come to an end . [He]54-mr. wilkins was particularly nice about [the washstand]1925-the washstand , and genuinely desirous of not taking up too much of the space in [the small bedroom]1926-the small bedroom . Quick to respond , [Lotty]94-lotty was even more desirous not to be in [his]54-mr. wilkins way ; and [the room]214-the room became the scene of many an affectionatecombat de générosité , each of which left [them]1928-them more pleased with [each other]201-each other than ever . [He]54-mr. wilkins did not again have a bath in [the bathroom]1725-the bathroom , though it was mended and ready for [him]54-mr. wilkins , but got up and went down every morning to [the sea]265-the sea , and in spite of the cool nights making the water cold early had [his]54-mr. wilkins dip as [a man]651-a man should , and came up to breakfast rubbing [his]54-mr. wilkins hands and feeling , as [he]54-mr. wilkins told [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , prepared for anything . [Lotty]94-lotty ’s belief in the irresistible influence of the heavenly atmosphere of [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore being thus obviously justified , and [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , whom [Rose]95-rose knew as alarming and [Scrap]108-scrap had pictured as icily unkind , being so evidently [a changed man]1933-a changed man , both [Rose]95-rose and [Scrap]108-scrap began to think there might after all be something in what [Lotty]94-lotty insisted on , and that [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore did work purgingly on the character . [They]1934-they were the more inclined to think so in that [they]1934-they too felt a working going on inside [themselves]1934-they : [they]1934-they felt more cleared , both of [them]1934-they , that second week — [Scrap]108-scrap in [her]95-rose thoughts , many of which were now quite nice thoughts , real amiable ones about [[her]95-rose parents]1082-her parents and [relations]1936-relations , with a glimmer in them of recognition of the extraordinary benefits [she]95-rose had received at the hands of — what ? Fate ? Providence?—anyhow of something , and of how , having received them , [she]95-rose had misused [them]1934-they by failing to be happy ; and [Rose]95-rose in [her]95-rose bosom , which though it still yearned , yearned to some purpose , for [she]95-rose was reaching the conclusion that merely inactively to yearn was no use at all , and that [she]95-rose must either by some means stop [her]95-rose yearning or give it at least a chance — remote , but still a chance — of being quieted by writing to [Frederick]65-frederick and asking [him]65-frederick to come out . If [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins could be changed , thought [Rose]95-rose , why not [Frederick]65-frederick ? How wonderful it would be , how too wonderful , if [the place]422-the place worked on [him]65-frederick too and were able to make [them]1938-them even a little understand [each other]201-each other , even a little be [friends]2611-friends . [Rose]95-rose , so far had loosening and disintegration gone on in [her]95-rose character , now was beginning to think [her]95-rose obstinate strait - lacedness about [his]65-frederick books and [her]95-rose austere absorption in good works had been foolish and perhaps even wrong . [He]65-frederick was [[her]95-rose husband]198-her husband , and [she]95-rose had frightened [him]65-frederick away . [She]95-rose had frightened love away , precious love , and that could n’t be good . Was not [Lotty]94-lotty right when [she]95-rose said the other day that nothing at all except love mattered ? Nothing certainly seemed much use unless it was built up on love . But once frightened away , could it ever come back ? Yes , it might in that beauty , it might in the atmosphere of happiness [Lotty]94-lotty and [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore seemed between [them]1938-them to spread round like some divine infection . [She]95-rose had , however , to get [him]65-frederick [there]207-there first , and [he]65-frederick certainly could n’t be got there if [she]95-rose did n’t write and tell [him]65-frederick where [she]95-rose was . [She]95-rose would write . [She]95-rose must write ; for if [she]95-rose did there was at least a chance of [his]65-frederick coming , and if [she]95-rose did n’t there was manifestly none . And then , once here in this loveliness , with everything so soft and kind and sweet all round , it would be easier to tell [him]65-frederick , to try and explain , to ask for something different , for at least an attempt at something different in [their]1938-them lives in the future , instead of the blankness of separation , the cold — oh , the cold — of nothing at all but the great windiness of faith , the great bleakness of works . Why , [one person in [the world]398-the world]1943-one person in the world , [one single person belonging to [one , of one]1946-one , of one ’s very own]1945-one single person belonging to one , of one ’s very own , to talk to , to take care of , to love , to be interested in , was worth more than all the speeches on platforms and the compliments of chairmen in [the world]398-the world . It was also worth more — [Rose]95-rose could n’t help it , the thought would come — than all the prayers . These thoughts were not head thoughts , like [Scrap]108-scrap ’s , who was altogether free from yearnings , but bosom thoughts . They lodged in the bosom ; it was in the bosom that [Rose]95-rose ached , and felt so dreadfully lonely . And when [her]95-rose courage failed [her]95-rose , as it did on most days , and it seemed impossible to write to [Frederick]65-frederick , [she]95-rose would look at [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins and revive . There [he]65-frederick was , [a changed man]1933-a changed man . There [he]65-frederick was , going into [that small , uncomfortable room]1949-that small , uncomfortable room every night , [that room whose proximities had been [Lotty]94-lotty ’s only misgiving , and coming out of it in the morning]1950-that room whose proximities had been lotty ’s only misgiving , and coming out of it in the morning , and [Lotty]94-lotty coming out of it too , both of [them]1951-them as unclouded and as nice to [each other]201-each other as when [they]1951-them went in . And had n’t [he]65-frederick , so critical at [home]215-home , [Lotty]94-lotty had told [her]95-rose , of the least thing going wrong , emerged from the bath catastrophe as untouched in spirit as [Shadrach]160-shadrach , [Meshach]161-meshach and [Abednego]162-abednego were untouched in body when [they]1954-they emerged from the fire ? Miracles were happening in [this place]2743-this place . If [they]1956-they could happen to [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , why not to [Frederick]65-frederick ? [She]95-rose got up quickly . Yes , [she]95-rose would write . [She]95-rose would go and write to [him]65-frederick at once . But suppose — [She]95-rose paused . Suppose [he]65-frederick did n’t answer . Suppose [he]65-frederick did n’t even answer . And [she]95-rose sat down again to think a little longer . In these hesitations did [Rose]95-rose spend most of the second week . Then there was [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher . [Her]76-mrs. fisher restlessness increased that second week . It increased to such an extent that [she]76-mrs. fisher might just as well not have had [[her]76-mrs. fisher private sitting - room]1335-her private sitting - room at all , for [she]76-mrs. fisher could no longer sit . Not for ten minutes together could [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher sit . And added to the restlessness , as the days of the second week proceeded on their way , [she]76-mrs. fisher had a curious sensation , which worried [her]76-mrs. fisher , of rising sap . [She]76-mrs. fisher knew the feeling , because [she]76-mrs. fisher had sometimes had it in childhood in [specially swift springs]1958-specially swift springs , when the lilacs and the syringas seemed to rush out into blossom in a single night , but it was strange to have it again after over fifty years . [She]76-mrs. fisher would have liked to remark on the sensation to [some one]751-some one , but [she]76-mrs. fisher was ashamed . It was such an absurd sensation at [her]76-mrs. fisher age . Yet oftener and oftener , and every day more and more , did [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher have a ridiculous feeling as if [she]76-mrs. fisher were presently going to burgeon . Sternly [she]76-mrs. fisher tried to frown the unseemly sensation down . Burgeon , indeed . [She]76-mrs. fisher had heard of dried staffs , pieces of mere dead wood , suddenly putting forth fresh leaves , but only in legend . [She]76-mrs. fisher was not in legend . [She]76-mrs. fisher knew perfectly what was due to [herself]76-mrs. fisher . [Dignity]145-dignity demanded that [she]76-mrs. fisher should have nothing to do with fresh leaves at [her]76-mrs. fisher age ; and yet there it was — the feeling that presently , that at any moment now , [she]76-mrs. fisher might crop out all green . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher was upset . There were many things [she]76-mrs. fisher disliked more than anything else , and one was when [the elderly]1960-the elderly imagined [they]1960-the elderly felt young and behaved accordingly . Of course [they]1960-the elderly only imagined it , [they]1960-the elderly were only deceiving [themselves]1960-the elderly ; but how deplorable were the results . [She]76-mrs. fisher [herself]76-mrs. fisher had grown old as [people]274-people should grow old — steadily and firmly . No interruptions , no belated after - glows and spasmodic returns . If , after all these years , [she]76-mrs. fisher were now going to be deluded into some sort of unsuitable breaking - out , how humiliating . Indeed [she]76-mrs. fisher was thankful , that second week , that [Kate Lumley]135-kate was not there . It would be most unpleasant , should anything different occur in [her]76-mrs. fisher behaviour , to have [Kate]135-kate looking on . [Kate]135-kate had known [her]76-mrs. fisher all [her]135-kate life . [She]135-kate felt [she]135-kate could let [herself]135-kate go — here [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher frowned at the book [she]76-mrs. fisher was vainly trying to concentrate on , for where did that expression come from?—much less painfully before [strangers]322-strangers than before [an old friend]1963-an old friend . [Old friends]1964-old friends , reflected [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , who hoped [she]76-mrs. fisher was reading , compare [one]229-one constantly with what [one]229-one used to be . [They]1964-old friends are always doing it if [one]229-one develops . [They]1964-old friends are surprised at development . [They]1964-old friends hark back ; [they]1964-old friends expect motionlessness after , say , fifty , to the end of one ’s days . That , thought [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , [her]76-mrs. fisher eyes going steadily line by line down the page and not a word of it getting through into [her]76-mrs. fisher consciousness , is foolish of [friends]2611-friends . It is condemning [one]229-one to a premature death . [One]229-one should continue ( of course with dignity ) to develop , however old one may be . [She]76-mrs. fisher had nothing against developing , against further ripeness , because as long as [one]229-one was alive [one]229-one was not dead — obviously , decided [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , and development , change , ripening , were life . What [she]76-mrs. fisher would dislike would be unripening , going back to something green . [She]76-mrs. fisher would dislike it intensely ; and this is what [she]76-mrs. fisher felt [she]76-mrs. fisher was on the brink of doing . Naturally it made [her]76-mrs. fisher very uneasy , and only in constant movement could [she]76-mrs. fisher find distraction . Increasingly restless and no longer able to confine [herself]76-mrs. fisher to [her]76-mrs. fisher battlements , [she]76-mrs. fisher wandered more and more frequently , and also aimlessly , in and out of [the top garden]1084-the top garden , to the growing surprise of [Scrap]108-scrap , especially when [she]76-mrs. fisher found that all [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher did was to stare for a few minutes at the view , pick a few dead leaves off the rose - bushes , and go away again . In [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins ’s conversation [she]76-mrs. fisher found temporary relief , but though [he]54-mr. wilkins joined [her]76-mrs. fisher whenever [he]54-mr. wilkins could [he]54-mr. wilkins was not always there , for [he]54-mr. wilkins spread [his]54-mr. wilkins attentions judiciously among [the three ladies]1843-the three ladies , and when [he]54-mr. wilkins was [somewhere else]1975-somewhere else [she]76-mrs. fisher had to face and manage [her]76-mrs. fisher thoughts as best [she]76-mrs. fisher could by [herself]76-mrs. fisher . Perhaps it was the excess of light and colour at [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore which made [every other place]1976-every other place seem dark and black ; and [Prince of Wales Terrace]18-prince of wales terrace did seem [a very dark black spot to have to go]1977-a very dark black spot to have to go back to — [a dark , narrow street]1978-a dark , narrow street , and [[her]76-mrs. fisher house]377-her house dark and narrow as [the street]1718-the street , with nothing really living or young in [it]377-her house . [The goldfish]163-the goldfish could hardly be called living , or at most not more than half living , and were certainly not young , and except for [them]1981-them there were only [the maids]1982-the maids , and [they]1981-them were dusty old things . Dusty old things . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher paused in [her]76-mrs. fisher thoughts , arrested by the strange expression . Where had it come from ? How was it possible for it to come at all ? It might have been one of [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ’s , in its levity , its almost slang . Perhaps it was one of [hers]76-mrs. fisher , and [she]76-mrs. fisher had heard [her]76-mrs. fisher say it and unconsciously caught it from [her]76-mrs. fisher . If so , this was both serious and disgusting . That [the foolish creature]1983-the foolish creature should penetrate into [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ’s very mind and establish [her]76-mrs. fisher personality there , the personality which was still , in spite of the harmony apparently existing between [her]76-mrs. fisher and [[her]76-mrs. fisher intelligent husband]1984-her intelligent husband , so alien to [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ’s own , so far removed from what [she]76-mrs. fisher understood and liked , and infect [her]76-mrs. fisher with [her]76-mrs. fisher undesirable phrases , was most disturbing . Never in [her]76-mrs. fisher life before had such a sentence come into [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher ’s head . Never in [her]76-mrs. fisher life before had [she]76-mrs. fisher thought of [[her]76-mrs. fisher maids]1985-her maids , or of [anybody else]1559-anybody else , as dusty old things . [[Her]76-mrs. fisher maids]1985-her maids were not dusty old things ; [they]1985-her maids were [most respectable , neat women , who were allowed the use of the bathroom every Saturday night]1988-most respectable , neat women , who were allowed the use of the bathroom every saturday night . [Elderly]1989-elderly , certainly , but then so was [she]76-mrs. fisher , so was [[her]76-mrs. fisher house]377-her house , so was [her]76-mrs. fisher furniture , so were [her]76-mrs. fisher goldfish . [They]1991-they were all elderly , as [they]1991-they should be , together . But there was a great difference between being elderly and being a dusty old thing . How true it was what [Ruskin]101-ruskin said , that evil communications corrupt good manners . But did [Ruskin]101-ruskin say it ? On second thoughts [she]76-mrs. fisher was not sure , but it was just the sort of thing [he]1992-he would have said if [he]1992-he had said it , and in any case it was true . Merely hearing [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins ’s evil communications at meals — [she]76-mrs. fisher did not listen , [she]76-mrs. fisher avoided listening , yet it was evident [she]76-mrs. fisher had heard — those communications which , in that they so often were at once vulgar , indelicate and profane , and always , [she]76-mrs. fisher was sorry to say , laughed at by [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline , must be classed as evil , was spoiling [her]76-mrs. fisher own mental manners . Soon [she]76-mrs. fisher might not only think but say . How terrible that would be . If that were the form [her]76-mrs. fisher breaking - out was going to take , the form of unseemly speech , [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher was afraid [she]76-mrs. fisher would hardly with any degree of composure be able to bear it . At this stage [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher wished more than ever that [she]76-mrs. fisher were able to talk over [her]76-mrs. fisher strange feelings with [some one who would understand]1993-some one who would understand . There was , however , [no one who would understand except [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins [herself]53-mrs. wilkins]1994-no one who would understand except mrs. wilkins herself . [She]53-mrs. wilkins would . [She]53-mrs. wilkins would know at once , [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher was sure , what [she]53-mrs. wilkins felt like . But this was impossible . It would be as abject as begging the very microbe that was infecting one for protection against its disease . [She]53-mrs. wilkins continued , accordingly , to bear [her]53-mrs. wilkins sensations in silence , and was driven by [them]1995-them into that frequent aimless appearing in the top garden which presently roused even [Scrap]108-scrap ’s attention . [Scrap]108-scrap had noticed it , and vaguely wondered at it , for some time before [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins inquired of [her]53-mrs. wilkins one morning as [he]54-mr. wilkins arranged [her]53-mrs. wilkins cushions for [her]53-mrs. wilkins — [he]54-mr. wilkins had established the daily assisting of [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline into [her]53-mrs. wilkins chair as [his]54-mr. wilkins special privilege — whether there was anything the matter with [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher . [He]54-mr. wilkins was all respectfulness . [She]2001-she could direct [his]54-mr. wilkins movements in regard to [herself]2001-she with the raising of an eyelash . [She]2001-she did not forget [his]54-mr. wilkins moving defencelessness the first morning in [his]54-mr. wilkins towel , and [he]54-mr. wilkins amused [her]2001-she , and [he]54-mr. wilkins was kind to [Lotty]94-lotty . Certainly [he]54-mr. wilkins did seem to be [one of those men , rare in [her]2001-she experience , who never looked at [a woman from the predatory angle]2006-a woman from the predatory angle]2005-one of those men , rare in her experience , who never looked at a woman from the predatory angle . The comfort of this , the simplification it brought into the relations of [the party]1920-the party , was immense . From this point of view [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins was simply ideal ; [he]54-mr. wilkins was unique and precious . Whenever [she]2001-she thought of [him]54-mr. wilkins , and was perhaps inclined to dwell on the aspects of [him]54-mr. wilkins that were a little boring , [she]2001-she remembered this and murmured , “ But what a treasure . ”[2001-she] Indeed it was [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins ’s one aim during [his]54-mr. wilkins stay at [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore to be a treasure . At all costs [the three ladies who were not [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife]2008-the three ladies who were not his wife must like [him]54-mr. wilkins and trust [him]54-mr. wilkins . Ladies with something on [their]2008-the three ladies who were not his wife minds were exactly what [he]54-mr. wilkins wanted . [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline , [he]54-mr. wilkins judged , had nothing on [hers]75-lady caroline at the moment , but so much beauty — for [he]54-mr. wilkins could not but see what was evident — must have had its difficulties in the past and would have more of them before it had done . In the past [he]54-mr. wilkins had not been at hand ; in the future [he]54-mr. wilkins hoped to be . And meanwhile the behaviour of [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , the next in importance of [the ladies from the professional point of view]2010-the ladies from the professional point of view , showed definite promise . It was almost certain that [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher had something on [her]76-mrs. fisher mind . [He]54-mr. wilkins had been observing [her]76-mrs. fisher attentively , and it was almost certain . With the third , with [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , [he]54-mr. wilkins had up to this made least headway , for [she]76-mrs. fisher was so very retiring and quiet . But might not this very retiringness , this tendency to avoid [the others]949-the others and spend [her]76-mrs. fisher time alone , indicate that [she]76-mrs. fisher too was troubled ? If so , [he]54-mr. wilkins was [[her]76-mrs. fisher man]2012-her man . [He]54-mr. wilkins would cultivate [her]76-mrs. fisher . [Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , [he]54-mr. wilkins understood from [Lotty]94-lotty , was [a British Museum official]2013-a british museum official — nothing specially important at present , but [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins regarded it as [his]54-mr. wilkins business to know all sorts and kinds . Besides , there was promotion . [Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , promoted , might become very much worth while . As for [Lotty]94-lotty , [she]94-lotty was charming . [She]94-lotty really had all the qualities [he]54-mr. wilkins had credited [her]94-lotty with during [his]54-mr. wilkins courtship , and [they]2014-they had been , it appeared , merely in abeyance since . [His]54-mr. wilkins early impressions of [her]94-lotty were now being endorsed by the affection and even admiration [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline showed for [her]94-lotty . [Lady Caroline Dester]75-lady caroline was [the last person]2015-the last person , [he]54-mr. wilkins was sure , to be mistaken on such a subject . [A man in [his]54-mr. wilkins profession]2017-a man in his profession could be immensely helped by [a clever and attractive wife]2018-a clever and attractive wife . Why had [she]94-lotty not been attractive sooner ? Why this sudden flowering ? [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins began too to believe there was something peculiar , as [Lotty]94-lotty had almost at once informed [him]54-mr. wilkins , in the atmosphere of [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore . [It]2019-it promoted expansion . [It]2019-it brought out dormant qualities . And feeling more and more pleased , and even charmed , by [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife , and very content with the progress [he]54-mr. wilkins was making with [the two others]1204-the two others , and hopeful of progress to be made with the retiring third , [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins could not remember ever having had such an agreeable holiday . The only thing that might perhaps be bettered was the way [they]2022-they would call [him]54-mr. wilkins [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins . [Nobody]225-nobody said [Mr. Mellersh - Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins . Yet [he]54-mr. wilkins had introduced [himself]54-mr. wilkins to [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline — [he]54-mr. wilkins flinched a little on remembering the circumstances — as [Mellersh - Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins . Still , this was a small matter , not enough to worry about . [He]54-mr. wilkins would be foolish if in such a place and such society [he]54-mr. wilkins worried about anything . [He]54-mr. wilkins was not even worrying about what the holiday was costing , and had made up [his]54-mr. wilkins mind to pay not only [his]54-mr. wilkins own expenses but [[his]54-mr. wilkins wife]238-his wife ’s as well , and surprise [her]238-his wife at the end by presenting [her]238-his wife with [her]238-his wife nest - egg as intact as when [she]238-his wife started ; and just the knowledge that [he]54-mr. wilkins was preparing a happy surprise for [her]238-his wife made [him]54-mr. wilkins feel warmer than ever towards [her]238-his wife . In fact [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , who had begun by being consciously and according to plan on [his]54-mr. wilkins best behaviour , remained on it unconsciously , and with no effort at all . And meanwhile the beautiful golden days were dropping gently from the second week one by one , equal in beauty with those of the first , and the scent of beanfields in flower on [the hillside behind [the village]604-the village]2025-the hillside behind the village came across to [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore whenever the air moved . In [the garden]507-the garden that second week [the poet]2028-the poet ’s eyed narcissus disappeared out [the long grass at the edge of the zigzag path]2029-the long grass at the edge of the zigzag path , and wild gladiolus , slender and rose - coloured , came in [their]2030-their stead , white pinks bloomed in the borders , filling [the whole place]685-the whole place with their smoky - sweet smell , and a bush [nobody]225-nobody had noticed burst into glory and fragrance , and it was a purple lilac bush . Such a jumble of spring and summer was not to be believed in , except by [those who dwelt in [those gardens]2034-those gardens]2033-those who dwelt in those gardens . Everything seemed to be out together — all the things crowded into one month which in [England]16-england are spread penuriously over six . Even primroses were found one day by [Mrs. Wilkins]53-mrs. wilkins in [a cold corner up in [the hills]965-the hills]2035-a cold corner up in the hills ; and when [she]53-mrs. wilkins brought [them]2037-them down to [the geraniums and heliotrope of [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore]2038-the geraniums and heliotrope of san salvatore [they]2037-them looked quite shy .

On the first day of the third week [Rose]95-rose wrote to [Frederick]65-frederick . In case [she]95-rose should again hesitate and not post the letter , [she]95-rose gave it to [Domenico]88-domenico to post ; for if [she]95-rose did not write now there would be no time left at all . Half the month at [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore was over . Even if [Frederick]65-frederick started directly [he]65-frederick got the letter , which of course [he]65-frederick would n’t be able to do , what with packing and passport , besides not being in a hurry to come , [he]65-frederick could n’t arrive for five days . Having done it , [Rose]95-rose wished [she]95-rose had n’t . [He]65-frederick would n’t come . [He]65-frederick would n’t bother to answer . And if [he]65-frederick did answer , it would just be giving some reason which was not true , and about being too busy to get away ; and all that had been got by writing to [him]65-frederick would be that [she]95-rose would be more unhappy than before . What things [one]229-one did when [one]229-one was idle . This resurrection of [Frederick]65-frederick , or rather this attempt to resurrect [him]65-frederick , what was it but the result of having nothing whatever to do ? [She]95-rose wished [she]95-rose had never come away on a holiday . What did [she]95-rose want with holidays ? Work was [her]95-rose salvation ; work was the only thing that protected [one]229-one , that kept [one]229-one steady and [one]229-one ’s values true . At [home]215-home in [Hampstead]4-hampstead , absorbed and busy , [she]95-rose had managed to get over [Frederick]65-frederick , thinking of [him]65-frederick latterly only with the gentle melancholy with which [one]229-one thinks of some one once loved but long since dead ; and now [this place]2743-this place , idleness in [this soft place]2047-this soft place , had thrown [her]95-rose back to the wretched state [she]95-rose had climbed so carefully out of years ago . Why , if [Frederick]65-frederick did come [she]95-rose would only bore [him]65-frederick . Had n’t [she]95-rose seen in a flash quite soon after getting to [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore that that was really what kept [him]65-frederick away from [her]95-rose ? And why should [she]95-rose suppose that now , after such a long estrangement , [she]95-rose would be able not to bore [him]65-frederick , be able to do anything but stand before [him]65-frederick like [a tongue - tied idiot]2048-a tongue - tied idiot , with all the fingers of [her]95-rose spirit turned into thumbs ? Besides , what a hopeless position , to have as it were to beseech : Please wait a little — please do n’t be impatient — [I]0-i think perhaps [I]0-i sha n’t be [a bore presently]2049-a bore presently . A thousand times a day [Rose]95-rose wished [she]95-rose had let [Frederick]65-frederick alone . [Lotty]94-lotty , who asked [her]95-rose every evening whether [she]95-rose had sent [her]95-rose letter yet , exclaimed with delight when the answer at last was yes , and threw [her]94-lotty arms round [her]95-rose . “ Now [we]2903-we shall becompletelyhappy ! ”[94-lotty] cried [the enthusiastic Lotty]94-lotty . But nothing seemed less certain to [Rose]95-rose , and [her]95-rose expression became more and more the expression of [one who has something on [her]2050-one who has something on her mind mind]2050-one who has something on her mind . [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , wanting to find out what it was , strolled in the sun in [his]54-mr. wilkins Panama hat , and began to meet [her]95-rose accidentally . “ [I]54-mr. wilkins did not know , ”[54-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins the first time , courteously raising [his]54-mr. wilkins hat , “ that [you]95-rose too liked [this particular spot]2904-this particular spot . ”[54-mr. wilkins] And [he]54-mr. wilkins sat down beside [her]95-rose . In the afternoon [she]95-rose chose another spot ; and [she]95-rose had not been in [it]2051-it half an hour before [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , lightly swinging [his]54-mr. wilkins cane , came round the corner . “ [We]2905-we are destined to meet in [[our]2905-we rambles]2906-our rambles , ”[54-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins pleasantly . And [he]54-mr. wilkins sat down beside [her]95-rose . [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins was very kind , and [she]95-rose had , [she]95-rose saw , misjudged [him]54-mr. wilkins in [Hampstead]4-hampstead , and this was [the real man]2052-the real man , ripened like fruit by the beneficent sun of [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore , but [Rose]95-rose did want to be alone . Still , [she]95-rose was grateful to [him]54-mr. wilkins for proving to [her]95-rose that though [she]95-rose might bore [Frederick]65-frederick [she]95-rose did not bore [everybody]2599-everybody ; if [she]95-rose had , [he]54-mr. wilkins would not have sat talking to [her]95-rose on each occasion till it was time to go in . True [he]54-mr. wilkins bored [her]95-rose , but that was n’t anything like so dreadful as if [she]95-rose bored [him]54-mr. wilkins . Then indeed [her]95-rose vanity would have been sadly ruffled . For now that [Rose]95-rose was not able to say [her]95-rose prayers [she]95-rose was being assailed by every sort of weakness : vanity , sensitiveness , irritability , pugnacity — strange , unfamiliar devils to have coming crowding on one and taking possession of one ’s swept and empty heart . [She]95-rose had never been vain or irritable or pugnacious in [her]95-rose life before . Could it be that [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore was capable of opposite effects , and the same sun that ripened [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins made [her]95-rose go acid ? The next morning , so as to be sure of being alone , [she]95-rose went down , while [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins was still lingering pleasantly with [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher over breakfast , to the rocks by [the water]678-the water ’s edge where [she]95-rose and [Lotty]94-lotty had sat the first day . [Frederick]65-frederick by now had got [her]95-rose letter . To - day , if [he]65-frederick were like [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , [she]95-rose might get a telegram from [him]65-frederick . [She]95-rose tried to silence the absurd hope by jeering at it . Yet — if [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins had telegraphed , why not [Frederick]65-frederick ? The spell of [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore lurked even , it seemed , in notepaper . [Lotty]94-lotty had not dreamed of getting a telegram , and when [she]94-lotty came in at lunch - time there it was . It would be too wonderful if when [she]94-lotty went back at lunch - time [she]94-lotty found one there for [her]94-lotty too . . . [Rose]95-rose clasped [her]95-rose hands tight round [her]95-rose knees . How passionately [she]95-rose longed to be important to [somebody]980-somebody again — not important on platforms , not important as an asset in [an organisation]2056-an organisation , but privately important , just to [one other person]2057-one other person , quite privately , [nobody else to know or notice]2058-nobody else to know or notice . It did n’t seem much to ask in a world so crowded with [people]274-people , just to have [one of [them]274-people]401-one of them , only one out of all the millions , to [oneself]2061-oneself . [Somebody who needed one]2062-somebody who needed one , who thought of one , who was eager to come to one — oh , ohhow dreadfully one wanted to be precious ! All the morning [she]94-lotty sat beneath the pine - tree by [the sea]265-the sea . [Nobody]225-nobody came near [her]94-lotty . The great hours passed slowly ; they seemed enormous . But [she]94-lotty would n’t go up before lunch , [she]94-lotty would give the telegram time to arrive . . . That day [Scrap]108-scrap , egged on by [Lotty]94-lotty ’s persuasions and also thinking that perhaps [she]94-lotty had sat long enough , had arisen from [her]94-lotty chair and cushions and gone off with [Lotty]94-lotty and sandwiches up into [the hills]965-the hills till evening . [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , who wished to go with [them]2066-them , stayed on [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline ’s advice with [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher in order to cheer [her]76-mrs. fisher solitude , and though [he]54-mr. wilkins left off cheering [her]76-mrs. fisher about eleven to go and look for [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher , so as for a space to cheer [her]76-mrs. fisher too , thus dividing [himself]54-mr. wilkins impartially between [these solitary ladies]2067-these solitary ladies , [he]54-mr. wilkins came back again presently mopping [his]54-mr. wilkins forehead and continued with [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher where [he]54-mr. wilkins had left off , for this time [Mrs. Arbuthnot]76-mrs. fisher had hidden successfully . [It]2922-your house ’s [yours]73-rose . ”[112-thomas briggs] “ Till Monday week , ”[73-rose] [she]73-rose smiled . “ Come and show [me]112-thomas briggs all the views , ”[112-thomas briggs] [he]112-thomas briggs said eagerly ; and it was plain , even to [the self - depreciatory [Rose]73-rose]2113-the self - depreciatory rose , that [she]73-rose did not bore [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs .

[They]2114-they had a very pleasant walk , with a great deal of sitting down in warm , thyme - fragrant corners , and if anything could have helped [Rose]73-rose to recover from the bitter disappointment of the morning it would have been the company and conversation of [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs . [He]112-thomas briggs did help [her]73-rose to recover , and the same process took place as that which [Lotty]94-lotty had undergone with [[her]94-lotty husband]198-her husband , and the more [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs thought [Rose]73-rose charming the more charming [she]73-rose became . [Briggs]72-briggs was [a man incapable of concealments , who never lost time if [he]72-briggs could help it]2116-a man incapable of concealments , who never lost time if he could help it . [They]2114-they had not got to [the end of [the headland where the lighthouse]2118-the headland where the lighthouse is]2117-the end of the headland where the lighthouse is — [Briggs]72-briggs asked [her]73-rose to show [him]72-briggs [the lighthouse]2119-the lighthouse , because the path to [it]2119-the lighthouse , [he]72-briggs knew , was wide enough for two to walk abreast and fairly level — before [he]72-briggs had told [her]73-rose of the impression [she]73-rose had made on [him]72-briggs in [London]3-london . Since [even the most religious , sober women]2120-even the most religious , sober women like to know [they]2120-even the most religious , sober women have made an impression , particularly the kind that has nothing to do with character or merits , [Rose]73-rose was pleased . Being pleased , [she]73-rose smiled . Smiling , [she]73-rose was more attractive than ever . Colour came into [her]73-rose cheeks , and brightness into [her]73-rose eyes . [She]73-rose heard [herself]73-rose saying things that really sounded quite interesting and even amusing . If [Frederick]65-frederick were listening now , [she]73-rose thought , perhaps [he]65-frederick would see that [she]73-rose could n’t after all be such [a hopeless bore]2121-a hopeless bore ; for here was [a man]651-a man , nice - looking , young , and surely clever — [he]651-a man seemed clever , and [she]73-rose hoped [he]651-a man was , for then the compliment would be still greater — who was evidently quite happy to spend the afternoon just talking to [her]73-rose . And indeed [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs seemed very much interested . [He]72-briggs wanted to hear all about everything [she]73-rose had been doing from the moment [she]73-rose got [there]207-there . [He]72-briggs asked [her]73-rose if [she]73-rose had seen this , that , and the other in [the house]404-the house , what [she]73-rose liked best , which room [she]73-rose had , if [she]73-rose were comfortable , if [Francesca]99-francesca was behaving , if [Domenico]88-domenico took care of [her]73-rose , and whether [she]73-rose did n’t enjoy using [the yellow sitting - room]2125-the yellow sitting - room — the one that got all the sun and looked out towards [Genoa]28-genoa . [Rose]73-rose was ashamed how little [she]73-rose had noticed in [the house]404-the house , and how few of the things [he]72-briggs spoke of as curious or beautiful in it [she]73-rose had even seen . Swamped in thoughts of [Frederick]65-frederick , [she]73-rose appeared to have lived in [San Salvatore blindly]14-san salvatore , and more than half the time had gone , and what had been the good of it ? [She]73-rose might just as well have been sitting hankering on [Hampstead Heath]43-hampstead heath . No , [she]73-rose might n’t ; through all [her]73-rose hankerings [she]73-rose had been conscious that [she]73-rose was at least in the very heart of beauty ; and indeed it was this beauty , this longing to share it , that had first started [her]73-rose off hankering . [Briggs]72-briggs walked by [her]73-rose side along [his]72-briggs paths that were yet so happily for the moment [her]73-rose paths , and felt all the innocent glows of family life . It was natural , [she]76-mrs. fisher being so strange , that [one]229-one should have , perhaps , misjudged [her]76-mrs. fisher . . . “ [I]72-briggs ’m sure [you]94-lotty want some tea , ”[72-briggs] said [Briggs]72-briggs with eager hospitality to [Lotty]94-lotty . [He]72-briggs thought [her]94-lotty delightful,—freckles , picnic - untidiness and all . [Just such a sister]2193-just such a sister would [he]72-briggs — “ This is cold , ”[72-briggs] [he]72-briggs said , feeling the teapot . “ [I]72-briggs ’ll tell [Francesca]99-francesca to make [you]94-lotty some fresh — ”[72-briggs] [He]72-briggs broke off and blushed . “ Are n’t [I]72-briggs forgetting [myself]72-briggs , ”[72-briggs] [he]72-briggs said , laughing and looking round at [them]2194-them . “ Very natural , very natural , ”[72-briggs] [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins reassured [him]72-briggs . “ [I]73-rose ’ll go and tell [Francesca]99-francesca , ”[73-rose] said [Rose]73-rose , getting up . “ No , no , ”[72-briggs] said [Briggs]72-briggs . “ Do n’t go away . ”[72-briggs] And [he]72-briggs put [his]72-briggs hands to [his]72-briggs mouth and shouted . “ [Francesca]99-francesca ! ”[72-briggs] shouted [Briggs]72-briggs . [She]2195-her came running . [Kate Lumley]135-kate might get into it , but that was about all . Once in , [she]135-kate would fit it so tightly that probably [she]135-kate would never be able to get out again . It was entirely at [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs ’s disposal , and [she]76-mrs. fisher hoped [he]72-briggs would do nothing so absurd as go to [an hotel]1148-an hotel — [he]72-briggs , [the owner of [the whole place]685-the whole place]2204-the owner of the whole place . And then when [she]2207-the daughter of the droitwiches herself spoke . . . what chance was there for [poor Briggs]72-briggs ? [He]72-briggs was undone . All [Scrap]108-scrap said was , “ How do [you]72-briggs do , ”[108-scrap] on [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins presenting [him]72-briggs , but it was enough ; it undid [Briggs]72-briggs . [His]72-briggs eyes could not keep off the enchanting face for a moment ; and when [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , elucidating [him]72-briggs , for [he]72-briggs failed to elucidate [himself]72-briggs , informed [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline that in [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs [she]75-lady caroline beheld [the owner of [San Salvatore]14-san salvatore]2209-the owner of san salvatore , who was on [his]2209-the owner of san salvatore way to [Rome]45-rome , but had got out at [Mezzago]30-mezzago , etc . etc . , and that [the other three ladies]2210-the other three ladies had invited [him]72-briggs to spend the night in what was to all intents and purposes [[his]72-briggs own house]2211-his own house rather than [an hotel]1148-an hotel , and [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs was only waiting for the seal of [her]75-lady caroline approval to this invitation , [she]75-lady caroline being [the fourth hostess]2213-the fourth hostess — when [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins , balancing [his]54-mr. wilkins sentences and being admirably clear and enjoying the sound of [his]54-mr. wilkins own cultured voice , explained the position in this manner to [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline , [Briggs]72-briggs sat and said never a word . A deep melancholy invaded [Scrap]108-scrap . [A nice good ghost]2226-a nice good ghost , of course , and still with a pretty name , but only a ghost . [He]72-briggs turned from [her]2225-the sweet - named lady to [Scrap]108-scrap again , and forgot [Rose Arbuthnot]73-rose ’s existence . How was it possible for [him]72-briggs to bother about [anybody]196-anybody or anything else in this first moment of being face to face with [his]72-briggs dream come true ? [Briggs]72-briggs had not supposed or hoped that any one as beautiful as [his]72-briggs dream of beauty existed . [He]72-briggs had never till now met even [an approximation]2228-an approximation . It was a sad sight to see the collapse of [Briggs]72-briggs . [Everybody]2599-everybody noticed it , even [Rose]73-rose . “ Upon [my]76-mrs. fisher word , ”[76-mrs. fisher] thought [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , “ the way [one pretty face]2977-one pretty face can turn [a delightful man]2978-a delightful man into [an idiot]2979-an idiot is past all patience . ”[76-mrs. fisher] And feeling the air getting chilly , and the sight of the enthralled [Briggs]72-briggs painful , [she]76-mrs. fisher went in to order [[his]72-briggs room]2238-his room to be got ready , regretting now that [she]76-mrs. fisher had pressed [the poor boy]2239-the poor boy to stay . [She]76-mrs. fisher had forgotten [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline ’s kill - joy face for the moment , and the more completely owing to the absence of any ill effects produced by it on [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins . [Poor boy]2240-poor boy . Such [a charming boy]2241-a charming boy too , left to [himself]2240-poor boy . It was true [she]76-mrs. fisher could not accuse [Lady Caroline]75-lady caroline of not leaving [him]72-briggs to [himself]72-briggs , for [she]76-mrs. fisher was taking no notice of [him]72-briggs at all , but that did not help . Exactly like foolish moths did [men]797-men , in other respects intelligent , flutter round the impassive lighted candle of a pretty face . [She]76-mrs. fisher had seen [them]797-men doing it . [She]76-mrs. fisher had looked on only too often . Almost [she]76-mrs. fisher laid a motherly hand on [Briggs]72-briggs ’s fair head as [she]76-mrs. fisher passed [him]72-briggs . [Poor boy]2240-poor boy . Then [Scrap]108-scrap , having finished [her]108-scrap cigarette , got up and went [indoors]2244-indoors too . [She]108-scrap saw no reason why [she]108-scrap should sit there in order to gratify [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs ’s desire to stare . [She]108-scrap would have liked to stay out longer , to go to [her]108-scrap corner behind the daphne bushes and look at the sunset sky and watch the lights coming out one by one in [the village]604-the village below and smell the sweet moistness of the evening , but if [she]108-scrap did [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs would certainly follow [her]108-scrap . The old familiar tyranny had begun again . [Her]76-mrs. fisher holiday of peace and liberation was interrupted — perhaps over , for who knew if [he]72-briggs would go away , after all , to - morrow ? [He]72-briggs might leave [the house]404-the house , driven out of [it]404-the house by [Kate Lumley]135-kate , but there was nothing to prevent [his]72-briggs taking rooms in [the village]604-the village and coming up every day . This tyranny of [one person]2248-one person over another ! And [she]76-mrs. fisher was so miserably constructed that [she]76-mrs. fisher would n’t even be able to frown [him]72-briggs down without being misunderstood . [Scrap]108-scrap , who loved this time of the evening in [[her]108-scrap corner]1589-her corner , felt indignant with [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs who was doing [her]108-scrap out of it , and [she]108-scrap turned [her]108-scrap back on [the garden]507-the garden and [him]72-briggs and went towards [the house]404-the house without a look or a word . But [Briggs]72-briggs , when [he]72-briggs realised [her]108-scrap intention , leapt to [his]72-briggs feet , snatched chairs which were not in [her]108-scrap way out of it , kicked a footstool which was not in [her]108-scrap path on one side , hurried to the door , which stood wide open , in order to hold it open , and followed [her]108-scrap through it , walking by [her]108-scrap side along [the hall]334-the hall . What was to be done with [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs ? Well , it was [[his]72-briggs hall]2253-his hall ; [she]108-scrap could n’t prevent [his]72-briggs walking along [it]2253-his hall . “ [I]72-briggs hope , ”[72-briggs] [he]72-briggs said , not able while walking to take [his]72-briggs eyes off [her]108-scrap , so that [he]72-briggs knocked against several things [he]72-briggs would otherwise have avoided — the corner of a bookcase , an ancient carved cupboard , the table with the flowers on it , shaking the water over—“that [you]108-scrap are quite comfortable [here]2640-here ? If [you]108-scrap ’re not [I’ll]72-briggs — [I’ll]72-briggs flay [them]2981-them alive . ”[72-briggs] [His]72-briggs voice vibrated . What was to be done with [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs ? [She]108-scrap could of course stay in [[her]108-scrap room]718-her room the whole time , say [she]108-scrap was ill , not appear at dinner ; but again , the tyranny of this . . . “ [I]108-scrap ’m very comfortable indeed , ”[108-scrap] said [Scrap]108-scrap . “ If [I]72-briggs had dreamed [you]108-scrap were coming — ”[72-briggs] [he]72-briggs began . “ It ’s [a wonderful old place]2982-a wonderful old place , ”[108-scrap] said [Scrap]108-scrap , doing [her]108-scrap utmost to sound detached and forbidding , but with little hope of success . [The kitchen]2704-the kitchen was on this floor , and passing [its]2704-the kitchen door , which was open a crack , [they]2256-they were observed by [the servants]417-the servants , whose thoughts , communicated to [each other by looks]2258-each other by looks , may be roughly reproduced by such rude symbols as Aha and Oho — symbols which represented and included [their]417-the servants appreciation of the inevitable , [their]417-the servants foreknowledge of the inevitable , and [their]417-the servants complete understanding and approval . “ Are [you]108-scrap going [upstairs]2983-upstairs ? ”[72-briggs] asked [Briggs]72-briggs , as [she]108-scrap paused at the foot of [them]2256-they . “ Yes . ”[72-briggs] “ Which room do [you]108-scrap sit in ? [The drawing - room]1504-the drawing - room , or [the small yellow room]2985-the small yellow room ? ”[108-scrap] “ In [[my]72-briggs own room]2986-my own room . ”[72-briggs] So then [he]72-briggs could n’t go up with [her]108-scrap ; so then all [he]72-briggs could do was to wait till [she]108-scrap came out again . [He]72-briggs longed to ask [her]108-scrap which was [[her]108-scrap own room]1490-her own room — it thrilled [him]72-briggs to hear [her]108-scrap call [any room in [[his]72-briggs house]490-his house [[her]108-scrap own room]1490-her own room]2260-any room in his house her own room — that [he]72-briggs might picture [her]108-scrap in [it]2260-any room in his house her own room . [He]72-briggs longed to know if by any happy chance it was [[his]72-briggs room]2238-his room , for ever after to be filled with [her]108-scrap wonder ; but [he]72-briggs did n’t dare . [He]72-briggs would find that out later from [some one else]358-some one else — [Francesca]99-francesca , [anybody]196-anybody . “ Then [I]196-anybody sha n’t see [you]108-scrap again till dinner ? ”[196-anybody] “ Dinner is at eight , ”[108-scrap] was [Scrap]108-scrap ’s evasive answer as [she]108-scrap went [upstairs]2983-upstairs . [He]72-briggs watched [her]108-scrap go . [She]108-scrap passed [the Madonna]170-the madonna , the portrait of [Rose Arbuthnot]73-rose , and the dark - eyed figure [he]72-briggs had thought so sweet seemed to turn pale , to shrivel into insignificance as [she]108-scrap passed . [She]108-scrap turned the bend of the stairs , and the setting sun , shining through the west window a moment on [her]108-scrap face , turned [her]108-scrap to glory . [She]108-scrap disappeared , and the sun went out too , and the stairs were dark and empty . [He]72-briggs listened till [her]108-scrap footsteps were silent , trying to tell from the sound of the shutting door which [room]2960-room [she]108-scrap had gone into , then wandered aimlessly away through [the hall]334-the hall again , and found [himself]72-briggs back in [the top garden]1084-the top garden . [Scrap]108-scrap from [her]108-scrap window saw [him]72-briggs there . [She]108-scrap saw [Lotty]94-lotty and [Rose]73-rose sitting on the end parapet , where [she]108-scrap would have liked to have been , and [she]108-scrap saw [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins buttonholing [Briggs]72-briggs and evidently telling [him]72-briggs the story of the oleander tree in the middle of [the garden]507-the garden . [Briggs]72-briggs was listening with a patience [she]108-scrap thought rather nice , seeing that it was [his]72-briggs oleander and [[his]72-briggs own father]2271-his own father ’s story . [She]108-scrap knew [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins was telling [him]72-briggs the story by [his]54-mr. wilkins gestures . [Domenico]88-domenico had told it [her]108-scrap soon after [her]108-scrap arrival , and [he]88-domenico had also told [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher , who had told [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins . [Mrs. Fisher]76-mrs. fisher thought highly of this story , and often spoke of it . It was about a cherrywood walking - stick . [[Briggs]72-briggs ’s father]2272-briggs ’s father had thrust this stick into the ground at that spot , and said to [[Domenico]88-domenico ’s father]2273-domenico ’s father , who was then [the gardener]2674-the gardener , “ Here [we]2987-we will have an oleander . ”[88-domenico] And [[Briggs]72-briggs ’s father]2272-briggs ’s father left the stick in the ground as a reminder to [[Domenico]88-domenico ’s father]2273-domenico ’s father , and presently — how long afterwards [nobody]225-nobody remembered — the stick began to sprout , and it was an oleander . There stood [poor Mr. Briggs]72-briggs being told all about it , and listening to the story [he]72-briggs must have known from infancy with patience . Probably [he]72-briggs was thinking of something else . [She]108-scrap was afraid [he]72-briggs was . How unfortunate , how extremely unfortunate , the determination that seized [people]274-people to get hold of and engulf [other people]2614-other people . If only [they]274-people could be induced to stand more on [their]274-people own feet . Why could n’t [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs be more like [Lotty]94-lotty , who never wanted anything of [anybody]196-anybody , but was complete in [herself]94-lotty and respected [other people]2614-other people ’s completeness ? [One]229-one loved being with [Lotty]94-lotty . With [her]94-lotty one was free , and yet befriended . [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs looked so really nice , too . [She]108-scrap thought [she]108-scrap might like [him]72-briggs if only [he]72-briggs would n’t so excessively like [her]108-scrap . [Scrap]108-scrap felt melancholy . Here [she]108-scrap was shut up in [[her]108-scrap bedroom]1056-her bedroom , which was stuffy from the afternoon sun that had been pouring into it , instead of out in [the cool garden]2284-the cool garden , and all because of [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs . Intolerable tyranny , [she]108-scrap thought , flaring up . [She]108-scrap would n’t endure it ; [she]108-scrap would go out all the same ; [she]108-scrap would run [downstairs]1756-downstairs while [Mr. Wilkins]54-mr. wilkins — really [that man]1275-that man was [a treasure]2287-a treasure — held [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs down telling [him]54-mr. wilkins about the oleander , and get out of [the house]404-the house by the front door , and take cover in the shadows of [the zigzag path]825-the zigzag path . [Nobody]225-nobody could see [her]108-scrap [there]207-there ; [nobody]225-nobody would think of looking for [her]108-scrap there . [She]108-scrap snatched up a wrap , for [she]108-scrap did not mean to come back for a long while , perhaps not even to dinner — it would be all [Mr. Briggs]72-briggs ’s fault if [she]108-scrap went dinnerless and hungry — and with another glance out of the window to see if [she]108-scrap were still safe , [she]108-scrap stole out and got away to the sheltering trees of [the zigzag path]825-the zigzag path , and there sat down on one of the seats placed at each bend to assist the upward journey of [those who were breathless]2294-those who were breathless . Ah , this was lovely , thought [Scrap]108-scrap with a sigh of relief . How cool . How good it smelt . [She]108-scrap could see the quiet water of [the little harbour]964-the little harbour through the pine trunks , and the lights coming out in [the houses on the other side]2296-the houses on the other side , and all round [her]108-scrap the green dusk was splashed by the rose - pink of the gladioluses in the grass and the white of the crowding daisies . Ah , this was lovely . So still . Nothing moving — not a leaf , not a stalk . The only sound was a dog barking , far away somewhere up on [the hills]965-the hills , or when the door of [the little restaurant in [the piazza below]1241-the piazza below]2298-the little restaurant in the piazza below was opened and there was a burst of voices , silenced again immediately by the swinging to of the door . [She]108-scrap drew in a deep breath of pleasure . Ah , this was — [Her]108-scrap deep breath was arrested in the middle . What was that ? [She]108-scrap leaned forward listening , [her]108-scrap body tense . Footsteps . On the zigzag path . [Briggs]72-briggs . Finding [her]108-scrap out . Should [she]108-scrap run ? No — the footsteps were coming up , not down . [Some one from [the village]604-the village]2300-some one from the village . Perhaps [Angelo]49-angelo , with provisions . [She]108-scrap relaxed again . But the steps were not the steps of [Angelo]49-angelo , that swift and springy youth ; they were slow and considered , and they kept on pausing . “ [Some one who is n’t used to hills]2988-some one who is n’t used to hills , ”[108-scrap] thought [Scrap]108-scrap . The idea of going back to [the house]404-the house did not occur to [her]108-scrap . [She]108-scrap was afraid of nothing in life except love . [Brigands]2303-brigands or [murderers as such]2304-murderers as such held no terrors for [the daughter of [the Droitwiches]152-the droitwiches]2886-the daughter of the droitwiches ; [she]108-scrap only would have been afraid of [them]2306-them if [they]2306-them left off being [brigands]2303-brigands and [murderers]2308-murderers and began instead to try and make love . The next moment the footsteps turned the corner of [her]108-scrap bit of path , and stood still . “ Getting [his]49-angelo wind , ”[108-scrap] thought [Scrap]108-scrap , not looking round . Then as [he]49-angelo — from the sounds of the steps [she]108-scrap took them to belong to [a man]651-a man — did not move , [she]108-scrap turned [her]108-scrap head , and beheld with astonishment [a person [she]108-scrap had seen a good deal of lately in [London]3-london]2310-a person she had seen a good deal of lately in london , [the well - known writer of amusing memoirs]2311-the well - known writer of amusing memoirs , [Mr. Ferdinand Arundel]172-mr. arundel . [She]108-scrap stared . Nothing in the way of being followed surprised [her]108-scrap any more , but that [he]49-angelo should have discovered where [she]108-scrap was surprised [her]108-scrap . [[Her]108-scrap mother]1020-her mother had promised faithfully to tell [no one]308-no one . “ [You]49-angelo ? ”[108-scrap] [she]108-scrap said , feeling betrayed . “ Here ? ”[108-scrap] [He]49-angelo came up to [her]108-scrap and took off [his]49-angelo hat . [Mr. Arundel]172-mr. arundel had n’t [the figure]2321-the figure for any kind of recklessness . [He]172-mr. arundel had lived too long and too well . [She]108-scrap was sure [he]172-mr. arundel could n’t sing , and would n’t want to . [He]172-mr. arundel must be at least forty . [Scrap]108-scrap , who had become melancholy at the sight of [Briggs]72-briggs , became philosophical at the sight of [Arundel]172-mr. arundel . Here [he]172-mr. arundel was . [She]108-scrap could n’t send [him]172-mr. arundel away till after dinner . [He]172-mr. arundel must be nourished . This being so , [she]108-scrap had better make the best of it , and do that with a good grace which anyhow was n’t to be avoided .
